sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Yawanci marasa lafiya kan haifar da ciwon huhu, raunin huhu mai tsanani, da cutar hanyoyin numfashi mai tsanani (ARDS).
en-mt: Patients commonly develop pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: Lokacin da ARDS ta faru, kumburin da ba a sarrafa shi ba, tara ruwa, da fibrosis mai ci gaba sun lalata mummunar musayar gas sosai.
en-mt: When ARDS occurs, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely impair gas exchange.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: Rashin daidaituwa na nau'in-I da nau'in-II na pneumocytes yana rage matakin surfactant kuma yana kara tashin hankali, ta haka ne rage ikon fadadar huhun da kara hadarin rushewar huhu.
en-mt: The imbalance of type-I and type-II pneumocytes reduces the level of surfactant and increases tension, thereby reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and increasing the risk of lung collapse.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: Sabili da haka, binciken mafi munin hoton zuciya sau da yawa suna kama da mafi girman yanayin cutar.
en-mt: Therefore, the findings of the worst cardiac imaging are often similar to the most severe form of the disease.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: A ranar 18 ga watan Fabrairu, 2020, bincike na farko na COVID-19 ya nuna rashin cancanci na pneumocytes, hyaline membrane, da kuma ƙwayar cuta ta mahaifa, da tantanin halita da yawa na ƙwayoyin cuta a cikin huhun masu cuta wanda ya mutu da cutar, ya yi daidai da yanayin kamuwar cutar makamacin ARDS da marasa lafiyar SARS da MERS.
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, the first analysis of COVID-19 showed the incompetence of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane, and cervical mucus, and many cells of the virus in the lungs of patients who died and the disease, is similar to the ARDS-like disease and SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: Ganowar SARS-CoV-2 RNA ta hanyar juyawar sarkar polymerase wato (reverse-transcriptase) (RT-PCR) anyi amfani da shi azaman manyan ka'idojin gwajin cutar COVID-19.
en-mt: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA by reverse-transcriptase (RT-PCR) is used as the main diagnostic criteria for COVID-19.

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: Duk da haka, saboda kiyatsa girman babu-rashi, wanda zai iya hanzartawar annoban, an fara amfani da alamun bayyanar asibiti don ganewar asali (wanda bai dogara ga RT-PCR ba) kadai ba a kasar Sin a ranar 13 ga Fabrairu, 2020.
en-mt: However, due to the estimated size of the absence, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical symptoms for diagnosis (not based on RT-PCR) alone began to be used in China on February 13, 2020.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: Hakanan irin wannan yanayin ya faru tare da bayyanar cutar SARS.
en-mt: A similar situation occurred with the emergence of the SARS virus.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: Sabili da haka, haɗuwa da tarihin cutar, bayyanar asibiti, dakin gwaji da kuma binciken radiyo yana da mahimmanci kuma wajibi ne don yin ingantaccen bincike.
en-mt: Therefore, the combination of the history of the disease, the clinical presentation, the laboratory and the radiological examination is important and necessary to make a correct diagnosis.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: A ranar 14 ga Fabrairu, 2020, kungiyar Feng Zhang ta ba da bayanin wata hanyar yin amfani da fasahar SHERLOCK ta CRISPR don gano SARS-CoV-2, wanda ke gano ƙwayoyin SARS-CoV-2 RNA roba a 20 × 10-18 mol / L zuwa 200 × 10-18 mol / L (10-100 kwafa ta microliter na shigar) ta amfani da dipstick a cikin ƙasa da awa ɗaya ba tare da buƙatar bayyanin kayan aikin ba.
en-mt: On February 14, 2020, Feng Zhang's group reported a method using SHERLOCK's CRISPR technology to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects SARS-CoV-2 synthetic RNA at 20 × 10-18 mol / L to 200 × 10-18 mol / L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without the need for equipment.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: Da fatan, sabuwar dabarar za ta iya bunkasa hankali da kwanciyar hankali matukar an tabbatar cikin samfuran asibiti.
en-mt: Hopefully, the new technique can improve sensitivity and stability as long as it is confirmed in clinical samples.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: Saboda ƙarancin ƙwarewa tare da sabon labari na CoV, likitoci na iya samar da kulawa ta musamman ga marasa lafiyar COVID-19, yayin da ake ƙoƙarin hanyoyin jiyya da dama waɗanda aka yi amfani da su ko aka gabatar dasu don jiyyar wasu CoV kamar SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV da sauran cututtukan (Tebur 2).2).
en-mt: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, doctors can provide special care for patients with COVID-19, while trying several treatment methods that have been used or proposed for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS- CoV and MERS-CoV and other diseases (Table 2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: Wadannan hanyoyin jinya na yanzu da kuma yiwuwar jiyya tare da magungunan rigakafi, da immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma daga majinyatan da suka sami sauki, magungunan Sinawa, da tallafin tunani.
en-mt: These current treatments and possible treatments include antibiotics, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: Ko da plasma daga majinyatan da sun samu sauki an gabatar dasu ne domin ayi amfani dasu don jiyya.
en-mt: Even plasma from patients who have recovered has been submitted to be used for treatment.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: Kamfanonin magunguna suna yin tsere don haɓaka ƙwayoyin garkuwa da alluran rigakafin kan kwayar cutan.
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 suna kai hari sosai a huhu a farawa kuma mai yiwuwa kuma suna kaiwa hari, zuwa ƙarancin ƙima, sauran gabobin da ke bayyana ACE2, kamar tsarin gastrointestinal da kodan.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 primarily attacks the lungs and probably also attacks, to a lesser extent, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: Duk da haka, lalatawar hanyar numfashi da gazawa sune babbar haɗari ga marasa lafiya da babban dalilin mutuwa.
en-mt: However, respiratory compromise and failure are the biggest risk to patients and the leading cause of death.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: Saboda haka, tallafawar hanya numfashi yana da mahimmanci don sauƙaƙe bayyanar cututtuka da kuma ceton rayuka kuma ya haɗa duk jiyya ta iska, iska mai saurin motsawa, samun iska daga na’ura, ya danganta ga tsananin cutar.
en-mt: Therefore, respiratory support is important to ease symptoms and save lives and includes all air treatments, ventilators, ventilators, depending on the severity of the disease.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: Marasa lafiya da bayyanar cutar hanyoyin numfashi mai tsanani dole ne a tallafa su da karin isaka (ECMO), wani ingantaccen dabarar bugun zuciya wanda aka yi amfani dashi don maganin cututtukan zuciya masu haɗari ko gazawar hanyoyin numfashi.
en-mt: Patients with severe respiratory disease must be supported with ECMO, an effective cardiopulmonary resuscitation technique used to treat severe heart disease or respiratory failure.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: Bugu da kari, da daidaitawar ma'aunin electrolyte, rigakafin da lura da kamuwa da cuta da sakin jiki, da kuma kariya daga ayyukan gabobin jiki ma suna da matukar muhimmanci ga marasa lafiya na SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: In addition, the regulation of electrolyte balance, the prevention and monitoring of infection and release, and the protection of organ functions are also very important for patients with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: An san cewa guguwar cytokine tana faruwa ne sakamakon wuce gona da iri na tsarin rigakafi a cikin marasa lafiyar SARS da MERS.
en-mt: Cytokine storms are known to occur as a result of an overactive immune system in SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: Guguwar Cytokine wani nau'i ne na yanayi amsar tsarin kumburi wanda aka gabatar ta hanyar jerin cytokines da suka hada da TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, da MCP-1.
en-mt: Cytokine storm is a type of natural response to the inflammatory process that is presented by a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: Waɗannan cytokines tare da tantanin halita mai garkuwa su saki ɗimbin kwayoyi mara canzawa waɗanda sune babban dalilin ARDS da kuma gazawar gabobin jiki da yawa.
en-mt: These cytokines together with immune cells release large amounts of unchanged drugs that are a major cause of ARDS and multi-organ failure.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: Danna rigakafi yana da muhimmanci a lura da guguwar cytokine, musamman a cikin majinyata masu rauni sosai.
en-mt: Immune suppression is important to monitor the cytokine storm, especially in critically ill patients.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: Corticosteroids da tocilizumab, anti-IL6 monoclonal garkuwar jiki, an yi amfani dasu don magance guguwar cytokine.
en-mt: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat the cytokine storm.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: Sauran jiyya danna rigakafi don guguwa ta cytokine sun hada da daidaitawa da amsawa kai tsaye na rigakafin tantanin halita T; toshewar IFN-γ, IL-1, da TNF; JAK hanawa; blinatumomab; mai danna alamar cytokine 4; da HDAC masu hanawa.
en-mt: Other immunosuppressant treatments for cytokine storms include modulation of the T cell immune response; blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; cytokine suppressor 4; and HDAC inhibitors.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Maganin Steroids, kamar immunosuppressants, aka yi amfani da su sosai a cikin lura da SARS don rage tsananin lalacewa kumburi.
en-mt: Steroids, such as immunosuppressants, are widely used in monitoring SARS to reduce the severity of inflammation.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Duk da haka, shan steroids sosai ba su da fa'ida ga mummunan raunin huhu a cikin marasa lafiyar SARS da COVID-19.
en-mt: However, high doses of steroids are not beneficial for acute lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: Madadin haka, suna iya haifar da mummunar illa, musamman cututtukan osteonecrosis, da ke haifar da tasirin cutar.
en-mt: Instead, they can cause serious side effects, especially osteonecrosis, which causes the effects of the disease.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Kodayake, gajerun darussan na corticosteroids a ƙarancin-zuwa-matsakaitan allurai an bada shawarar ayi amfani dasu da hankali don marasa lafiya COVID-19 marasa lafiya.
en-mt: However, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses are recommended to be used with caution for non-infected COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: A lokacin rubutu, babu ingantaccen maganin rigakafi da aka tabbatar.
en-mt: At the time of writing, there is no effective vaccine proven.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: Duk da haka, badawa ta jijiya da remdesivir, wani nucleotide na analog, ana samun inganci a cikin marasa lafiyar COVID-19 na Amurka.
en-mt: However, intravenous administration of remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been shown to be effective in US COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: Remdesivir wata sabon maganin rigakafin ƙwayoyin cuta ne wanda Gidiyon ta kirkiro da farko don jiyyar cututtukan da cutar Ebola da Marlburg suka haifar.
en-mt: Remdesivir is a new antiviral drug originally developed by Gideon to treat the Ebola and Marlburg virus infections.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: Daga baya, sakatariya ya kuma nuna yiwuwar hana sauran kwayoyin cutar RNA guda da suka hada da kwayoyin cututtukar MERS da SARS.
en-mt: Later, the secretariat also showed the possibility of inhibiting other RNA viruses, including MERS and SARS.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: Dangane da waɗannan, Gidiyon ya ba wa mahaɗin zuwa China don gudanar da gwaji guda biyu a kan mutane masu kamuwa da cutar SARS-CoV-2, kuma ana sa ran samun sakamako sosai.
en-mt: Based on these, Gideon gave the link to China to conduct two tests on people infected with SARS-CoV-2, and the results are expected to be very good.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, an ba da shawarar baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, da ribavirin a matsayin hanyoyin kwantar da hankalin marasa lafiya wanda ke da cutar hanyoyin numfashi mai tsanani.
en-mt: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been recommended as therapies for patients with severe respiratory disease.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: Zawo, tashin zuciya, amai, lalacewar hanta, da sauran raunin azaba na iya faruwa bayan an haɗawar jinyar tare da lofinavir/ritonavir.
en-mt: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other side effects may occur after combination therapy with lofinavir/ritonavir.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: Hulɗawar waɗannan jiyya tare da wasu magunguna da aka yi amfani da su a cikin marasa lafiya ya kamata a sa ido sosai.
en-mt: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in patients should be closely monitored.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: Plasma daga marasa lafiya da suka samu sauki da garkuwar jiki.
en-mt: Plasma from immunocompromised patients.

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: Tarin jini daga marasa lafiyar da suka murmure daga wata cuta mai yaduwa don yi wa wasu marasa lafiya da ke fama da wannan cuta ko kuma kare lafiyar mutane daga kamuwa da cutar yana da dogon tarihi.
en-mt: Collecting blood from patients who have recovered from an infectious disease to donate to other patients suffering from this disease or to protect people from infection has a long history.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: Tabbas, mara lafiyar da aka dawo dasu galibi suna da babban matakin kariya daga kwayar cuta a cikin jinin su.
en-mt: Indeed, recovered patients often have a high level of immunity from the virus in their blood.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: Garkuwar jiki sune rigakafi immunoglobulin (Ig) wanda aka samar daga B lymphocytes don yaƙar ƙwayoyin cuta da sauran abubuwa na ƙasashen waje kuma suna sane da kwayoyi na musamman a cikin cututtukan da ke cikin su.
en-mt: Immunoglobulin (Ig) antibodies are produced by B lymphocytes to fight viruses and other foreign substances and are aware of special drugs in the diseases that are in them.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: Dangane da wannan, an karɓo plasma daga jinin gungun masu haƙuri waɗanda suka warke daga COVID-19 kuma an saka shi cikin marasa lafiya 10 mara lafiya sosai.
en-mt: Accordingly, plasma was taken from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 very sick patients.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: Alamar cutar su ta inganta cikin sa'o'i 24, tare da rage kumburi da rahusa da kuma inganta jijiyar oxygen a cikin jini.
en-mt: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, with reduced inflammation and improved blood oxygenation.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: Duk da haka, tabbatarwa da bayani wajibi ne don gabatar da hanyar don babban amfani kafin takamaiman hanyoyin kwantar da hankali ba su inganta ba.
en-mt: However, confirmation and explanation are necessary to present the method for general use before specific therapies are not improved.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: Bugu da kari, da aka ba da tasirin warkewa, za a yi la’akari da wasu kasala da ke da alaƙa da plasma a hankali.
en-mt: In addition, given the therapeutic effect, some plasma-related disorders will be considered carefully.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: Alal misali, cututtukan rigakafi na iya wuce gona da iri kan hanyar kariya kuma suna haifar da sakin alamar alcytokine, wanda ke iya zama haɗarin rayuwa.
en-mt: For example, immune diseases can overwhelm the immune system and cause the release of alcytokine signaling, which can be life-threatening.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: Taruwar garkuwar jiki cikin jini yawancin lokuta na ƙadan, kuma buƙatun plasma yana da yawa don kula da marasa lafiya da ke fama da rashin lafiya.
en-mt: The accumulation of antibodies in the blood is often small, and the demand for plasma is high to treat sick patients.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: Yana da wuya a haɓaka da samar da takamaiman ƙwayoyin rigakafi cikin hanzari don yaƙi da annobar duniya.
en-mt: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies quickly to fight global epidemics.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: Don haka, abu mafi mahimmanci ne kuma mai kyawu ne a kebe tantanin halittar jikin B (B cells) daga marassa lafiyar da suka warke kuma gano lambobin kwayar halitta wadanda ke hade da ingantattun garkuwar jiki ko duba garkuwa musamman a kan muhimman furotin na kwayan cutar.
en-mt: Therefore, it is very important and desirable to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the cell numbers that are associated with improved immunity or to look specifically at the important proteins of the virus. .

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: Ta wannan hanyar, zamu iya haɓaka samar da magungunan garkuwar jiki.
en-mt: In this way, we can increase the production of immune drugs.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: An yi amfani da TCM don magance wasu cututtuka da yawa a kasar Sin har tsawon dubunnan shekaru.
en-mt: TCM has been used to treat many diseases in China for thousands of years.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: Duk da haka, tasirin sa ya dogara ne akan haɗakar abubuwan haɗin da yawa a cikin tsari wanda ya bambanta dangane da binciken cutar da aka yi la'akari da tunanin TCM.
en-mt: However, its effectiveness is based on the combination of many ingredients in a process that varies depending on the diagnosis of the disease considered in TCM.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: Yawancin ingantattun abubuwanda ake aiki dasu ba'a san su ba ko kuma marasa fahimta ne saboda yana da wahalar cirewa da tabbatar da irin waɗannan abubuwan haɗin ko abubuwan haɗin su.
en-mt: Many of the active ingredients are unknown or poorly understood because it is difficult to extract and verify such ingredients or their ingredients.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: A halin yanzu, saboda rashin inganci da takamaiman jiyyar COVID-19, TCM ya zama ɗayan daga cikin hanyoyin jiyyan marasa lafiya tare da haske zuwa alamu na matsakaicin alama ko ga waɗanda suka warke daga matsanancin matakai.
en-mt: Currently, due to the ineffective and specific treatment of COVID-19, TCM has become one of the treatment methods for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Alal misali, maganin kawan Shu Feng Jie Du da maganin kawan Lian Hua Qing Wen an samu sun dace don jinyar COVID-19.
en-mt: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du's medicine and Lian Hua Qing Wen's medicine have been found to be effective in treating COVID-19.

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: Babban warkarwa marasa lafiyar COVID-19 a cikin larduna da yawa na kasar Sin wadanda ke amfani da TCM a cikin kashi 87% bisa dari na marasa lafiyar su, ciki har da Gansu kashi (63.7%), Ningxia kashi (50%), da Hunan kashi (50%), yayin da lardin Hubei, wanda ya yi amfani da TCM a kusan kashi 30% na masu cutar COVID-19, suna da mafi ƙarancin warkewa kashi (13%).
en-mt: Major cures for COVID-19 patients in many provinces of China that use TCM in 87% percent of their patients, including Gansu percent (63.7%), Ningxia percent (50%), and Hunan percent (50%), while Hubei province, which used TCM in about 30% of the patients with COVID-19, had the lowest cure rate (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: Duk da haka, wannan ya zama kwatanci mara kyau kamar yadda sauran dalilai masu tasiri kamar lamba da tsananin marasa lafiya yakamata a saka su cikin kimantawa.
en-mt: However, this is a poor comparison as other influencing factors such as the number and severity of patients should be included in the evaluation.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: A ranar 18 ga watan Fabrairu, 2020, Boli Zhang da abokan aikin ta sun buga wani bincike don kwatanta magani na yamma (WM) jinyar shi kaɗai tare da haɗin maganin WM da TCM.
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and her colleagues published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with a combination of WM treatment and TCM.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: Sun gano cewa lokutan da ake buƙata don murmurewar yanayin jiki, ɓarnawar alama, da kuma asibiti mafi ƙaranci a cikin rukunin WM + TCM fiye da ƙungiyar cikin WM ƙungiyar kawai.
en-mt: They found that the times required for physical recovery, symptom resolution, and hospitalization were shorter in the WM + TCM group than in the WM only group.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: Mafi ban sha'awa, rauni da yake ƙaruwa da cuta (daga haske zuwa mai tsanani) ya kasance ƙarancin ƙungiyar WM + TCM fiye da na ƙungiyar WM kawai kashi (7.4% kusa da 46.2%) kuma yawan mutuwa ya kasance ƙasa a cikin rukunin WM + TCM fiye da WM kawai rukuni kashi (8.8% a kan 39%).
en-mt: More interestingly, the severity of the disease (from light to severe) was lower in the WM + TCM group than in the WM only group (7.4% compared to 46.2%) and the death rate was lower in the group WM + TCM more than WM only group percentage (8.8% against 39%).

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: Koyaya, inganci da lafiyar TCM har yanzu suna jiran ƙarin gwaji da aka sarrafa sosai a sikeli mafi girma da kuma a cikin ƙarin cibiyoyin.
en-mt: However, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await further well-controlled trials on a larger scale and in more institutions.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: Hakanan zai zama mai ban sha'awa don sanin yanayin ayyukan da bayyana ingantattun kayan aikin jiyya na TCM ko haɗinsu idan zai yiwu.
en-mt: It would also be interesting to know the nature of the activities and describe the effective treatment tools of TCM or their combinations if possible.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: Marasa lafiya da ake zargi ko aka tabbatar da COVID-19 yawan lokuta suna fuskantar babbar fargaba game da cutar mai yaduwa har ma da kisa, kuma mutanen da ke keɓewa kuma suna fuskantar bacin rai, kadaici, da fushi.
en-mt: Suspected or confirmed COVID-19 patients often face great fear of the disease being contagious and even fatal, and people in isolation also experience depression, loneliness, and anger.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: Bayan haka, alamomin kamuwa da cuta kamar zazzabin, cututtukan rashin iska, da tari kazalika da illa dabam-dabam na jinyar kamar cutar rashin bacci wanda corticosteroids ke hadasa na iya haifar da ƙarin damuwa da damuwa ta hankali.
en-mt: In addition, symptoms of infection such as fever, shortness of breath, and cough as well as various side effects of treatment such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can cause more stress and psychological distress.

sourceString: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
targetString: A farkon barkewar cutar ta SARS, an sami dumbin cututtukan kwakwalwa da suka hada da ci gaba da damuwa, damuwa, fargaba, tashin hankali, alamomin tabin hankali, tashin hankali, har ma da kashe kansa.
en-mt: At the beginning of the SARS outbreak, there were many mental illnesses including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychotic symptoms, violence, and even suicide.

sourceString: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
targetString: M lamba tuntuɓe da keɓe masu ciwo, a matsayin wani ɓangare na martanin lafiyar jama'a game da yaduwar COVID-19, zai iya sa mutane su zama masu yawan damuwa da masu laifi game da sakamakon yaduwar, keɓewa, da ki kan iyali da abokai.
en-mt: The high number of contacts and isolation of the sick, as part of the public health response to the spread of COVID-19, can make people feel anxious and guilty about the consequences of the spread, isolation, and rejection on family and friends. .

sourceString: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
targetString: Don haka, ya kamata a ba da kulawa ta lafiyar kwakwalwa ga marasa lafiya na COVID-19, waɗanda ake zargi, da mutanen da ke hulɗa da su da kuma sauran jama'a waɗanda ke da buƙata.
en-mt: Therefore, mental health care should be provided to patients with COVID-19, suspects, people who come in contact with them and other people who need it.

sourceString: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
targetString: Taimakon tunani ya kamata ya haɗa da kafa ƙungiyoyin kiwon lafiyar masu tunani iri-iri, bayyanannun sadarwa tare da sabuntawa na yau da kullun game da fitowar SARS-CoV-2 da tsare-tsaren kulawa da kuma amfani da na'urorin lantarki da aikace-aikace don guje wa kusanci da juna.
en-mt: Psychological support should include the establishment of multi-disciplinary health teams, clear communication with regular updates on the outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 and treatment plans and the use of electronic devices and applications. practice to avoid close contact with each other.

sourceString: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
targetString: Magungunan rigakafi suna da mahimmanci don katse hanyoyin yadawa daga jikin dabbobi da kuma kamuwar mutane zuwa masu bada cutar a saukake kuma galibi suna taimakawa ga maganin jinyar garkuwar kwayoyin cuta don magancewar anoba wanda ƙwayoyin cuta masu tasowa ke haifar.
en-mt: Antibiotics are important to stop the transmission from animals and humans to easy transmission of the disease and are often adjuncts to antibiotic therapy for the treatment of anoeba caused by emerging bacteria.

sourceString: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
targetString: An yi ƙoƙari don haɓaka alluran rigakafin mai-furotin S don samar da magungunan rigakafi na dogon lokaci da kuma watsewar garkuwa jiki da/ko kariya daga garkuwar kariya daga cutar SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Efforts have been made to develop S-protein vaccines to provide long-term immunosuppression and immune suppression and/or immune protection against SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
targetString: An kimanta allurar rigakafi masu rai cikin samfurin dabbobi SARS.
en-mt: Live vaccines have been evaluated in animal models of SARS.

sourceString: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
targetString: Koyaya, ingancin waɗannan maganin alurar rigakafi a cikin tsofaffi mutane da samfuran ƙarancin cuta da kariyarsu game da kamuwa da cutar ƙwayar cutar zoonotic har yanzu ba a ƙaddara su ba kafin fara nazarin asibiti.
en-mt: However, the effectiveness of these vaccines in elderly people and models of low disease and their protection against zoonotic disease has not yet been determined before starting clinical studies.

sourceString: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
targetString: Wataƙila saboda SARS ya mutu ƙasa 17 da suka wuce kuma ba a sake samun wani sabon mai kamuwa ba.
en-mt: Probably because SARS died 17 years ago and there are no new infections.

sourceString: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
targetString: A hanya daban, lamari masu lalacewa da kuma gungu na MERS suna ci gaba da faruwa a Gabas ta Tsakiya kuma suka watsu zuwa wasu yankuna sakamakon dorewar hanyoyin zoonotic a cikin wurare masu cutarwa.
en-mt: On the other hand, devastating cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions as a result of sustained zoonotic pathways in endemic areas.

sourceString: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
targetString: An tsara dabarun yin rigakafi don MERS ta amfani da ƙwayar cuta mara ƙarfi, abubuwan plasmids na DNA, ƙwayoyin cuta na viral, abubuwan nanoparticles, kamar-ƙwayoyin cuta barbashi da ƙananan abubuwan gina jiki da aka kimanta su kuma a wasu samfuran dabbobi.
en-mt: Immunization strategies for MERS have been developed using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral particles, nanoparticles, bacteria-like particles and small proteins and have been evaluated in other animal models.

sourceString: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
targetString: Haɓaka ingantaccen maganin rigakafi daga SARS-CoV-2 ga mutane marasa garkuwa abu ne mai gaggawa da mahimmanci don magance annoba da ke ci gaba.
en-mt: The development of an effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for immunocompromised individuals is urgent and important to combat the ongoing epidemic.

sourceString: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
targetString: Duk da haka, yana da ƙalubale don shawo kan wahalar saboda tsawon lokaci (aƙalla watanni 18) da ake buƙata don haɓaka maganin alurar rigakafi da bambancin canji na CoVs.
en-mt: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty due to the long time (at least 18 months) needed to develop a vaccine and the variability of CoVs.

sourceString: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
targetString: A matsayin sabon cuta, COVID-19 ya fara bayyana cikakkiya a matsayin ciwon asibiti ta wurin dubban masu kamuwa da cutar.
en-mt: As a new disease, COVID-19 has started to manifest itself as a clinical illness with thousands of infected people.

sourceString: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
targetString: A mafi yawacin alamari, marasa lafiya na iya murmurewa a hankali ba tare da sequelae ba.
en-mt: In most cases, patients can recover slowly without sequelae.

sourceString: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
targetString: Duk da haka, mai kama da SARS da MERS, COVID-19 shima yana da alaƙa da mutuwa sosai a cikin marasa lafiya da suke da tsananin lamarin cutan.
en-mt: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high mortality in patients with severe cases of the disease.

sourceString: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
targetString: Don haka, kirkirar tsarin tsinkaye game da cutar yana da mahimmanci ga hukumomin kiwon lafiya don ba da fifikon ayyukanta, musamman a wuraren da ake wahalar samar da albarkatu.
en-mt: Therefore, the creation of a system for predicting the disease is important for health authorities to prioritize its activities, especially in areas where it is difficult to provide resources.

sourceString: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
targetString: Dangane da binciken asibiti wanda aka ruwaito har zuwa yanzu, abubuwan da ke ƙasa na iya shafar ko kuma za a iya danganta su da haɓakar marasa lafiya na COVID-19 (Tebur (Tebur33)):
en-mt: Based on the clinical studies reported so far, the following factors may affect or may be associated with the development of patients with COVID-19 (Table (Table33)):

sourceString: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
targetString: Shekaru: Shekaru shine mafi mahimmancin hangen nesa na SARS, wanda gaskiya ne ga COVID-19.
en-mt: Age: Age is the most important predictor of SARS, which is true for COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
targetString: COVID-19 ya faru ne sosai a cikin shekaru 30-65 tare da kashi 47.7% na waɗannan marasa lafiya sun fi 50 a cikin nazarin lamarin cutar 8,866 kamar yadda aka bayyana a sama.
en-mt: COVID-19 occurred more in the 30-65 age group with 47.7% of these patients being over 50 in the study of 8,866 cases as described above.

sourceString: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Marasa lafiya waɗanda ke buƙatar tsananin kulawa sun fi iya samun wasu cututtuka na lokaci daya da rikitarwa kuma sun fi tsufa da waɗanda ba suyi (a cikin shekarun tsakiya na 66 da 51), suna ba da shawara ga shekarun a matsayin hangar zuwan cutar don sakamakon marasa lafiya na COVID-19.
en-mt: Patients who require intensive care are more likely to have co-morbidities and complications and are older than those who do not (with a median age of 66 and 51), suggesting age as a predictor of outcomes. COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
targetString: Jima'i: SARS-CoV-2 ya fi kama maza fiye da mata (0.31 / 100,000 a kan 0.27 / 100,000), kamar yadda aka bayyana a sama.
en-mt: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 affects men more than women (0.31 / 100,000 against 0.27 / 100,000), as described above.

sourceString: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
targetString: Rashin daidaituwa da wahala: Marasa lafiya tare da COVID-19 waɗanda ke buƙatar kulawa mai zurfi sun fi fuskantar wahala ga mummunan rauni na zuciya da arrhythmia.
en-mt: Irregularity and difficulty: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more prone to serious heart failure and arrhythmia.

sourceString: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
targetString: Aukuwar ciwon zuciya shima babban dalilin mutuwa a cikin masu cutar SARS.
en-mt: Cardiovascular disease is also the leading cause of death in SARS patients.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: An ba da rahoton cewa SARS-CoV-2 na iya ɗaure zuwa ACL2-tabbatacce cholangiocytes, wanda zai haifar da rashin aikin hanta a cikin marasa lafiyar COVID-19.
en-mt: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can bind to ACL2-positive cholangiocytes, which will cause liver dysfunction in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
targetString: Yana da mahimmanci a lura cewa shekaru da cutar na da dangantaka sosai kuma suna iya tsoma baki ga juna.
en-mt: It is important to note that age and disease are closely related and can interfere with each other.

sourceString: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
targetString: Binciken dakin gwaji wanda ba a hanya ba ne: C-reactive protein (CRP) mataki a jini yana nuna tsananin zafin kumburi ko raunin nama kuma an gabatar da shi don zama mai yuwuwar asarar cutar, amsar jin magani, da murmurewa ta ƙarshe.
en-mt: Laboratory research that is not in the way: C-reactive protein (CRP) level in the blood shows the severity of inflammation or tissue damage and has been proposed to be a possible loss of the disease, the response to treatment, and the final recovery.

sourceString: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
targetString: Hulɗawar matakin CRP zuwa ga tsananin da kuma hangar zuwan cutar COVID-19 shi ma an shawarta.
en-mt: The relationship of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been suggested.

sourceString: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, ɗaukaka lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), da creatine kinase (CK) zasu iya taimakawa hango ko hasashen sakamakon.
en-mt: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) can help predict the outcome.

sourceString: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
targetString: Ana nuna waɗannan ƙwayoyin enzyme a cikin gabobin da yawa, musamman a zuciya da hanta, kuma ana sake su yayin lalata nama.
en-mt: These enzymes are expressed in many organs, especially the heart and liver, and are released during tissue breakdown.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: Don haka, su masun makin gargajiyar zuciya ko rashin aikin hanta da kyau.
en-mt: Therefore, those who have a good heart or liver function score.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: Manyan alamun cututtukan asibiti: Hoto zuciya da ci gaban wucin gadin alamun asibiti na bayyanar cututtuka ya kamata a bincika tare da sauran maganganun don annabta sakamako da rikitarwar COVID-19.
en-mt: Major clinical signs: Cardiac imaging and the temporal development of clinical signs of symptoms should be analyzed together with other indicators to predict the outcome and complications of COVID-19.

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Amfani da magungunan steroid: Kamar yadda aka bayyana a sama, steroids immunosuppressant ne da aka saba amfani da shi azaman hanyar haɗin kan jinyar cututtuka don rage tsananin lalacewa kumburi.
en-mt: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are an immunosuppressant that is commonly used as an adjunctive therapy to reduce the severity of inflammation.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: Tunda yawan magungunan corticosteroids an yi amfani dashi sosai a cikin majinyata na SARS, da yawa daga waɗanda suka tsira suka sha wahala daga cututtukan osteonecrosis tare da nakasassu na rayuwa da ƙarancin rayuwa.
en-mt: Since many corticosteroids have been used extensively in SARS patients, many of the survivors have suffered from osteonecrosis with life disabilities and low life expectancy.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Don haka, idan ana buƙata, ya kamata a yi amfani da steroids don sha kadan kuma don ɗan gajeren lokaci a cikin marasa lafiya na COVID-19.
en-mt: Therefore, if needed, steroids should be used in small doses and for a short period of time in patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: Tabin hankali: Kamar yadda aka bayyana a sama, lokacin barkewar COVID-19 yawancin marasa lafiya suna shan wahala daga matsananciyar damuwa yayin da suke jure tsawon lokaci na keɓancewa da matsanancin rashin tabbas kuma suna ganin mutuwar dangi da kuma abokan rashin lafiyar.
en-mt: Mental illness: As explained above, during the outbreak of COVID-19 many patients suffer from severe stress as they endure long periods of isolation and extreme uncertainty and witness the death of family members and friends of the disease.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: Yana da mahimmanci a samar da shawarwari na tunani da tallafi na dogon lokaci don taimakawa waɗannan marasa lafiya su murmure daga damuwa kuma su koma rayuwan da aka saba yi.
en-mt: It is important to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from stress and return to a normal life.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: Dangane da binciken alƙalumma har ya zuwa yanzu, da alamar COVID-19 na da fasalin cututtukan annoba daban-daban daga SARS.
en-mt: Based on the demographic studies so far, the symptoms of COVID-19 have different epidemic features from SARS.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: Bugu da kari ga maimaitawa cikin hanyar numfashi na kasa, SARS-CoV-2 na iya rabuwa sosai a cikin hanyar numfashi na sama kuma ya haifar da karama ko babu nuna alamun farkon kamuwa da cutar, mai kama da sauran CoVs waɗanda ke haifar da mura na yau da kullun.
en-mt: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can be highly isolated in the upper respiratory tract and cause little or no early symptoms of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause influenza. everyday.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: Sabili da haka, marasa lafiya masu kamuwa da cuta a farkon lokaci ko lokacin shiryawa na iya samar da adadin ƙwayar cuta lokacin ayyukan yau da kullun, yana haifar da babban wahala don magance annobar.
en-mt: Therefore, patients infected with the virus in the early stages or during the incubation period can produce a large amount of the virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty in treating the epidemic.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: Duk da haka, an dauke watsar da SARS-CoV na faru lokacin da marasa lafiya ke fama da rashin lafiya, yayin da yawancin watsawa basu faru ba a farkon lokaci.
en-mt: However, transmission of SARS-CoV is considered to occur when patients are ill, while most transmissions do not occur in the early stages.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: Don haka, barkewar COVID-19 na yanzu ya fi tsanani da wahala wajen sarrafawa fiye da barkewar SARS.
en-mt: Therefore, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: A yanzu haka ana ci gaba da yin kokari sosai a kasar Sin ciki har da kullewar Wuhan da biranen da ke kewayen ta da ci gaba da keɓaɓɓen jama'ar gaba ɗaya cikin fatan kawo ƙarshen yadawa kwayar cutar SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Currently, efforts are being made in China, including the lockdown of Wuhan and its surrounding cities and the continued isolation of the entire population in the hope of ending the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: Duk da cewa wadannan ayyukan sun lalata tattalin arzikin kasar da sauran bangarorin kasar, adadin sabbin masu cutar yana raguwa, yana nuna raguwar barkewar cutar.
en-mt: Although these activities have damaged the country's economy and other parts of the country, the number of new cases is decreasing, indicating a decrease in the outbreak.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: Kyakkyawan tsammanin shine barkewar zata ƙare a watan Maris kuma yanayin saukar ruwan zaiyi tsawon watanni 3-4.
en-mt: The best expectation is that the outbreak will end in March and the water level will last 3-4 months.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: Duk da haka, wasu masana ba su da bege ba.
en-mt: However, some experts are not pessimistic.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: Paul Hunter, et al., Ya kiyasta cewa COVID-19, wanda alama yafi kamuwa da cutar fiye da SARS, ba zai ƙare a cikin 2020 ba.
en-mt: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems to be more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: Ira Longini, et al., Sun kirkiro wani abin ƙira don ƙaddara game da sakamakon annobar kuma ya ba da shawarar SARS-CoV-2 na iya kamuwa da kashi biyu bisa uku na yawan jama'ar duniya.
en-mt: Ira Longini, et al., developed a model to determine the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two thirds of the world's population.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: Wata Kungiya daga Kanada ta ba da rahoton cewa an gano SARS-CoV-2 a cikin tsakiyar turbinate da makogwaron majinyacin da suka murmure kuma suka bar asibiti makonni 2 da suka gabata, wanda ke nuna cewa sabon kwayar cutar da ke nuna za ta iya zama wani abu mai kama da cutar mai kama da mura.
en-mt: A group from Canada reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in the middle turbinate and throat of a patient who had recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks ago, indicating that the new virus may be something similar to a flu-like illness.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: Duk da haka, alamu suka bada alama sun faru a kasar Sin bisa la'akari da raguwar sabbin lamurra cutan, wanda ke nuna dabarun da yanzu ke iya aiki.
en-mt: However, there are signs that it has happened in China based on the decrease in new cases of the disease, which shows that the strategy is now working.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: An riga an annabta cuta ta Ebola wanda zai iya haifar da lamarin cutar miliyan guda tare da mutuwa rabin miliyan.
en-mt: Ebola has already been predicted to cause one million cases and half a million deaths.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
targetString: Duk da haka, ta hanyar keɓancewa da warewa, cutar ta ƙare a ƙarshe.
en-mt: However, through isolation and isolation, the disease eventually ends.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
targetString: Mai yiyuwa ne, mai kama da SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 na iya zama da rauni a cikin cuta kuma a ƙarshe ya mutu ko kuma ya zama ƙasa da kwayar cutar tare da mutane.
en-mt: It is possible that, similar to SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 may be weak in disease and eventually die or become less virulent with humans.

sourceString: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
targetString: Ana ba da kwatancin annobar COVID-19 tare da na SARS da MERS yadda aka bada a ƙasa (Fig. (Fig. 55).
en-mt: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is given below (Fig. (Fig. 55).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: Ana yada SARS-CoV-2 sosai ta hanyar tari ko atishawa, kuma na yiwu kuma ta hanyar saduwa kai tsaye da kayan da kwayar cutar ta gurbata.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is widely spread through coughing or sneezing, and possibly through direct contact with contaminated material.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
targetString: An kuma gano kwayar cutar a cikin kashi, wanda ke haifar da sabon yiwuwar yaduwar cutan daga kashi-zuwa-baki.
en-mt: The virus has also been found in bone, which creates a new possibility of bone-to-mouth transmission.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: Wani binciken da aka yi kwana nan a kan lamarin masu kamuwa da cutan guda 138 ya ba da rahoton cewa kashi 41% daga cikin waɗannan cututtukan sun yiwu ne ta hanyar kamuwar nosocomial, ciki har da marasa lafiya 17 da wasu cututtukan baya da ma'aikacin kiwon lafiya guda 40.
en-mt: A recent study on the case of 138 infections reported that 41% of these infections were possible through nosocomial infection, including 17 patients with other diseases and the worker 40 health care.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: Don haka, ya kamata a yi amfani da babbar kariya don kare mutane, musamman ma’aikacin kiwon lafiya, ma'aikatan zamantakewa, membobin iyali, abokan aiki, har ma da masu hulɗa da marasa lafiya ko mutanen da suka kamu da cutar.
en-mt: Therefore, great protection should be used to protect people, especially health workers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even those who are in contact with patients or people who are infected.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: Layin farko na kariya wanda za'a iya amfani dashi don rage hadarin kamuwa da cuta shine ta hanyar sanya fuskokin fuska; duka amfani da masks na tiyata da kuma nau'in mashin na numfashi N95 (jerin # 1860s) yana taimakawa wajen sarrafa yaduwar kwayar cututtuka.
en-mt: The first line of defense that can be used to reduce the risk of infection is by wearing face masks; Both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirators (series #1860s) help control the spread of disease.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: Abin rufe fuska na tiyata na hana digan ruwa daga yiwuwar mutane da suka kamu da cuta daga tafiya cikin iska ko mannewa a saman kayayyaki, inda za'a watsa su ga wasu.
en-mt: Surgical masks prevent droplets from potentially infected people from traveling through the air or sticking to surfaces, where they can be spread to others.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: Koyaya, masai N95 (jerin # 1860s) abin rufe fuska zasu iya kare kai daga shaƙar virions da ke karami kamar 10 zuwa 80 nm, tare da kashi 5% na virions sun sami damar shiga gaba ɗaya; SARS-CoV-2 yana kama da SARS-CoV a girma kuma duka sunkai kusan 85 m.
en-mt: However, N95 (series #1860s) masks can protect against inhaling virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with 5% of virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar in size to SARS-CoV and both are about 85 m.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: Tunda barbashi na iya shiga ko da abin rufe fuskar tiyata guda biyar wadanda aka hada kansu, ma’aikatan kiwon lafiya a cikin hulda kai tsaye tare da marassa lafiya dole ne su sanya N95 (jerin # 1860s) abin rufe fuska amma ba abin rufe fuska na tiyata ba.
en-mt: Since particles can penetrate even a five-piece surgical mask, healthcare workers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series #1860s) masks but not face masks not for surgery.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: Kari ga abin rufe fuska, ma’aikacin samar da kiwon lafiya yakamata su sanya rigunan kadaici don a kara rage hulɗa da ƙwayoyin cuta.
en-mt: In addition to masks, healthcare workers should wear isolation gowns to further reduce contact with germs.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: Kwayoyin cuta kuma na iya kama mutum ta hanyar idanu.
en-mt: Bacteria can also infect a person through the eyes.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: A watan Janairu 22, 2020, likita ya kamu da SARS-CoV-2 duk da cewa ya sa abin rufe fuska N95; mai yiwuwa kwayar cutar ta shiga jikin sa ta kumburin idanuwan sa.
en-mt: On January 22, 2020, a doctor contracted SARS-CoV-2 despite wearing an N95 mask; the virus may have entered his body through the swelling of his eyes.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: Don haka, ma’aikacin kiwon lafiya suma suna sanye da garkuwar fuska ko ƙyalli yayin da ana aiki tare da marasa lafiya.
en-mt: Therefore, healthcare workers also wear face shields or goggles while working with patients.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: Ga jama'a gaba daya a wuraren da abin ya shafa, ana bada shawara ga kowa da kowa ya wanke hannuwan sa tare da sabulun hanna yaduwar cutar mafi sau dayawa,yi ƙoƙarin zama a cikin gida don keɓancewar kai da taƙaita hulɗa da masu yiwuwar kamuwa da cutar.
en-mt: For the general population in the affected areas, it is recommended that everyone wash their hands with hand soap to prevent the spread of the disease more often, try to stay indoors for self-isolation and limit contact with potentially infected people. and the disease.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: An dauke kafa shida a matsayin nesa wanda ta dace mutane su zauna domin guje marasa lafiya.
en-mt: Six feet is considered as the proper distance for people to stay to avoid the sick.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Wadannan ayyuka sune hanyoyin ingantattu don rage hadarin kamuwa da cutar tare da hana yaduwar kwayar cutar
en-mt: These practices are effective ways to reduce the risk of infection and prevent the spread of the virus

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: Kodayake SARS-CoV-2 ya zama sabon ƙwayar cuta ga duniyar ɗan adam, babban haɗarinsa ga SARS-CoV kamar yadda aka ruwaito a 7 Janairu 2020 Yakamata ya jawo babbar jijjiga ga kasar Sin dangane da zurfin tunaninta game da barkewar SARS a 2003.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 is a new virus to the human world, its high risk to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should cause a great shock to China based on its deep thoughts about the outbreak of SARS in 2003.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: Amma, har zuwa 19 ga Janairu 2020, darektan Cibiyar Kula da Cututtuka ta Wuhan ya ta'azantar da 'yan kasar ta hanyar cewa sabon littafin kwayar cutan na da karancin yaduwa da karancin haihuwa daga mutum zuwa mutum kuma ba matsala ba ne don hanawa da kuma tsayaya da cutar ba.
en-mt: But, as of January 19, 2020, the director of the Wuhan Center of Disease Control has reassured the citizens by saying that the new novel virus has low transmission and low transmission from person to person and is not a problem to prevent and and stay with the disease.

sourceString: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
targetString: Wannan sakon ya shakata karar da jama'a ke yi, musamman lokacin da daukacin kasar ke shirye-shiryen bukukuwan bazara, kuma an dauki lokaci mai tsaho don dauke cutar a karancin sa a Wuhan.
en-mt: This message calmed the noise of the people, especially when the whole country is preparing for the summer holidays, and it took a long time to contain the disease at its lowest level in Wuhan.

sourceString: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
targetString: Hukumomin kula da cutar a China na iya daukar wannan darasi tare da yin muhimmin ci gaba a nan gaba.
en-mt: The disease control authorities in China can take this lesson and make important progress in the future.

sourceString: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
targetString: Misali, wadannan hukumomin yakamata su kasance (1) mai da hankali sosai yayin yin sanarwar jama'a kamar yadda kowace kalma take yiwa 'yan kasa kuma yana iya canza halaye da yanke shawara; 2) mai saurin dimauta da mayar da hankali ga bayanan da ba a sani ba daga asibitoci maimakon jiran cikakken bayani daga likitoci ko jami'ai; (3) ƙarin hanawa don ɗaukar cutar annoba a farkon matakinsa maimakon ƙoƙarin ta'azantar da jama'a; da (4) mafi yawan lokuta don samar da ingantattun bayanai da kuma ingantattun hanyoyin domin kara wayar da kan jama'a game da cututtukan annoba da kuma gwadawa da inganta tsarin amsawar al'umma a wasu lokuta.
en-mt: For example, these agencies should be (1) very careful when making public announcements as every word affects citizens and can change attitudes and decisions; 2) prone to confusion and focusing on unknown information from hospitals instead of waiting for detailed information from doctors or officials; (3) more prevention to catch the epidemic in its early stages instead of trying to comfort the population; and (4) more often to provide better information and better methods to increase public awareness of epidemics and to test and improve community response systems in some cases.

sourceString: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
targetString: Barkewar COVID-19 wanda ke haifar da ƙwayar cuta SARS-CoV-2 ya fara ne a ƙarshen watar Disamba 2019.
en-mt: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus began in late December 2019.

sourceString: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
targetString: Kasa da watanni biyu, ya bazu ko'ina cikin China da kusan sauran ƙasashe 50 a duniya a lokacin wannan rubutun.
en-mt: In less than two months, it has spread throughout China and about 50 other countries around the world at the time of this writing.

sourceString: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
targetString: Tunda kwayar cutar tana kama da SARS-CoV kuma alamomin ma suna kama ne tsakanin COVID-19 da SARS, fashewar COVID-19 ya haifar da ma'anar sake dawo da SARS.
en-mt: Since the virus is similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has led to the resurgence of SARS.

sourceString: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
targetString: Duk da haka, akwai wasu bambance-bambance na ban mamaki tsakanin COVID-19 da SARS, waɗanda suke da mahimmanci don tsayarwa da annoban da kuma kula da marasa lafiya.
en-mt: However, there are some striking differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are important for stopping the epidemic and treating patients.

sourceString: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
targetString: COVID-19 ya fi shafar tsofaffi fiye da matasa kuma maza fiye da mata, kuma ƙarancin mutuwa da yawan mutuwa sun fi girma a cikin tsofaffi mutum fiye da na matasa.
en-mt: COVID-19 affects the elderly more than the young and men more than women, and the death rate and death rate are higher in the elderly than in the young.

sourceString: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
targetString: SARS tana da mutuƙar nisan mutuwa fiye da COVID-19 kashi (10.91% a kan 1.44%).
en-mt: SARS has a far higher fatality rate than COVID-19 (10.91% against 1.44%).

sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: Marasa lafiyar COVID-19 na bada kwayar cutar koda kuwa ba ta da alamar sa yayin da marasa lafiyar SARS ke yin hakan yawanci lokacin da suke rashin lafiya mai ƙarfi, wanda ke haifar da babban wahala don ɗaukar yaduwar COVID-19 fiye da SARS.
en-mt: COVID-19 patients give the virus even if they have no symptoms while SARS patients usually do it when they are very sick, which makes it more difficult to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Wannan wani bangare yana bayanin dalilin da yasa yadawar SARS-CoV-2 na da sauri da fadi fiye da SARS-CoV.
en-mt: This partly explains why the spread of SARS-CoV-2 is faster and wider than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: RNA na yau da kullun ba da tabbaci ga SARS-CoV-2 na iya zama mara kyau a wasu marasa lafiyar COVID-19.
en-mt: Normal RNA testing for SARS-CoV-2 may be negative in some COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: A wata gefe guda, marasa lafiya da aka warke zasu iya zama tabbatacce ga sake cutar.
en-mt: On the other hand, patients who have been cured can be positive for the disease again.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: Wadannan binciken sun kara hadarin yadawa kwayar cutan.
en-mt: These findings increase the risk of spreading the virus.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: Ganin irin wannan saurin ci gaba a cikin binciken COVID-19, batutuwa masu mahimmancin gaske ana iya warware su, kamar haka:
en-mt: Given such rapid progress in the research of COVID-19, very important issues can be resolved, such as:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: Daga ina SARS-CoV-2 ta fito?
en-mt: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: Kodayake an samu kashi 96% na kwayoyin tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da jemage biyu kamar-SARS CoVs, har yanzu ba za mu iya yanke hukuncin cewa SARS-CoV-2 daga jemagu bane.
en-mt: Although 96% of the cells were found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat-like SARS CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: Wace halitar dabba ce tsakiya ne don yada kwayar cutar daga ainihin mai mazaman cutar, cewa jemagu, ga mutane?
en-mt: Which animal is the center to spread the virus from the original host of the disease, that bats, to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: Ba tare da sanin amsoshin # 1 da na 2 ba, ba za mu iya yanke watsawar yadda yakamata ba, kuma barkewar na iya sake dawowa a kowane lokaci.
en-mt: Without knowing the answers to #1 and #2, we cannot effectively stop the spread, and outbreaks can recur at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: Kodayake samfurin ƙirar kwayoyin halitta da kuma tabbatarwar kwayoyin halitta sun nuna cewa SARS-CoV-2 yana ɗaurawa ACE2, ta yaya ne kwayar cutar ta ke shiga cikin hanya iskar tantanin halitar kuma ta haifar da canje-canjen cutar?
en-mt: Although genetic modeling and genetic confirmation have shown that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how does the virus enter the cellular pathway and cause viral changes?

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
targetString: Shin kwayar cutar kuma tana ɗaukar ƙwayoyin bayyana ACE2 a cikin wasu gabobin?
en-mt: Does the virus also carry ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?

sourceString: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
targetString: Idan ba tare da amsoshin waɗannan tambayoyin ba, ba za mu iya samun ingantacciyar hanyar bincike da kuma ingantaccen magani ba.
en-mt: Without the answers to these questions, we will not be able to find a better way of diagnosis and better treatment.

sourceString: How long will the epidemic last?
targetString: Har yaushe annobar zata kai ga karshe?
en-mt: How long will the epidemic end?
