sourceString: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
targetString: Ta yaya ƙwayar cutar ke canza yanayi halita lokacin bazawa tsakanin mutane?
en-mt: How does the virus change its nature when it spreads between people?

sourceString: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
targetString: Shin zai iya zama annoba a duk duniya, ya mutu kamar SARS ko sake dawowa lokaci-lokaci kamar mura?
en-mt: Could it become a worldwide epidemic, die out like SARS or recur periodically like the flu?

sourceString: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
targetString: Yana da mahimmanci amma yana iya ɗaukar ɗan lokaci don bincika amsoshin tambayoyin da ke sama da sauran tambayoyi masu yawa.
en-mt: It is important but it may take some time to research the answers to the above questions and many other questions.

sourceString: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
targetString: Duk da haka, tare da kowane irin kuɗin da yake buƙata, ba mu da wani zaɓi amma tsayar da annoban da wuri kuma mu dawo da rayuwarmu yada aka saba.
en-mt: However, with all the money he needs, we have no choice but to stop the epidemic early and get our lives back to normal.

sourceString: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
targetString: Asalin zoonotic na coronaviruses na mutum
en-mt: The zoonotic origin of human coronaviruses

sourceString: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
targetString: Maye gurbi da kuma daidaitawa ne suka haifar da juyin halittun coronaviruses (CoVs) da wajen zaman su, har ma da mutane, zuwa dubban shekaru.
en-mt: Mutations and adaptations have led to the evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their existence, including in humans, for thousands of years.

sourceString: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
targetString: Kafin 2003, CoVs na mutum guda biyu (HCoVs) an san su don haifar da ciwo mara tsanani, kamar sanyi na yau da kullun.
en-mt: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as the common cold.

sourceString: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
targetString: Barkewar cuta mai saurin kamuwar manufanshi da alamar (SARS) da cutar manufanshi ta Gabas ta Tsakiya (MERS) sun juya kuɗin don bayyana yadda ɓarkewar cutar HCoV zata iya zamawa.
en-mt: The outbreaks of SARS and MERS have turned the tide to reveal what HCoV outbreaks can be.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
targetString: Fitowar SARS-CoV-2 a tsakiyar ƙasar Sin a ƙarshen shekarar 2019 ya turo cuttutukar CoVs gaba kuma ya ba mu mamaki da cewa yana da sauƙin aikawa ga juna amma yawan ƙwayar cutar sun rage idan aka kwatanta da ‘yar uwarta SARS-CoV.
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 pushed the spread of CoVs to the fore and surprised us that it is easy to transmit to each other but the number of viruses is less compared to its sister SARS-CoV.

sourceString: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
targetString: Cutar HCoV ana samun sa ne daga dabbobi kuma fahimtar tushen HcoVs taimaka gaya.
en-mt: HCoV infection is acquired from animals and understanding the source of HcoVs helps to tell.

sourceString: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
targetString: Galibin kwayoyin halittar HCoVs sun samo asali ne daga jemagu inda suka kasance ba masu cutarwa ba.
en-mt: Most of the HCoVs originated from bats where they were non-pathogenic.

sourceString: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
targetString: Ana sane da halittukan da ke rik'e wasu cututtukar HCoVs a tsakani suma.
en-mt: Organisms that harbor some HCoVs are also known.

sourceString: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
targetString: Gano ainihin dabbobin da ke dauke da cutar zai taimaka kai tsaye wajen kare mutane daga cutar.
en-mt: Identifying the real animals that carry the disease will directly help protect people from the disease.

sourceString: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
targetString: Bincikar mu’amalar mai dauke da cutar CoV da dabbobi watakila zai taimaka wajen gano yaduwar kwayoyin halittar cutar CoV a jikin mutane.
en-mt: Investigating the interactions between CoV and animals may help to identify the spread of CoV in humans.

sourceString: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
targetString: A cikin wannan bita, mun gabatar da wani bayyani game da ilimin data kasance game da HCoV guda bakwai, tare da mai da hankali kan tarihin gano su da yadda aka samo asalin zoonotic da kuma yada jinsunan halittar.
en-mt: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about seven HCoVs, focusing on the history of their discovery and the zoonotic origin and spread of the species.

sourceString: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
targetString: Muhimmin abu a nan shi ne, mu tantance banbanci tsakanin kwayar cutar HCoVs daga fahimtar yadda asalin kwayar cuta take rikada da kuma kwayoyin halitta suke rikida daga asalin tushensu.
en-mt: The important thing here is to determine the difference between HCoVs from understanding how viruses evolve and how organisms evolve from their original sources.

sourceString: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
targetString: Cutar CoV da ake fama da ita a 2019 mai suna (COVID-19) wacce annoba ce, an yi bayani game da ita a nan.
en-mt: The 2019 CoV disease (COVID-19) which is an epidemic, is explained here.

sourceString: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, an jaddada yadda abunda ake buƙata domin ƙwayar cutar ta samu nasarar masauka wanda ke sauyawa kuma anlmm jaddada sakamakon yadda juyin halittar kwayar cutar ke tsananta cutar.
en-mt: In addition, it is emphasized how necessary for the virus to successfully colonize, which is changing and how the evolution of the virus aggravates the disease is emphasized.

sourceString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
targetString: Kwayoyin cutar Corona (CoVs) sun kasance dangin Coronaviridae, wanda ya hada da tabbatacciyar rukunin kwayoyin cututtukan RNA mai zare daya.
en-mt: Corona viruses (CoVs) belong to the Coronaviridae family, which includes a distinct group of single-stranded RNA viruses.

sourceString: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
targetString: Wadannan kwayoyin cututtukan sun kunsar da babban ma’adanin kwayar halittar kamaceceniya na RNA daga 26 zuwa 32 nasu, dalilin da yasa ake kiransu “CoVs” wanda ake iya gani a tabarau na microscope.
en-mt: These viruses contain a large amount of RNA from 26 to 32 copies of their genome, which is why they are called "CoVs" that can be seen under a microscope.

sourceString: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
targetString: A gine dai, CoVs suna da kwayoyin halittar da ba a rarrabe su ba wanda ke da shiri kamar haka.
en-mt: Structurally, CoVs have uncharacterized genes that are organized like this.

sourceString: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
targetString: Kimanin kashi biyu bisa uku na halittar suna dauke da manyan furanni masu budewa biyu (ORF1a da ORF1b), wadanda ake fassara su cikin pp1a da pp1ab kwafin polyproteins.
en-mt: About two-thirds of the gene contain two large opening folds (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into pp1a and pp1ab polyprotein transcripts.

sourceString: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
targetString: Ana ƙara aiwatar da polyproteins don samar da furotin 16 waɗanda ba na tsari ba, waɗanda aka tsara nsp1~16.
en-mt: The polyproteins are further processed to form 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.

sourceString: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
targetString: Sauran bangaren tushen halittar mai dauke da ORFs domin abu mai gina jiki kamar su, nau‘in spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
en-mt: The other parts of the gene containing ORFs for proteins such as spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).

sourceString: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
targetString: Yawancin nau'ikan sinadaran zuriya, su ma ana lulluɓe su da wasu zuriyoyin CoVs daban.
en-mt: Most of the lineages are also covered by different lineages of CoVs.

sourceString: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
targetString: Dangane da bambanci a cikin jerin abubuwan gina jiki, ana rarraba CoVs zuwa abubuwa huɗu (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV da delta-CoV), tsakanin abin da beta-CoV ya ƙunshi yawancin HCoVs kuma an rarrabasu cikin kashi huɗu (A, B, C da D).
en-mt: According to the difference in the protein sequence, CoVs are divided into four types (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which beta-CoV contains most of the HCoVs and are divided into four categories (A, B, C and D).

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
targetString: Hujjojin halittun dabbobi sun nuna cewa jemagu da dabbobin suna aiki a matsayin tushen asalin yawancin alpha-CoVs da beta-CoVs, yayin da tsuntsaye sune babban tafki na gamma-CoVs da delta-CoVs
en-mt: Animal biology evidence shows that bats and animals serve as the source of origin for most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.

sourceString: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
targetString: Shekaru dubbai yanzu, CoVs sun shawo kan shingen jinsuna kuma wasu sun fito a matsayin mahimman ƙwayoyin cuta na mutane.
en-mt: For thousands of years now, CoVs have overcome species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.

sourceString: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.
targetString: Har ya zuwa yau din nan, an san cututtukan na CoVs (HCoVs) nau’i bakwai ne a jikin dan adam.
en-mt: To date, seven types of CoVs (HCoVs) have been identified in humans.

sourceString: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.
targetString: Daga cikinsu HCoV-229E da HCoV-NL63 sune alpha-CoVs.
en-mt: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.

sourceString: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Sauran beta-CoV guda biyar sun hada da HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, cutar hanyoyin numfashi mai tsanani na coronavirus (SARS-CoV), cutar numfashi na gefen larabawa coronavirus (MERS-CoV) da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Arabian respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and/or diarrhea.
targetString: Cututtukan HCoV-229E da HCoV-OC43 da HCoV-HKU1 da kuma HCoV-NL63 galibi su kan haifar da alamomin cuta marasa karfi sosai kamar mura da ko kuma gudawa.
en-mt: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 infections usually cause mild symptoms such as flu and or diarrhea.

sourceString: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and the newly-identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
targetString: Saɓanin haka, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV da subuwar cutar SARS-CoV-2 da aka gano sune cututtuka masu mafi yaɗuwa da ke haifar da mummunan rauni na jijiyoyin jiki a marasa lafiya tare da babbar damar haɓaka ciwo mai rauni na rashin damuwa na jiki (ARDS) da bayyananniyar cututtuka.
en-mt: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have been identified as the most common pathogens that cause severe neurological damage in patients with a high risk of developing mild to moderate depression. body (ARDS) and obvious diseases.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
targetString: Nau'in HCoV-229E na farko, B814, ya kasance mai rabuwa daga fitowar hancin marasa lafiya masu fama da murar yau da kullum a tsakiyar shekarun 1960.
en-mt: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal secretions of patients with the common cold in the mid-1960s.

sourceString: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
targetString: Tun daga lokacin, ake ta samun ilimi kan HCoV-229E da kuma HCoV-OC43, ta hanyar zurfafa nazarin alamun cutar.
en-mt: Since then, knowledge has been gained about HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, through in-depth analysis of the symptoms of the disease.

sourceString: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: Tabbas, an yarda da ra'ayin cewa kamuwa da cutar HCoVs gaba daya ba shi da matsala har sai fashewar SARS.
en-mt: Indeed, the idea that HCoVs infection was generally not a problem was accepted until the outbreak of SARS.

sourceString: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
targetString: Barkewar cutar SARS da ta faru a cikin shekarar 2003, shi ne ɗaya mafi munin balaguro a cikin tarihin na yanzu, da ya kamu da mutane sama da 8,000 da ke cikin mummunan yanayin mutuwar kusan kashi 10%.
en-mt: The SARS outbreak in 2003 was one of the worst in recent history, infecting more than 8,000 people with a fatality rate of around 10%.

sourceString: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
targetString: Shekaru goma bayan haka, barkewar cutar numfashi na gefen larabawa wato Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) ya haifar da annoba na yau da kullum a Kasashen Larabawa tare da yaduwa zuwa sauran sassan duniya.
en-mt: Ten years later, the outbreak of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) in the Arab world caused a daily epidemic in the Arab countries and spread to other parts of the world.

sourceString: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which has subsequently been renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.
targetString: Sabuwar cutar HCoV ta shekarar 2019 (2019-nCoV), wanda daga baya aka sake masa suna SARS-CoV-2, shine wakili na abubuwanda ke faruwa na ci gaba da cutar coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19), wanda ya yi sanadiyar rayuka sama da 3,120 kuma ya kamu da mutane sama da dubu 91,000 a cikin watan Maris 3, 2020.
en-mt: The new 2019 HCoV (2019-nCoV), later renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the agent of the continuation of the 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19), which has claimed more lives and 3,120 and infected more than 91,000 people in the month of March 3, 2020.

sourceString: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ƙararrawar tana ta kaɗawa kuma dole duniya ta shirya akan annobar cutar SARS-CoV-2 da ke zuwa.
en-mt: The alarm is sounding and the world must prepare for the coming SARS-CoV-2 pandemic.

sourceString: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
targetString: Dukkanin HCoV guda bakwai suna da asalin fitowa daga dabbobi kamar su jemagu, beraye ko dabbobin gida.
en-mt: All seven HCoVs have origins in animals such as bats, mice or domestic animals.

sourceString: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.
targetString: Bayanan shaida da yawa suna tallafawa asalin juyin halittar dukkanin HCoVs daga jemagu, inda ƙwayoyin cuta suke dacewa da kyau kuma ba masu bada ciwon ba ne amma na nuna babban bambancin kwayoyin halita.
en-mt: Several lines of evidence support the evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where the viruses are well adapted and are not pathogens but show great genetic diversity.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to China and the world.
targetString: COVID-19 annobar cutar ta gabatar da babban kalubale na likita, kimiyya, zamantakewa da halin kirki ga kasar Sin da duniya.
en-mt: The COVID-19 pandemic has presented a major medical, scientific, social and moral challenge to China and the world.

sourceString: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.
targetString: Binciken asalin dabbobin da suka janyo HCoVs yana ba da tsarin fahimtar tarihin halitta, ƙarfin tuƙi da abubuwan da ke hana ƙetare na tsallen jinsin.
en-mt: The study of the origin of HCoVs in animals provides a framework for understanding the genetic history, driving forces and factors that prevent the crossing of the species.

sourceString: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
targetString: Wannan na iya jagorantar ko sauƙaƙe bincika tafkin, matsakaici da haɓaka rundunar garken dabbobi (s) na SARS-CoV-2, tare da mahimmancin tasiri cikin karewar abin da ke dawowa nan gaba.
en-mt: This may lead to or facilitate the investigation of the reservoir, medium and development of the animal herd(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future recurrences.

sourceString: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of HCoVs.
targetString: A cikin wannan bitar, mun gabatar da wani taƙaitaccen bayani game da asalin cututtukar dabbobi (zoonotic), watsawarsu tsakanin nau’in jinsun kansu da gine-ginen HCoVs.
en-mt: In this review, we present a summary of the origin of zoonotic diseases, their transmission between species and the architecture of HCoVs.

sourceString: Particularly, we highlight and discuss the common theme that parental viruses of HCoVs are typically non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.
targetString: Musamman ma, muna karin haske da bayani kan tushen kwayoyin cutar HCoVs ba wai sun samo asali ne daga kwayoyin halittar da basa haifar da cuta a jiki bayan sun shiga jikin wani na daban.
en-mt: In particular, we clarify and explain the origin of HCoVs, not that they originate from non-pathogenic organisms after entering the body of another person.

sourceString: We also review the trend of HCoV evolution in which the increase in transmissibility often comes with the decrease in pathogenicity.
targetString: Mun kuma sake nazarin yanayin cigaban HCoV wanda karuwa a watsawa sau da yawa yana zuwa tare da raguwa a cikin mai bada kwayar cutan.
en-mt: We also reviewed the evolution of HCoV in which an increase in transmission is often accompanied by a decrease in the host virus.

sourceString: The outcome of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is also discussed in this context.
targetString: Ana bayanin sakamakon da barkewar ita ma cutar SARS-CoV-2 a nan.
en-mt: The results of the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak are described here.

sourceString: Animal CoVs have been known since late 1930s.
targetString: An san CoV na dabbobi tun ƙarshen shekarun 1930.
en-mt: Animal CoV has been known since the late 1930s.

sourceString: Before the first isolation of HCoV-229E strain B814 from the nasal discharge of patients who had contracted common cold, different CoVs had been isolated in various infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat and dog.
targetString: Kafin farkon warewar iri B814 na HCoV-229E daga zubar hancin wanda ya kamu da mura na yau da kullun, an ware CoVs a dabbobi daban-daban wanda suka kamu da cutar kamar tolotolo, ɓera, shanu, alade, kule da kare.
en-mt: Before the first isolation of strain B814 of HCoV-229E from the nasal discharge of a person infected with the common cold, CoVs were isolated in various animals that were infected with the disease such as hamsters, mice, cattle, pigs, cats and dogs.

sourceString: In the past decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.
targetString: A shekara ashirin da suka gabata, an gano kwayoyin cuatr dangin HCoVs.
en-mt: Twenty years ago, four members of the HCoVs family were discovered.

sourceString: A brief summary of the history of HCoV discovery in chronological order (Table ​1) would be informative and instructive.
targetString: Takaitaccen tarihin gano cutar HCoV a jerin jadawalin farko na wannana teburi (Tebur 1) zai zama mai gamsarawa tare da bayar da cikakken bayani a kai.
en-mt: A summary of the history of HCoV diagnosis in the first table of this table (Table 1) will be satisfactory and provide detailed information on it.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year of 1966, and was subsequently adapted to grow in WI-38 lung cell lines.
targetString: Rashin HCoV-229E na farko ya kasance a kebe daga cutar hanyar numfashi na marasa lafiya da cutar sama hanyar numfashi a shekarar 1966, daga baya ya sami karbuwa girma cikin layin tantanin halitar huhu WI-38.
en-mt: HCoV-229E was first isolated from patients with upper respiratory tract infection in 1966, and subsequently grown in the human lung cell line WI-38.

sourceString: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10~20% cases.
targetString: Marasa lafiya waɗanda ke kamuwa da HCoV-229E da aka gabatar tare da alamun sanyi na yau da kullun, gami da ciwon kai, atishawa, rashin jin dadi, zazzabi da ciwon-makogwaro, da zazzabi da tari da aka gani cikin damu’oin kashi 10~20%.
en-mt: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with typical cold-like symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise, fever and sore throat, and fever and cough seen in bone disorders. 10~20%.

sourceString: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.
targetString: Daga baya a shekarar 1967, an ware HCoV-OC43 daga hanyar binciken ‘organ culture’ da kuma hanyar renon cuta (serial passage) da zai biyo a kwakwalwar jariran ɓeraye.
en-mt: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and serial passage in the brains of newborn mice.

sourceString: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.
targetString: Siffofin asibiti na kamuwa da HCoV-OC43 suna kama da waɗanda HCoV-229E ke haifar, waɗanda ke alammar nuna bambanci daga kamuwa da wasu cututtukan ƙwayoyin cuta kamar mura da ƙwayoyin cuta da kuma rhinoviruses.
en-mt: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection are similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are characteristic of different infections from other viral diseases such as influenza viruses and rhinoviruses.

sourceString: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are distributed globally, and they tend to be predominantly transmitted during the season of winter in temperate climate.
targetString: Dukansu HCoV-229E da HCoV-OC43 na yaɗuwa a duk faɗin duniya, kuma galibi suna watsawa a lokacin bazara, a cikin yanayi marasa dumi ko sanyi.
en-mt: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are circulating throughout the world, and are mostly transmitted during the summer, in warm or cold climates.

sourceString: Generally, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than one week, followed by an approximately 2-week illness.
targetString: Yawanci dai, lokacin yaɗuwar waɗannan ƙwayoyin cututtuka guda biyu shi ne ƙasa da mako ɗaya, hakan na biye da sa rashin lafiyan kusan makonai 2.
en-mt: Usually, the period of transmission of these two diseases is less than a week, and it is followed by an illness of about 2 months.

sourceString: According to a human volunteer study, healthy individuals infected with HCoV-229E developed mild common cold.
targetString: Dangane da binciken masu ba da agaji na ɗan adam, mutane masu lafiya waɗanda suka kamu da cutar HCoV-229E sun kamu da sanyi na yau da kullun.
en-mt: Based on studies of human volunteers, healthy people who were infected with HCoV-229E developed the common cold.

sourceString: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.
targetString: Kalilan marasa lafiya wadan da garkuwar jikin sub ba karfi ne ke nuna tsananin kamuwa hanyar manufanshi da cuta.
en-mt: A few patients with sub-immune disease are more susceptible to infection.

sourceString: SARS, also known as “atypical pneumonia”, was the first well documented HCoV-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.
targetString: SARS, wanda kuma aka sani da "kwayar cutar huhu", shine farkon bayanan da aka samu na cutar HCoV-da ke haifar da ƙwayar cuta a cikin tarihin ɗan adam kuma wakili na etiological shine SARS-CoV, HCoV na uku da aka gano.
en-mt: SARS, also known as "pneumonia virus", is the first documented HCoV-causing virus in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV to be identified.

sourceString: The first case of SARS can be traced back to late 2002 in Guangdong Province of China.
targetString: Ana iya gano kamuwar SARS ta farko zuwa karshen 2002 a lardin Guangdong na kasar Sin.
en-mt: The first SARS infection can be traced back to the end of 2002 in China's Guangdong Province.

sourceString: The SARS epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.
targetString: Cutar ta SARS ta haifar da mutane 8,096 da aka ruwaito sun kamu da asarar rayuka 774, sun bazu cikin kasashe da nahiyoyi da yawa.
en-mt: The SARS epidemic caused 8,096 reported infections and 774 deaths, spread across many countries and continents.

sourceString: Apart from the super-spreaders, it was estimated that each case could give rise to approximately two secondary cases, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the peak of viral load appearing on the 10th day of illness.
targetString: Ban da manyan gwaraza, an kiyasta hakan kowane damuwa na iya ba da kusan damu’oi biyu na, tare da lokacin shiryawa na kwanaki 4 zuwa 7 da gangar jikin kwayar cutar ta bayyana a ranar 10 ta rashin lafiya.
en-mt: With the exception of large sparrows, it is estimated that each concern can give almost two concerns, with a incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the stem of the virus appears on the 10th day of illness.

sourceString: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
targetString: Marasa lafiya waɗanda ke kamuwa da SARS-CoV da farko suna kasancewa tare da myalgia, ciwon kai, zazzabi, zazzabin cizon sauro da tsananin sanyi, biyo bayan dyspnea, tari da matsananciyar damuwa kamar bayyanar cututtuka.
en-mt: Patients who are infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaria and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and severe anxiety like symptoms.

sourceString: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.
targetString: Lymphopenia, gwajin aikin hanta, da haɓaka sinadarin creatine kinase abubuwa ne na gama-gari wurin gwaji na SARS.
en-mt: Lymphopenia, liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory findings for SARS.

sourceString: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in SARS patients.
targetString: Diffuse alveolar damage (lalacewar huhu), epithelial cell proliferation (yaɗuwar ƙwayoyin halittar kan jiki), kuma an gano karuwar macrophages (ƙwayoyin halittar farin jini) a cikin marasa lafiyar SARS.
en-mt: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation, and increased macrophages (white blood cells) have been found in SARS patients.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.
targetString: Aƙalla kashi 20-30% na marasa lafiya daga baya suna buƙatar kulawa mai zurfi da samun iska.
en-mt: At least 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and ventilation.

sourceString: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.
targetString: Bayan hanyar numfashi ta ƙasa, gabobin cikin jiki da yawa, ciki har da na ciki, hanta da koda na iya kamuwa da cutar a cikin waɗannan mummunan yanayin cutar, yawanci tare da hadarin cytokine, wanda kan iya kashewa musamman ga marasa lafiya marasa kariyar lafiya.
en-mt: After the lower respiratory tract, many internal organs, including the stomach, liver and kidneys can be infected in these severe cases of the disease, usually with the risk of cytokines, which can be fatal especially for immunocompromised patients .

sourceString: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.
targetString: An fara ware kwayar cutar ne daga tarin kwayoyin cutar huhu na wani dan uwan mai cutar Ebola wanda ya tafi Hong Kong daga Guangzhou.
en-mt: The virus was first isolated from the lung tissue of a relative of an Ebola patient who traveled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.

sourceString: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to HCoV research.
targetString: Tun lokacin kuma ake ta kokarin nazari kan cutar HCoV.
en-mt: Since then, efforts have been made to study the HCoV disease.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during late 2004.
targetString: HCoV-NL63 an ware shi daga wani yaro dan watanni 7 daga Netherlands a ƙarshen 2004.
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old boy from the Netherlands in late 2004.

sourceString: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.
targetString: An samo shi ne da farko a cikin yara ƙanana, tsofaffi da marasa lafiyan mara garkuwa wato immunocompromised da cutan numfashi.
en-mt: It is found primarily in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory infections.

sourceString: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Gabatar coryza, conjunctivitis, zazzabi, da mashako ya zama ruwan dare a cikin cutar da HCoV-NL63 ta haifar.
en-mt: The presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.
targetString: Wani bincike mai zaman kansa ya bayyana warewar cutar guda daga samfurin hanci daga wani yaro dan watanni 8 da ke fama da ciwon huhu a Netherlands.
en-mt: An independent study described the isolation of the virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old child with pneumonia in the Netherlands.

sourceString: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
targetString: Ko da yake a gano ta ne a kasar Netherlands, amma tabbas dai an yada ta a duniya.
en-mt: Even though it was discovered in the Netherlands, it has definitely spread around the world.

sourceString: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
targetString: An yi kiyasin cewa kwayoyin halittar HCoV-NL63 sune keda alhakin akalla kashi 4.7 na cututtukan numfashi, kuma yana ganiyarsa a daidai shigar lokacin bazara da kaka da kuma hunturu.
en-mt: It is estimated that the HCoV-NL63 virus is responsible for at least 4.7 percent of respiratory infections, and it is most common in spring, autumn and winter.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
targetString: HCoV-NL63 yana da alaƙar da cutar kumburin beli mai toshewa, wanda kuma aka sani da croup.
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 is associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, also known as croup.

sourceString: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.
targetString: A shekara daya ce, cutar HCoV-HKU1 aka fara gano ta daga wani dattijo mai shekara 71 wanda aka garzaya da shi asibiti sakamakon cutar shakewar numfashi ta pneumonia da kuma cutar huhu a birnin Hong Kong.
en-mt: One year ago, HCoV-HKU1 was first identified from a 71-year-old man who was rushed to the hospital due to pneumonia and lung disease in Hong Kong.

sourceString: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
targetString: Bayan ciwon huhu da na hanyoyin huhu wadanda al'umma ke samu, an ruwaito cewa HCoV-HKU1 yana da alaƙa da matsanancin rashin lafiyar asma.
en-mt: In addition to community-acquired lung cancer, HCoV-HKU1 has been reported to be associated with severe asthma.

sourceString: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
targetString: Kama da HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E da HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 an samu a duk duniya, suna haifar da karamin cutan manufanci.
en-mt: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 has been found worldwide, causing small-scale disease.

sourceString: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
targetString: Duk waɗannan HCoVs huɗu da al'umma suka samu wurin zama a mutane kuma galibi ba su da ikon canzawa don haifar da kwayoyin cututtuka sosai, kodayake hatsarori sun faru ne saboda dalilai da ba a san su ba kamar yadda a cikin mafi yawan yanayi mai kama da HCoV-NL63, wanda a kwanan nan aka ba da rahoton cewa yana haifar da cuta kasa hanyar numfashi mai tsanani a China.
en-mt: All four of these HCoVs have been established in humans and are generally not capable of mutating to cause severe disease, although accidents have occurred for unknown reasons as in most similar situations. and HCoV-NL63, which was recently reported to cause severe respiratory disease in China.

sourceString: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
targetString: Gabaɗaya, lokacin da waɗannan HCoVs suka sami damar iya watsuwa yadda yakamata kuma su riƙe kansu gabaɗaya cikin ɗan-adam, su kuma suna zama ƙasa da ɓarna ko kuma cutarwa.
en-mt: In general, when these HCoVs are able to properly replicate and maintain themselves in humans, they become less invasive or harmful.

sourceString: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: An fara ware MERS-CoV ne a cikin 2012 a cikin huhu na wani mara lafiya mai shekaru 60 wanda ya kamu da matsananciyar cutar huhu da gazawar koda a Saudiya.
en-mt: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 in the lungs of a 60-year-old patient with severe pulmonary disease and kidney failure in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
targetString: Ganin cewa mafi yawan kwayoyin da aka tabbatar da asali sun fito ne daga Gabas ta Tsakiya, an bayar da rahoton yaduwa ta biyu na gaba zuwa makusantan sadarwa a kasashe daban-daban na Turai da Tunusiya.
en-mt: Considering that most of the confirmed strains come from the Middle East, the second spread has been reported to close contacts in various European countries and Tunisia.

sourceString: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
targetString: Wani fashewa ta sakandare ya faru a Koriya ta Kudu a cikin 2015 tare da tabbatarwan mutane 186 da cutar.
en-mt: A secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
targetString: Bayyanannin asibiti na MERS sun yi kama da na SARS, wanda ke nunawa da mummunan ciwon huhu.
en-mt: The clinical manifestations of MERS are similar to those of SARS, characterized by severe pneumonia.

sourceString: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.
targetString: Sai dai ba kamar cutar SARS ba, da dama daga cikin majinyatan murar ta MERS sun kuma gamu da matsalar ciwon koda, wanda ya zama babban dalili da ya sa banbanta cuatr ta MERS da kuma kwayoyin cututtukan da ke samuwa daga HCoV.
en-mt: However, unlike SARS, many of the patients with MERS have also had kidney problems, which is the main reason for distinguishing between MERS and HCoV.

sourceString: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
targetString: Fiye da kashi 30% na marasa lafiya da ke tare da alamun gastrointestinal, kamar gudawa da amai.
en-mt: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.

sourceString: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
targetString: Ya zuwa ranar 14 ga Fabrairu, 2020, kamuwa sama da 2500 da aka tabbatar a dakin gwaje-gwaje sun kasance tare da mutuwar kasha 34.4 cikin dari, wadda ya sa MERS-CoV ta zama daya daga cikin cututtukan da ke lalata mutane sosai da aka taba samu.
en-mt: As of February 14, 2020, there have been more than 2,500 laboratory-confirmed infections with a fatality rate of 34.4 percent, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating human diseases ever reported. never had.

sourceString: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Daidai lokacin tsakiyar watan Disamban 2019, an samu wasu marasa lafiya masu fama da shakewar numfashi ko pneumonia da a lokacin aka yi tunanin tana kama da cutar SARS-CoV-2 wandanda aka gano a birnin Wuhan, lardin Hubei, da ke kasar China.
en-mt: In the middle of December 2019, there were some patients suffering from respiratory suffocation or pneumonia which at that time was thought to be similar to SARS-CoV-2 which was discovered in the city of Wuhan, Hubei province, in China.

sourceString: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
targetString: Hukumar Kiwon Lafiya ta Duniya ta ba da sanarwar ci gaban barkewar cuta kasan hanyar manufanci wanda haifar da SARS-CoV-2 da shi wanda ya zama babban kalubale ga lafiyar Jama'a na Kasa da Kasa kuma ya sanya sunan cutar COVID-19.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has announced the development of an outbreak of a disease caused by SARS-CoV-2, which has become a major challenge to the health of the International People and has given the name of the disease COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
targetString: Ya zuwa ranar 3 ga watan Maris, 2020, as tabbatar da mutane masu kamuwa 90,053 a duniya, tare da yawan mutuwa saboda kamuwa wanda ya kai kashi 3.4%..
en-mt: As of March 3, 2020, there are 90,053 confirmed cases of the virus worldwide, with a death rate of 3.4%.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
targetString: Musamman ma, yawan wadanda suka mutu daga cutar a Hubei, China ya kai kashi 4.2 cikin dari, alhali wanda yake waje da can kashi 1.2 cikin dari ne.
en-mt: In particular, the number of people who died from the disease in Hubei, China reached 4.2 percent, while the number outside of that country was 1.2 percent.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 yana haifar da tsananin cutan numfashi kamar SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV, an gabatar da su azaman zazzabi, tari da dyspnea.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory disease like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
targetString: Ana kuma ganin cutar gudawa a wasu marassa lafiyan.
en-mt: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Cutar huhu na ɗaya daga cikin alamun bayyanar cututtuka kuma yana iya ci gaba cikin hanzari zuwa ciwo mai wahala na manumfashi.
en-mt: Pneumonia is one of the symptoms and can quickly progress to severe respiratory disease.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: Kodayake SARS-CoV da SARS-CoV-2 suna da kama sosai saboda halayyar ƙwayoyin nucleotide na kasha 82%, suna curewa cikin rassa daban-daban a cikin bishiyar kwayoyin halittar.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to their 82% nucleotide sequence, they fall into different branches in the genetic tree.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: Idan aka kwatanta da SARS-CoV wadda yake da babban adadin maye gurbi, adadin maye gurbi na SARS-CoV-2 yana kasa sosai, wadda ke nuna girman matakin karbuwa ga mutane.
en-mt: Compared to SARS-CoV which has a high number of mutations, the number of mutations of SARS-CoV-2 is very low, which indicates a high degree of adaptability to humans.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
targetString: Wani mai nuna alamar kamu da SARS-CoV-2 wanda aka bada rahoton iya ba da gudummawa ga saurin yaduwa a duniya.
en-mt: Another indicator of SARS-CoV-2 infection that has been reported may contribute to the rapid global spread.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
targetString: Kwatantawa da kuma musanya SARS-CoV-2 tare da sauran HCoV guda shida suna nuna kamanni da bambance-bambance masu babban mahimmanci.
en-mt: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs shows important similarities and differences.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
targetString: Na farko dai, lokacin kyankyasar cutar da kuma yadda cutar ta HCoV ke samuwa na kama da juna.
en-mt: First of all, the incubation period of the virus and the mode of transmission of HCoV are similar.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
targetString: A wannan batun, SARS-CoV-2 yana bin yanayin gaba ɗaya na sauran HCoV guda shida.
en-mt: In this respect, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
targetString: Na biyu shi ne zafin alamun cutar COVID-19 ya dogara ne tsakanin cutar SARS-CoV da kuma sauran ire-irensu guda hudu: HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
en-mt: The second is that the severity of the symptoms of COVID-19 depends on the SARS-CoV virus and the other four types: HCoVs (ie HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
targetString: A bangare guda, kamuwa da cuta SARS-CoV-2 yana nuna fasali waɗanda aka fi ganinsu yayin kamuwa da cutar HCoVs, da al'umma ke samu, gami da gabatar da marasa takamaiman, mai saukin kai ko ma babu alamun su.
en-mt: On the one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection shows features that are more common during infection with HCoVs, acquired by the community, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
targetString: A gefe guda, ana iya ganin ƙaramin kashin tsananin kamuwa da COVID-19 kamar yadda ake ganin ta a kamuwa da cutar SARS-CoV, duk da haka kashin yana da karanci.
en-mt: On the other hand, a small percentage of the severity of the infection with COVID-19 can be seen as it is seen with the SARS-CoV infection, however the percentage is low.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Na uku, watsuwar SARS-CoV-2 kuma yana nuna alamun halayen ban sha'awa na samun HCoVs da al'umma kan yi da na SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Third, the spread of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting characteristics of community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: A bangare guda, bazuwar SARS-CoV-2 ya yi daidai da na HCoVs wanda al'umma suka samu.
en-mt: On the one hand, the spread of SARS-CoV-2 is similar to that of community-acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: A wata gefe guda, ya rage don tabbatar da ko yiwuwar rikicewar SARS-CoV-2 ya ragu bayan bayanan wurare a cikin mutane kamar yadda yake a yanayin SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV.
en-mt: On the other hand, it remains to be confirmed whether the possibility of SARS-CoV-2 infection is reduced after the information of places in humans as it is in the case of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
targetString: A ƙarshe, daidai da sauran HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 za'a iya gano su a cikin samfuran fecal.
en-mt: Finally, similar to other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.

sourceString: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
targetString: Nazarin cewa ko cutar SARS-CoV-2 ta yadu ta hanyar kashin da ya shiga ta baki ya taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen yada cutar SARS-CoV zai zama sai nan gaba za a tabbatar da haka a binciken da za a yi.
en-mt: The study that whether the SARS-CoV-2 virus spread through the bone that entered the mouth played an important role in the spread of the SARS-CoV virus will be confirmed in the future in the research that will be done.

sourceString: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Hakanan yana da matukar sha'awar ganin ko SARS-CoV-2 na iya bayyanar da yanayi kamar yadda al'amuran al'umma suka samu HCoVs.
en-mt: It is also very interesting to see if SARS-CoV-2 can appear in the environment as the community has acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
targetString: Koyaya, siffofin SARS-CoV-2 gami da wucewa, pathogenicity da ci gaba mai yadawa bayan wurare a cikin mutane zasu zama masu tasiri akan ƙarshen ƙaddarar barkewar COVID-19.
en-mt: However, the characteristics of SARS-CoV-2 including transmissibility, pathogenicity and continued spread in humans will have an impact on the final determination of the outbreak of COVID-19.

sourceString: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
targetString: Dukkanin al'ummomin guda huɗu sun samo HCoVs waɗanda ke haifar da bayyanar cututtuka masu alaƙa sun daidaita ga mutane.
en-mt: All four communities have found HCoVs that cause related symptoms adapted to humans.

sourceString: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
targetString: Ta wata hanyar, zai iya zama gaskiya ne cewa 'yan Adam sun daidaita da waɗannan HCoVs huɗu.
en-mt: In a way, it could be true that humans have adapted to these four HCoVs.

sourceString: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
targetString: Ta wata hanyar, duka biyun zasu iya kasancewa daga rayuwar tsoffin anoban HCoV.
en-mt: Alternatively, both could be from the survival of former HCoV infections.

sourceString: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
targetString: HCoVs waɗanda ke haifar da mummunan cututtuka a cikin mutane da mutane waɗanda suka kamu da mummunan cututtukan HCoV an kawar dasu.
en-mt: HCoVs that cause severe disease in humans and people who have been infected with severe HCoV disease have been eliminated.

sourceString: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
targetString: Domin wannan ya faru, HCoVs na bukatar su rubanya a cikin mutane zuwa isasshen mataki don ba da damar tattaruwar maye gurbi da zai ci galabar dalilan ƙuntatawa na mafaka.
en-mt: For this to happen, HCoVs need to multiply in humans to a sufficient degree to allow the accumulation of mutations that will overcome the reasons for the asylum restriction.

sourceString: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
targetString: Ta wannan hanyar, tsawon lokacin fashewa da SARS-CoV-2 ya ci gaba kuma mutane da yawa suna cutar dashi, mafi girma damar cewa zai cikakken daidaita da ga mutane.
en-mt: In this way, the longer the outbreak of SARS-CoV-2 continues and the more people it infects, the greater the chance that it will fully adapt to humans.

sourceString: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
targetString: Idan har ta samu gindin zama sosai, yaduwarta tsakanin mutum zuwa mutum zai zama da matukar wahala ta hanyar killacewa ko kuma sauran matakan kare bazuwar cuta.
en-mt: If it becomes well established, its spread from person to person will be very difficult through containment or other measures to prevent the spread of disease.

sourceString: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
targetString: Shekaru da yawa, al'umma huɗu sun samo CoVs suna kewayawa cikin yawan mutane, yana haifar da sanyin mura cikin kwararun masun garkuwa.
en-mt: Over the years, four nations have found CoVs circulating in the human population, causing colds in infected hosts.

sourceString: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
targetString: Wadannan kwayoyin cutar basa bukatar zama a jikin mutum ko dabba.
en-mt: These bacteria do not need to live in the human or animal body.

sourceString: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
targetString: Sabanin haka, SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV masu sanya cuta ba su daidaita da mutane ba da kyau kuma yaduwarsu a mutane ba za a iya cigaba da shi ba.
en-mt: In contrast, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV pathogens do not adapt well to humans and their spread in humans cannot be sustained.

sourceString: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
targetString: Suna da bukatar ci gaba da rayuwa a jikin dabbobin da ke dauke da su domin su sami damar shiga jikin mutane ta hanyar mutum guda ko fiye da samo ta daga dabbobin.
en-mt: They need to continue living in the bodies of the animals that carry them so that they can enter the human body through one or more people who get it from the animals.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: Cutar SARS-CoV-2 tana da kamanni irin na cutar SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV da kuma sauran masu dauke da nau’in cutar HCoVs.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and other HCoVs.

sourceString: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
targetString: Wannan abu ne da za'a iya yaduwa sosai kamar kamuwar HCOVs a cikin al'umma, aƙalla a lokacin da muke a ciki.
en-mt: This is something that can spread as much as HCOVs in the community, at least in our time.

sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: Duk da haka, ya fi zaman mai daukar kwayar cuta fiye da al’uma da aka sami HCoVs kuma ƙasa da mai daukar kwayar cutan fiye da SARS-CoV ko MERS-CoV.
en-mt: However, it is more infectious than community-acquired HCoVs and less infectious than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: Ya rage a gani ko zai iya dacewa da mutane sosai kuma ya kewaya cikin mutane ba tare da wurin ajiya ba ko mafaka ta tsakiya a jikin dabbobi.
en-mt: It remains to be seen whether it can adapt well to humans and circulate in humans without a central storage or refuge in the animal body.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: Kafin tattauna asalin dabbobin dabbobi na HCoVs, zai taimaka mana sosai mu tattauna kan ma’anoni da halayen juyin halitta, na halitta, tafki, matsakaici da haɓaka mafakar HCoVs.
en-mt: Before discussing the animal origin of HCoVs, it will be helpful to discuss the definitions and characteristics of the evolution, natural, reservoir, medium and development of the shelter of HCoVs.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Dabba da ta zama wata mafaka ta juyin halitta ta HCoV idan ta tanadi asalin magabata mai kusanci wadda suke babban kama ta haɗin dangantaka a matakin jerin nucleotide.
en-mt: An animal would have been an evolutionary refuge for HCoV if it harbored a closely related ancestor that was highly similar by linkage at the nucleotide sequence level.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: Kwayar cutar ta asali galibi ana rayuwa da ita kuma bata zama illa ga inda dama take rayuwa.
en-mt: The original virus is usually living with it and is not harmful to the environment where it lives.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: Hakanan, mai yin tafki mai tashar jiragen ruwa HCoV yana ci gaba kuma tsawon lokaci.
en-mt: Also, the reservoir that harbors HCoV is persistent and long-lasting.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: A dukkan halayen, masu rukunin suna kamuwa da cuta ta dabi'a kuma sune ainihin rukunin HCoV ko ƙwayar mahaifa.
en-mt: In all cases, hosts are naturally infected and are the original host of HCoV or host virus.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: Sabanin haka, idan sabon HCoV ya gabatar da sabon matsakaici a gabanin ko a kusa da gabatarwar sa ga mutane, ba a daidaita shi da sabon mai masaukin ba kuma yawanci shine pathogenic.
en-mt: In contrast, if a new HCoV introduces a new medium before or around its introduction to humans, it is not adapted to the new host and is usually pathogenic.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: Wannan da kwayar cutar ta samu gindin zama jikinsa, zai iya zama tushen da cutar da za ta shafa kuma ya taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen bai wa kwayar cutar damar ta hayayyafa inda za ta iya harbin dan adam daga nan.
en-mt: When the virus gets a foothold in his body, it can become the source of the disease and play an important role in giving the virus the opportunity to reproduce where it can attack humans from here.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: HCoV na iya yin gwajin cutar mutu-karshen idan har ba zai iya ci gaba da yada ta ba a cikin matsakaiciyar mai watsa shiri.
en-mt: HCoV can prove fatal if it cannot sustain its spread in an intermediate host.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: Sai dai wani abin da zai zama wanda ya saba da hakan, cutar HCoVs kan iya rayuwa jikin wani abu na daban kuma ya iya haifar da illar gaske da za ta dauki lokaci gabanin bayyanarta.
en-mt: But something that will be familiar to that, the disease HCoVs can live in the body of a different thing and can cause serious effects that will take time before its appearance.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: A nan kuma, wanda cutar ta kasance a jikinsa na karshe to zai zama wanda ainihin inda cutar ta samo asali tun da farko.
en-mt: Here again, the one who had the disease in his last body will be the one where the disease originated in the first place.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: Bayanan cututtukan dabbobi sun bayyana bita da kullun cewa yanayin binciken SARS yana da tarihin hulɗa tare da dabbobin wasa.
en-mt: Animal epidemiology reports have revealed that the SARS outbreak has a history of contact with game animals.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: Binciken seroprevalence mai zuwa ya nuna cewa yan kasuwar dabbobi sun sami karuwar SARS-CoV IgG idan aka kwatanta da na sauran jama'a.
en-mt: The following seroprevalence analysis showed that livestock traders had increased SARS-CoV IgG compared to the general population.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: Dabbobin civet masu rufaffen tafi (Paguma larvata) da karen racoon dake cikin kasuwancin dabbobi su ne aka fara ganowa suna ɗauke da ƙwayoyin cuta masu kama da wadanda suke kusan iri ɗaya ne ga SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Coated civets (Paguma larvata) and raccoons in the pet trade were the first to be found to carry viruses that are nearly identical to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: Wannan ya tallafawa kai tsaye ta hanyar cewa ba a sake samun ƙarin rahoton SARS ba bayan kashe duk wasu dabbobin Sivets cikin kasuwannin.
en-mt: This is directly supported by the fact that there were no further reports of SARS after killing all the Civets in the markets.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Duk da haka, an ba da rahoton cewa dabban itacen giginya wato civets daga cikin daji ko gonaki ba tare da fuskantar kasuwannin dabbobi masu rai ba sun kasance da cutar SARS-CoV ba, wadda ke nunar da cewa civets masu rufaffen tafi watakila kawai su zama mafakar tsakiya mai fadadawa ga SARS-CoV amma ba mafakan sa ba.
en-mt: However, it has been reported that wild civets from the wild or farms without exposure to live animal markets have not been infected with SARS-CoV, which suggests that civets with closed paws may only be an expanding central reservoir for SARS-CoV but not its reservoirs.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: Musamman ma, tunda kashi 80% na dabbobi daban-daban a cikin kasuwanni a Guangzhou suna da rigakafin SARS-CoV da yiwuwar cewa yawancin nau'in kananan dabbobi masu shayarwa suma zasu iya zama matsakaicin fadada rundunonin SARS-CoV ba za'a iya cire su ba.
en-mt: In particular, since 80% of different animals in markets in Guangzhou have SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibility that many types of small mammals can also be the medium for the expansion of SARS-CoV hosts cannot be ruled out. they are not.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Dukkanin wadannan sun kasance inda cutar SARS-CoV take mutuwa a jikinsu.
en-mt: All of these were where the SARS-CoV virus died in their bodies.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: Bincike mai zuwa don rundunar dabba ta SARS-CoV sun nuna wata jemage mai zaman kusa da CoV da ake kira SARS-Jemagen Rhinolophus CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-JemageCoV HKU3), wanda yake a cikin jikunan dawakai na kasar Sin.
en-mt: Subsequent studies for the animal host of SARS-CoV have shown a bat-like CoV called SARS-Rh-Bat Rhinolophus CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which is present in the bodies of horses in China.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: Wadannan jemagun suna dauke da kwayoyin halitta masu maganin SARS-CoV da kwayoyin tsuhen halitta masu ajin SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
en-mt: These bats carry SARS-CoV antibodies and SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3 antibodies.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Wannan da sauran CoVs na jemagu suna da nasaba kashi 88-92% ta jerin kwayoyin nucleotide tare da SARS-CoV.
en-mt: This and other bat CoVs are 88-92% related by nucleotide sequence to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: Wadannan karatuttukan sun aza harsasai ga sabuwar manufar da jemagu ke karbar bakuncin cututtukan dan adam.
en-mt: These studies shed light on the new concept of bats as hosts for human diseases.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: Yawancin CoVs (SL-CoVs) masu kama da SARS an kuma gano su daga jemagu, amma babu wani idan ba guda kawai da aka tsara WIV1 da za a iya warewa a zaman ƙwayar cuta mai rai.
en-mt: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none but one designated WIV1 can be isolated as a live virus.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kayan mutum wanda yake canza enzyme 2 (ACE2) an san shi mai karɓar SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Human factor converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor for SARS-CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: Kwayar WIV1 da aka samo daga kashin jemagu an yi amfani da shi ne a jemagen da kyanwa da kuma ACE2 na mutum a matsayin masu karbar kwayar halittar.
en-mt: The WIV1 gene derived from bat bone has been used in bats and cats and human ACE2 as gene receptors.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: Abin ban sha'awa, fama da cutar SARS wanda suna samun sauki sun iya wargazawar WIV1.
en-mt: Interestingly, the SARS virus that they were recovering from was able to destroy WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: Har zuwa yau, WIV1 tana wakiltar asalin magabata na SARS-CoV a cikin jemage, yana kamanni mataki na 95% nucleotide jerin homology.
en-mt: To date, WIV1 represents the original ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing a level of 95% nucleotide sequence homology.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Duk da haka, akwai babban tsarin alaƙa tsakanin waɗannan ƙwayoyin cuta guda biyu, gabaɗaya an yi imanin cewa WIV1 ba ƙwayar cuta ce ta iyaye na nan take na SARS-CoV kuma jemagu ba shine reshe na kai tsaye na SARS-CoV ba.
en-mt: However, there is a strong relationship between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parent virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the direct branch of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: Binciken ƙwayar Phylogenetic ta mahaɗar MERS-CoV zuwa rukuni guda na Jemage CoV-HKU4 da baton CoV-HKU5.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis of MERS-CoV clustering into the same group of bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: CoV-HKU4 na jemage da MERS-CoV suna yin amfani da mai karɓa guda, da dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), don shigowar ƙwayar cutar virus.
en-mt: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV use the same receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for viral entry.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: Jerin kwayoyin halittar RNA-dependent da kuma na miyau RNA suna daga cutar MERS-CoV suna kama ne da jemagun da ake gani a nahiyar Turai da kuma Afirka.
en-mt: The sequence of RNA-dependent and negative RNA genes from MERS-CoV are similar to bats found in Europe and Africa.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: Har ya zuwa maganan nan da muke yanzu, babu wata alamar kwayar cutar MERS-CoV da take rayuwa a jikin jemagun daji.
en-mt: To date, there is no evidence of MERS-CoV living in wild bats.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: Kwayar cutar MERS-CoV da kuma wacce tafi kama da ita ta jemage mai suna CoV-HKU25 suna da nasaba ta kashi 87% a kwayoyin halittarsu masu kamanceceniya da juna.
en-mt: MERS-CoV and its bat counterpart CoV-HKU25 are 87% genetically identical.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Don haka jemagu watakila ba sune ke dauke da kwayar cutar MERS-CoV.
en-mt: So bats may not be carrying the MERS-CoV virus.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: A gefe guda, bincike a Gabas ta Tsakiya ya nuna cewa raƙuman masu tozo guda suna da matsalar virus ga ƙwayoyin magance ƙwayoyin cuta na MERS-CoV, daidai da raƙuman masu asalin daga gabas ta Tsakiya wadanda ke cikin ƙasashen Afirka da yawa.
en-mt: On the other hand, research in the Middle East has shown that raccoons are more susceptible to MERS-CoV antibodies, similar to raccoons of Middle Eastern origin in many African countries.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: MERS-CoV mai raye daidai ne da cutar da aka samu a cikin mutane an ware ta daga kwarfatar hanci na raƙuman maso tozo guda, wanda ke cigaba da nuna cewa rakuma suna aiki a matsayin taskar mafaka ta MERS-CoV.
en-mt: A live MERS-CoV equivalent to the disease found in humans was isolated from the nasal cavity of a single camel, further suggesting that camels act as a reservoir of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: Hakanan abin lura ne cewa yawancin alamu masu saukin kai amma an lura da zubar da kwayar cutar a cikin raƙuma na gwaji yayin kamuwa da MERS-CoV.
en-mt: It is also noteworthy that many mild symptoms but shedding of the virus was observed in experimental camels during MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: Musamman, raƙuma masu kamuwa da cuta suna zubar da ƙwayoyin cuta ba kawai ta hanyar numfashi ba amma har ma ta hanyar fecal-na baka, wanda kuma shine babban hanyar cutar zubar da kwari daga jemagu.
en-mt: In particular, infected camels shed the virus not only by breathing but also by fecal-oral route, which is also the main way of shedding the virus from bats.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: Koyaya, tambayoyi har yanzu suna kasancewa tunda masu kamuwa da MERS su da yawa sun tabbatar da cewa ba su da tarihin hulɗa da raƙuma kafin farawa samun alamar cuta, wanda ake dangantawa watsuwa tskanin mutum-zuwa-mutum ko ta hanyoyi da ba a sani ba wadanda suka shafi nau'in dabbobi da ba a gano su ba wadanda suke dauke da MERS-CoV.
en-mt: However, questions still remain since many MERS-infected people have proven to have no history of contact with camels before becoming symptomatic, which is attributed to person-to-person contact or through unknown routes. those related to animal species that have not been identified as carriers of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 na raba kashi 96.2% na nucleotide homology tare da wata bature CoV RaTG13 da aka ware daga jemagun affinis Rhinolophus.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% of nucleotide homology with a European CoV RaTG13 isolated from bats Rhinolophus affinis.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: Kamar yadda ya faru da SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV, rarrabewa tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da RaTG13 ya yi girma da yawa don sanya dangantakar iyaye.
en-mt: As with SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the differences between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are too great to establish a parentage relationship.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: Abin nufi shine, jemagu bazai kasance mai masaukin na kai tsaye na SARS-CoV-2 ba sai dai idan an samo kusan kwatankwacin batutuwan CoVs masu zuwa nan gaba.
en-mt: The point is, bats may not be the direct host of SARS-CoV-2 unless similar cases of CoVs are found in the future.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: Wataƙila, rundunan dabbobi masu matsakaici na SARS-CoV-2 ya kamata ya kasance cikin nau'in namun daji da aka sayar kuma an kashe shi a Kasuwar sayar da abincin teku, wanda yawancin farkon damuwar COVID-19 suke da alaƙa, alamu ne na yiwuwar watsawar cutan daga dabbobi-zuwa-mutum.
en-mt: Perhaps, the host of medium-sized animals of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the species of wild animals sold and killed in the seafood market, which many of the early concerns of COVID-19 are related to, are signs of the possibility of animal-to-human transmission.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Yawancin binciken da aka yi kwanan nan dangane da jerin hanyoyin metagenomic sun nunar da wasu ƙananan dabbobi masu shayarwa dake haɗarin bata, wadanda aka sani da pangolins (Manis javanica) suna iya kasancewa masu dauke da magabata beta-CoVs wanda ya dangantaka da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: A number of recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have shown that some endangered small mammals, known as pangolins (Manis javanica) may be carrying precursor beta-CoVs that are related to SARS-CoV. -2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Wadannan sabbin kwayoyin genome na pangolin CoV suna hadakar kwayoyin genomes 85-92% na tsarin kwayoyin nucleotide homology tare da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: These new pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% sequence nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Ko yaya, suna da alaƙa da RaTG13 da kusan kasha 90 bisa dari Asali a matakin nucleotide.
en-mt: However, they are related to RaTG13 by about 90 percent Original at the nucleotide level.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: Suna tattaruwa cikin sassan biyu na SARS-CoV-2-kamar ƙwayoyin cuta a cikin bishiyar phylogenetic, ɗayan wanda ya raba yanki mai ɗaukar nauyi mai rikodin mai karɓa (RBD) tare da SARS-CoV-2, tare da 97.4% shaidar asalin jerin amino asid.
en-mt: They cluster into two groups of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which shares the receptor-binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% sequence identity amino acid.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: Ko yaya dai, yawan maye gurbi RBDs na SARS-CoVs-2 da RaTG13 su na daban-daban kusan sau miliyan ne fiye da wanda ke daukar su.
en-mt: However, the number of mutations in the RBDs of SARS-CoVs-2 and RaTG13 is about a million times different than the one carrying them.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
