targetString: Wani binciken da ya gabata a kan pangolins masu cutuka shi ma ya ba da labarin gano alamun kwayar cutar virus daga samfuran huhu, wanda ya yi kama da masu alaƙa da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: A previous study on infected pangolins also reported the detection of viral markers from lung samples, which were similar to those related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: Wannan binciken ya karɓi hanyoyi daban-daban na haɗuwa da kundin jagora don samar da jerin abubuwan genome wanda ya ƙunshi kimanin kashi 86.3% na cikakkiyar ƙwayoyin cuta ta genome.
en-mt: This study adopted different methods of assembly of the guide book to produce a genome sequence that contains about 86.3% of the complete bacterial genome.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ba za mu kawar da yiwuwar cewa dabbar pangolin din tana daga cikin dabbobin da suke dauke da kwayar cutar SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: We cannot rule out the possibility that the pangolin is one of the animals that carry the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Duk da haka, a halin yanzu babu wata shaida a cikin goyon bayan asalin pangolin kai tsaye na SARS-CoV-2 saboda rarrabewar jerin tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da pangolin hadedeyar-SARS-CoV-2 da beta-CoVs.
en-mt: However, there is currently no evidence in support of the direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the distinct sequence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin-SARS-CoV-2 and beta-CoVs.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Kari akan haka, nisan da ke tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da RaTG13 ya fi guntu fiye da wancan tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da pangolin SARS-CoV-2 masu hade da beta-CoVs.
en-mt: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV-2 pangolins associated with beta-CoVs.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: Rikidar cutar SARS-CoV-2 a jikin jemagu da kuma dabbobin pangolin da ma sauransu ya zama wani abi da za a kafa hujja kansa.
en-mt: The spread of SARS-CoV-2 in the body of bats and pangolins, among others, is something to be proven.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: Ganin cewa mafi girman jerin kwayoyin an samo cikin RBDs tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-beta-CoVs, beta-CoVs masu alaka da SARS-CoV-2 da RaTG13 suna kama mafi girma a jerin kwayoyin halittar jini.
en-mt: Whereas the largest sequence of genes is found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-beta-CoVs, beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 capture the largest sequence of genes blood.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: Abun hasashe ne babba cewa girman matsayin dake kamance tsakanin RBDs na pangolin SARS-CoV-2-beta-CoV-beta da SARS-CoV-2 ana haifar da shi ne ta hanyar juyin halitta wanda yake rikidewa.
en-mt: It is highly hypothesized that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of the pangolin SARS-CoV-2-beta-CoV-beta and SARS-CoV-2 is caused by evolutionary change.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: Neman shawara ya dace da sake hadewa tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da aka hada da beta-CoV da RaTG13 a cikin dabbobin daji na uku.
en-mt: The search is compatible with the recombination between SARS-CoV-2 combined with beta-CoV and RaTG13 in third wild animals.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: A matsayin ƙarfin tuki a cikin juyin halitta, sake haɗa abubuwa da ke yaɗuwa sosai tsakanin beta-CoVs.
en-mt: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is highly prevalent among beta-CoVs.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Har yanzu masu yanke hukunci suna kan asalin SARS-CoV-2 na zoonotic.
en-mt: The verdict is still out on the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: Idan ka cire batun rikidar kwayar cutar HcoVs data samo asali daga jikin dabbobi an kuma nazarci na’ukan HCoV-229E da HCoV-OC43 da HCoV-NL63 da HCoV-HKU1.
en-mt: If you remove the issue of the complexity of HcoVs virus data originating from animal bodies, HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 types have also been analyzed.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Shaidar ilimin halittun dabbobi ya nuna cewa duka HCoV-NL63 da HCoV-229E za su iya samo asali ne daga jemage CoVs, yayin da aka sami ƙwayoyin cuta na iyaye na HCoV-OC43 da HCoV-HKU1 a cikin beraye.
en-mt: Animal biology evidence suggests that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E may have originated from bat CoVs, while the parent viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 were found in mice.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: An ba da rahoton cewa wata CoV ta jemage da ake kira ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) wacce aka gano a jemage mai kala uku a Arewacin Amurka ta sami dangantaka mai kusanci da HCoV-NL63.
en-mt: It has been reported that a bat CoV called ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) found in the three-colored bat in North America is closely related to HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: A wata gefe guda, HCoV-229E yana da alaƙar alaƙa da wani jigon CoV, ana kiran shi Hipposideros / GhanaKwam / 19/2008, wanda aka gano a Gana, yayin da kuma ana zargin raƙumin a matsayin mai ba da taimakon sa.
en-mt: On the other hand, HCoV-229E is closely related to another CoV strain, called Hipposideros / GhanaKwam / 19/2008, which was discovered in Ghana, while the camel is also suspected as its donor.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: Don ba da haske, ilimin zamani game da asalin dabbobi na sananniyar HCoVs an taƙaita su a cikin Hoto na 1 da Tebur 2.
en-mt: To provide clarity, the current knowledge about the animal origin of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure 1 and Table 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: Nazarin Phylogenetic ya ba da hujja ga abubuwan da suka faru na watsa abubuwan HCoV a cikin tarihin.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis provides evidence for the transmission events of HCoV throughout history.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: Lokacin da HCoV-OC43 ya haɗu da jinsin don cutar da mutane daga dabbobin gida a shekarar 1890, an yi rikodin annoba ta numfashi.
en-mt: When HCoV-OC43 joined the genus to infect humans from domestic animals in 1890, a respiratory epidemic was recorded.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: Tarihin yaduwar cutar HCoV-229E ba wani karin haske sosai a kansa.
en-mt: The history of the spread of HCoV-229E is not very clear.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: An gano kwayar cutar daga jemage CoVs wacce ta yi kama sosai da cutar HCoV-229E.
en-mt: A strain of bat CoVs has been identified that closely resembles HCoV-229E.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: Tsakanin su akwai alpha mai suna 'alpaca-CoV.
en-mt: Among them is an alpha named 'alpaca-CoV'.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: Akwai hujjoji da dama da suke nuna cewa cutar ta yadu ne daga jemagu kai tsaye zuwa jikin dan adam.
en-mt: There is a lot of evidence that shows that the disease is spread from bats directly to the human body.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: Da farko, mutane amma ba almasas ba zasu iya hulɗa da jemagu a cikin raba kimiyyar muhalli.
en-mt: First, humans but not diamonds can interact with bats in sharing environmental science.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Maimakon haka, mutane suna kusanci da alpacas.
en-mt: Instead, people get closer to alpacas.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Na biyu, HCoV-229E mai hade da batutuwan al-CoVs suna da bambanci kuma marasa tsari a cikin jemagu, alhali kuwa Alpha-CoV ya haifar da barkewar cutar ta hanu a cikin dabbobi masu kamuwa.
en-mt: Second, HCoV-229E and related al-CoVs are heterogeneous and unregulated in bats, whereas alpha-CoV has caused outbreaks of influenza in infected animals.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: A ƙarshe, ba a sami alpaca alpha-CoV ba a cikin dabbobin feral.
en-mt: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Don haka, baza a kawar da tunanin yiyuwar cutar HCoV-229E ta samo asali ne daga kwayoyin halittar CoV daga dan jikin dan adam.
en-mt: Therefore, the possibility that HCoV-229E originated from CoV genes from a human body cannot be ruled out.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Hakika, jemagu sune tushen kai tsaye na ƙwayoyin cuta na mutum wanda ya haɗa da kwayar cutar rabies, ƙwayar cutar Ebola, ƙwayar cutar Nipah da ƙwayar cutar Hendra.
en-mt: In fact, bats are a direct source of human viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: Don haka ba abin mamaki bane cewa jemagu na iya yada HCoV-229E ga mutane kai tsaye.
en-mt: It is therefore not surprising that bats can directly transmit HCoV-229E to humans.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: A wata hanya, yayin da alpha-CoVs suna aiki ne a matsayin hanyar samar da hanyar HCoV-229E, alpacas da raƙuman ruwa na iya zama matsakaiciyar runduna waɗanda ke aika ƙwayoyin cuta ga mutane, daidai kamar yadda yake a cikin yanayin MERS-CoV.
en-mt: In another way, while alpha-CoVs act as a source of HCoV-229E, alpacas and giraffes can be intermediate hosts that transmit the virus to humans, just as in the case of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: MERS-CoV ya zama wani kyakkyawan misali game da watsa sadarwa daga jemage zuwa raƙuman dabbobi da kuma raƙumi zuwa ga mutane.
en-mt: MERS-CoV is a good example of transmission from bats to raccoons and camels to humans.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: Asalin juyin halitta na MERS-CoV daga jemagu an san shi a farkon ganowarsa kuma ya sami ƙarfafuwa sakamakon binciken da ya biyo baya.
en-mt: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats was known at the time of its discovery and has been reinforced by subsequent studies.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: A fili take cewa jemagu sune matattarar da ke dauke da cututtukan da za su iya yada su daga dabbobi zuwa mutane.
en-mt: It is clear that bats are the carriers of diseases that can spread from animals to humans.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: Dogon lokaci, dauloli masu cike da tarin yawa, kusanci da zamantakewa da kuma karfin ƙarfi don tashi duka yanayi ne da ya dace da jemage don zama kyakkyawan 'mai yada kwayoyin cutar.
en-mt: Long periods of time, dense colonies, social proximity and the ability to fly are all ideal conditions for a bat to be a good 'spreader' of the virus.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: A wata gefe guda, MERS-CoV an gabatar dashi ga raƙuman dromedary shekaru da yawa.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for many years.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Ya dace da waɗannan raƙuma waɗanda suka juya daga matsakaici mai ban sha'awa zuwa barikin mai tsaro da na ɗabi'a na dabi'a.
en-mt: It is suitable for these camels that have turned from an interesting medium to a guard barracks and of natural behavior.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: MERS-CoV yana haifar da ciwo mai laushi kuma yana riƙe da ƙarancin maye gurbi a cikin waɗannan dabbobi.
en-mt: MERS-CoV causes mild disease and retains very few mutations in these animals.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Bazuwarta zuwa mutane ya faru haka kwatsam kmua mutane sune inda cutar MERS-CoV ba za ta iya sake fita ba sakamakon yadda bai iya fita daga nan.
en-mt: Its spread to humans happened so suddenly that people are where the MERS-CoV disease can't get out again because it couldn't get out of here.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Ya bambanta da rawar raƙuma a cikin watsa MERS-CoV, rawar pangolins, idan akwai wani, a cikin watsawar SARS-CoV-2 ya bambanta.
en-mt: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: Musamman ma kwayoyin cutar jemagen pangolin beta-CoVs wanda sun fi rayuwa a jikin jemagun pangolins.
en-mt: Especially the beta-CoVs of pangolin bats which live in the body of pangolins.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Zasu iya zama mafakar karshe ga SARS-CoV-2-beta-CoVs masu dangantaka, da kama da dabbobin civets a yanayin SARS-CoV.
en-mt: They can be the last refuge for SARS-CoV-2-beta-CoVs related, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Yawancin yuwuwar watsuwa tsakanin jinsuna na SARS-CoV-2 daga dabbobi zuwa mutane dole ne a yi watsi da su ko a amince da su a nazari gaba.
en-mt: Many possible interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans must be ruled out or accepted in future studies.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Na farko, jemagu za su iya zama babban reshin raunin da ke da alaƙa da ƙwayar SARS-CoV-2 kusan iri ɗaya ce ga SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: First, bats can be the main branch of the virus associated with SARS-CoV-2 virus is almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Yan-Adam na iya hadakar muhalli tare da jemagu ta hanyar yankan nama ko kuma hakar kwal.
en-mt: Humans can interact with bats by cutting meat or mining coal.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: Na biyu, pangolins na iya zama ɗayan tsaka-tsakin fadadawa wanda aka gabatar da sabon ƙwayar cuta ta SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Second, pangolins may be one of the intermediates of expansion through which the new SARS-CoV-2 virus was introduced.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: Yan-Adam suna kamuwa da kwayar cutar ta fannin yanka da cin naman dabba.
en-mt: Humans are infected with the virus by slaughtering and eating animal meat.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Yana yiwuwa yawancin dabbobi masu shayarwa ciki har da dabbobin gida suna da saukin kamuwa da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It is possible that many mammals including pets are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Lallai ne akwai bukatar gudanar da wani bincike kan dabbobin cikin gida da kuma na dawa/daji domin kariya ga jiki.
en-mt: There is definitely a need to conduct some research on domestic and wild animals for the protection of the body.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Na uku, kamar yadda aka ambata a sama, sake sakewa da daidaitawa da SARS-CoV-2 na iya faruwa a cikin jinsin na uku wanda ke da alaƙa tare da jemage da kuma pangolins.
en-mt: Thirdly, as mentioned above, the replication and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 can occur in the third species that is related to bats and pangolins.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Binciken asalin SARS-CoV-2 daga dabba har yanzu ana kan yi.
en-mt: Research on the origin of SARS-CoV-2 from animals is still ongoing.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Baya ga mabanbanta dabbobin da ke daukar cutar, akwai wasu ababuwa uku muhimmai game da cutar wajen tsallakawa da halittun CoVs daga masu hana su fita.
en-mt: In addition to the different animals that carry the disease, there are three important factors about the disease in the cross-breeding of CoVs from those that prevent them from escaping.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Da farko dai, yawan adadin su na maye gurbi a cikin rabawar RNA.
en-mt: First of all, their number of mutations in the RNA distribution.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Idan aka kwatanta da sauran ƙwayoyin RNA guda ɗaya, masu ƙididdigar adadin maye gurbi na CoVs za'a iya ɗauka su azaman “Matsakaici” zuwa “babba” tare da matsakaicin sauyawa mai aiki wanda ya zama ~ 10-4 sauyawa a kowace shekara ta rukunin yanar gizon 2, gwargwadon tsarin karbuwa na CoV zuwa runduna mai labari.
en-mt: Compared to other single RNA molecules, the mutation rates of CoVs can be considered as “moderate” to “high” with an average active mutation that is ~10-4 mutations per group year website 2, according to the process of CoV acceptance to the host of the novel.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: CoVs suna da hujjar sake-karantar exoribonuclease, sharewa wanda yake haifar da babban rikitarwa sosai da rashiwa ko mara dorewa.
en-mt: CoVs have the proof of exoribonuclease re-reading, the deletion of which leads to a very high complication and lack or non-sustainability.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Sai dai abin sha’awa a nan, asalin halittar cutar wanda galibi yake takura kwayar CoV ta hanyar haduwa da miyau ta sinadaran RNA.
en-mt: But what is interesting here is the genetic background of the virus that usually restricts the CoV virus by interacting with the saliva through RNA molecules.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: Remdesivir yana daya daga cikin masu ba da rigakafin maganin SARS-CoV-2 da za a gwada su a gwajin asibiti.
en-mt: Remdesivir is one of the SARS-CoV-2 vaccines to be tested in clinical trials.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Ko yaya dai, yawan maye gurbi na CoVs ya ninka sau miliyan sama da na ƙungiyar sojojinsu.
en-mt: However, the mutation rate of CoVs is a million times higher than that of their host group.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Bugu da kari, yawan maye gurbi yakan zama mafi girma yayin da CoVs ba su dace da mai zama da su ba.
en-mt: In addition, mutation rates tend to be higher when CoVs are incompatible with the host.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Idan aka kwatanta da SARS-CoV da babban maye gurbi, adadin maye gurbi na SARS-CoV-2 na kasa sosai, bayar da shawarar mafi girman matakin karbuwa ga mutane.
en-mt: Compared to SARS-CoV and the high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is very low, suggesting a higher level of tolerance to humans.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Wataƙila, an riga an saba da shi ga wata mai zama da cutar da ke kusa da mutane.
en-mt: Perhaps, it is already familiar to the moon living with the disease that is close to people.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Baya ga SARS-CoV-2, wannan kuma ya shafi MERS-CoV, wanda ya dace da raƙuma masu tozo guda.
en-mt: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is compatible with camels.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: A ka’idodi, ba lallai bane cewa tsaran kwayoyin halitta zai iya samar da alluran rigakafi da rigakafi akan SARS-CoV-2 marasa tasiri da sauri.
en-mt: In principle, it is not necessary that genetic engineering can quickly produce vaccines and vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Na biyu kuma, babbar kwayar halittar RNA a jikin cutar CoVs ya nuna asalin sauyawa da rikida da tushen kwayoyin halitta suke yi, wanda hakan ke kara haifar da bazuwarsu tsakanin halittu wanda ya taimaka wajen bullar cututtukan CoVs masu shuhura a lokacin da suka samu dacewar yanayin da suke so.
en-mt: Second, the large RNA genome of CoVs has shown a genetic mutation, which increases their spread between organisms, which has contributed to the emergence of the famous CoVs when they find the right environment. that they want.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Wannan yana da goyan bayan yalwar budaddun faifan karatu na musamman da amfanin furotin mai lamba ta wurin ƙarshen 3′ na genome.
en-mt: This is supported by the abundance of unique open reading frames and the use of protein coding by the 3′ end of the genome.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Na uku, Covs na iya canza jiki barkatai da akai-akai lokacin rabuwar RNA ta hanyar “kwafin-zabi” na musamman.
en-mt: Third, Covs can physically and repeatedly change RNA splicing through a unique "copy-selective" mechanism.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: A cikin mafakar da take zama wurin gaurayuwa, canzawar sassa yana faruwa akai-akai a lokacin kwafar CoV RNA.
en-mt: In the shelter that serves as a mixing point, cell turnover occurs frequently during CoV RNA replication.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: Cigaba da cikakken-tsawon da bangarn genomic na RNAs mai sake haduwa don samar da sabbin abubuwan CoV.
en-mt: Development of full-length and genomic fragments of recombinant RNAs to generate new CoV isolates.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: An samu shaidar asalin halitta daga yadda aka halicce take a jikin duka HCoV-HKU1 da kuma HCoV-OC43, har ma da jikin dabbobi CoVs kamar su jemagu SL-CoV da batCoV-HKU9.
en-mt: Evidence of genetic origin has been obtained from the replication of both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Mu’amalar kwayar cuta daga inda take zama da kuma na yadda take bazuwa.
en-mt: The interaction of a virus from where it lives and how it spreads.

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Baya ga abubuwa guda uku da aka ambata a sama game da kwayar cutar, hulɗar kwayar cuta tare da mafaka mai karba wani abu ne dake tasiri akan watsuwa tsakanin jinsunar kwayar halittar.
en-mt: In addition to the three factors mentioned above about the virus, the interaction of the virus with the host host is another factor that affects the stability of the genetic material.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Anan, an sake haɗawa da SARS-CoV a zaman misali na yau da kullum, wanda kuma ya nuna tabbataccen zaɓi na ɗabi'a yayin watsuwa tsakanin jinsuna.
en-mt: Here, SARS-CoV was reintroduced as a common example, which also demonstrated positive behavioral selection during interspecific transmission.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Ta la'akari da gwajin kwatanci tsakanin keɓaɓɓun abu na SARS-CoVs din ɗan-adam da civet, Ana tunanin SARS-CoV zai iya yin saurin daidaituwa cikin mafaka daban-daban, musamman tare da maye gurbi a cikin furotin RBD na S.
en-mt: Based on the comparative test between the isolates of SARS-CoVs of humans and civets, it is thought that SARS-CoV can adapt quickly in different shelters, especially with mutations in the RBD protein of S.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Gabaɗaya, RBD a cikin furotin na S na CoV yana hulɗa tare da tantanin halita mai karban sako da mai martini abin kare jiki.
en-mt: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of CoV interacts with the host cell and the immune system.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: A cikin SARS-CoV, RBD yana cikin 318th zuwa 510 na amino acid din akan gungun S1, wanda ya daure wa dan Adam ACE2 kazalika hade da mai karban don shigar kwayar cuta.
en-mt: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is located in the 318th to 510 amino acids on the S1 group, which binds to human ACE2 as well as the receptor for virus entry.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: RBD na SARS-CoV yana da ikon sanin masu karɓar ACE2 na dabbobi daban-daban, gami da jemage, civet, bera da karen raccoon, wadda ke ba da izinin watsuwa tsakanin jinsuna kwayar cutar.
en-mt: The RBD of SARS-CoV has the ability to recognize the ACE2 receptors of different animals, including bats, civets, rats and raccoon dogs, which allows for cross-species transmission of the virus.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: A zahiri, amino acid guda 6 ne kawai da aka lura ya bambanta da na mutum kuma ƙwayar civet viral ta ware a cikin RBD kuma 4 daga cikinsu suna cikin motsi mai ɗaukar abubuwa don hulɗa da mai karɓar ACE2.
en-mt: In fact, only 6 amino acids were observed to be different from the human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them are in the transporter movement to interact with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: SARS-CoV na dabba Sivet yana da rikice-rikicen K479N da S487T a cikin RBD, wanda zai iya ƙara kusancin hulɗa da ma'adinin furotin tare da mai karɓar ACE2 na mutum.
en-mt: The animal SARS-CoV Civet has mutations K479N and S487T in the RBD, which can increase the close interaction of the protein mineral with the human ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: A takaice dai, wadannan maye gurbi na amino acid na iya zama mai matukar mahimmanci ga karbar kwayar cuta a jikin mutum.
en-mt: In other words, these amino acid mutations can be very important for the acceptance of the virus in the human body.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Abin lura ne cewa SARS-CoV-2 yana raba tantanin halita mai karban sako (cellular receptor) iri daya da SARS-CoV.
en-mt: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor as SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: Bambanci kashi 30% tsakanin SARS-CoV-2 da SARS-CoV a cikin sashin S1 na furotin S yana nuna cewa ƙarshen dangantakar S furotin da dan adam ACE2 zai iya canzawa.
en-mt: The 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 part of the S protein suggests that the end of the relationship between the S protein and human ACE2 may change.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Tabbas, binciken cryo-EM yana nuna dangantakar mafi girma ta 10 zuwa 20 daga wannan abin da aka ɗauka sama da wanda ke tsakanin ɗan adam na ACE2 da furotin na SARS-CoV S.
en-mt: Indeed, cryo-EM analysis shows a relationship 10 to 20 times higher from this factor than that between human ACE2 and the SARS-CoV S protein.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Hakanan zai kasance mai ban sha'awa don sanin ko za a buƙaci kowane sauran abokin karba don watsuwar SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It will also be interesting to know whether any other host will be needed for the spread of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: Mai ban sha'awa, HCoV-NL63 kuma yana ɗaure wa ACE2 amma tare da wani sashi na S.
en-mt: Interestingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with an S subunit.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Akwai sauran masu karɓar HCoV, kamar aminopeptidase N don HCoV-229E, da acid 9-O-acetylated sialic acid don HCoV-OC43.
en-mt: There are other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Zasu iya dauka nauyin samun nasarar daidaita wadatar waɗannan CoVs a cikin mutane bayan watsa nau'in halittu daga wurin dakaru dabbobin su.
en-mt: They may be responsible for successfully stabilizing the supply of these CoVs in humans after transmission of the species from their host animals.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Baya ga tantanin halita mai karban sako, sakamakon watsuwar HCoVs ta tsakanin jinsuna shi ma ana sarrafa shi ta hanyar sauran abubuwan dogaro na mafaka da abubuwan ƙuntatawa.
en-mt: In addition to the host cell, the outcome of the interspecies spread of HCoVs is also controlled by other host-dependent factors and constraints.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: Rarraba waɗannan sunadaran masu kariya tsakanin ɗan adam da rarar halitta na rukunin HCoVs kamar jemagu, raƙumi da bera na iya zama cikas ga watsawar ma'amala.
en-mt: The distribution of these protective proteins between humans and other biological groups of HCoVs such as bats, camels and rats may be a barrier to transmission.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: HCoVs dole su rinjayi dogaro kan mafaka sannan su fi karfin ƙuntatawar mafakarsu don nasarar watsuwa tsakanin jinsina daban-daban.
en-mt: HCoVs must overcome shelter dependence and overcome their shelter restrictions for successful interbreeding.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Dangane da wannan, masu fayyace kwayoyin halitta a wannan muhimmin fannin na hulɗar kwayar cuta da mafakarta sun kasance har yanzu ana gano su kuma za a iya sanin su.
en-mt: In this regard, the determinants of genes in this important aspect of the interaction between the virus and its host are still being identified and can be identified.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Binciken yanayin rashin daidaituwa game da dogaro na mafaka da abubuwan ƙuntatawa don SARS-CoV-2 ta amfani da fasahar zamani ta CRISPR na iya zama mai amfani.
en-mt: Analysis of the inconsistency of the refuge dependence and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using modern CRISPR technology may be useful.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: Fitowar HCoVs: Koma baya ga sifili
en-mt: Outbreak of HCoVs: Back to zero

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: Bambancin CoVs na jemage yana bayar da isasshe dama ga fitowar sabon HCoVs da ke daban.
en-mt: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunity for the emergence of new and different HCoVs.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Bisa wannan hujjar, cututtukan jemage na CoVs sune tushen cututtukan HCoVs.
en-mt: Based on this argument, bat-borne CoVs are the source of HCoVs.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Bugu da kari, saurin maye gurbi da sake halittar gado shima yana fitar da cigaban HCoV kuma yana zama matakai biyu masu mahimmanci a wannan aikin.
en-mt: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic reproduction also drive the development of HCoV and are two important steps in this process.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Alal misali, siyarwa ko asarar kwayoyin halittar furotin dana duniya suna da damar canza kwayar cutar kwayar halitta ta wata hanya.
en-mt: For example, the sale or loss of protein genes in the world have the potential to change the genetic code in some way.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Daga cikin furotin na kariya na SARS-CoV, ORF8 ana tsammanin yana da mahimmanci a cikin dacewa da mutane, kamar yadda SARS-CoV masu hade da ƙwayoyin cuta jemage wanda aka keɓancewa amma an sami sinadarai masu bambam da furotin na ORF8.
en-mt: Among the protective proteins of SARS-CoV, ORF8 is thought to be important in the adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV associated with bat viruses was isolated but chemically different from the protein of ORF8 was found.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: An gano rugujewar kwayar halittar 29 daga yanayin SARS-CoVs a jini a farkon lokacin da aka fara gano annobar a jikin dan adam.
en-mt: 29 gene mutations from SARS-CoVs were detected in the blood at the beginning of the outbreak in humans.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: Wannan sharewa ta shiga ORF8 zuwa ORF8a da ORF8b kuma ana zaton shine maye gurbi wanda yake inganta canjin mafaka.
en-mt: This deletion joins ORF8 to ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be a mutation that promotes cryptic transformation.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Bayan haka, SARS-CoV yana da yiwuwar sake duba tarihin tare da layin alpha- da gamma-CoVs, inda aka gano yawancin adadin yankuna masu rarrafe a cikin polymrase ɗin RNA da suke dogara da RNA.
en-mt: After that, SARS-CoV has the possibility to review the history with the lines of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of crawling regions were found in the RNA polymerase that depends on RNA.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: An kuma gano wuraren sake canzawa a cikin nsp9, mafi yawan nsp10, da kuma sassan nsp14.
en-mt: Transcription sites have also been identified in nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Hakanan, an nuna cewa annobar MERS-CoV ta sami abubuwan sake haduwa tsakanin layuka daban-daban, wanda ya faru a cikin raƙuman masu tozo guda a Saudiya.
en-mt: Also, it has been shown that MERS-CoV outbreaks have had recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in the same virus outbreaks in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: Gefen wannan SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV, an kuma lura da abubuwan sake maye a cikin wasu HCoVs, wanda HCoVs suka sake haɗuwa da wasu CoVs na dabba a cikin abubuwan halittar da basu da tsari.
en-mt: Beside this SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in some HCoVs, in which HCoVs have recombined with other animal CoVs in unorganized genetic elements.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Hakanan ya kamata a yi gargaɗin cewa zaɓin ɗan adam zai iya ba da gudummawa ga canje-canjen da ba a yi tsammani ba a kwayoyin halittar, wataƙila ana haifar da sauƙaƙe ƙwayoyin cuta daga matsanancin zaɓi, kamar su tsarin garkuwar jiki.
en-mt: It should also be warned that human selection can contribute to unexpected changes in genes, perhaps resulting from the simplification of viruses from extreme selection, such as the immune system.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Misalin waɗannan tasirin shine asarar cikakken tsawon ORF4 a cikin ƙwayar samfurin HCoV-229E, sakamakon shafewar nucleotide guda biyu.
en-mt: An example of these effects is the loss of the full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E model strain, resulting from two nucleotide deletions.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Duk da yake ana iya lura da ingantaccen ORF4 a cikin ƙwayoyin cutar jemage da raƙumi waɗanda ke da alaƙa da HCoV-229E, alpha-CoV ta rakumin alpaca yana nuna guda ɗaya na nucleotide, wanda ya haifar da sauyin frameshift.
en-mt: While a positive ORF4 can be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca camel alpha-CoV shows a single nucleotide, resulting in a frameshift mutation.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Daga ƙarshe amma ba ƙarami ba, juyin halittar sabbin HCoVs yana kuma faruwa ne ta hanyar matsi na zabin a cikin mafakar taskokinsu.
en-mt: Last but not least, the evolution of new HCoVs is also caused by selection pressure in their reservoirs.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Mai nuna ya kamu da cuta ko kawai bayyanar cututtuka ne aka gano yayin da Jemagu sun kamu da cuta na CoVs, yana nuna daidaitawar juna tsakanin CoVs da jemagu.
en-mt: Indicators of infection or only symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating a mutual correlation between CoVs and bats.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: Ta bayyana cewa jemagu sune matattarar kwayoyin halittar CoVs lura da yanayin jikinsu da kuma yadda gabobin jikin nasu ke aiki.
en-mt: She explained that bats are a genetic filter for CoVs observing their body condition and how their organs work.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Alal misali, lahani a cikin faifan martani na maganin kumburi-kumburi a cikin jemagu yadda yakamata ya rage cutarwar da CoVs tayi.
en-mt: For example, a defect in the inflammatory response in bats effectively reduces the virulence of CoVs.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Bayan haka, ayyukan kwayar halittar kisa a cikin jemagu tana lalacewa sakamakon hauhawar mai hana karbar kwayar halittar kisa NKG2/CD94 da ƙarancin matakin bayyana manyan kwayoyin halittun aji I hadaddu masu dacen jini.
en-mt: Furthermore, killer cell activity in bats is impaired by elevated levels of the killer cell receptor inhibitor NKG2/CD94 and low levels of expression of major class I hematopoietic complex genes.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Haka kuma, babban nau'in nau'in oxygen mai aiki (ROS) wanda aka samo asali daga ayyukan kwayoyi na jemagu na iya murkushe kwafin kwayar CoV kuma yana shafar karantawa ta hanyar karba-karba, ta haka ne samar da matsin zabi na tsararrakin kwayar cuta mai matukar birgeshi yayin gabatar da shi cikin sabon mai watsa shiri.
en-mt: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) produced by the drug activity of bats can suppress the replication of the CoV virus and affect the replication through the acceptor, thus creating a selective pressure of the generation. a highly virulent virus when introduced into a new host.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Haka kuma cututtukan CoV na pathogenic CoV na iya canzawa ta hanyar sake halittar, wanda ke haifar da sifofin furotin ko littafin fasalin furotin don karbuwa.
en-mt: Also, the pathogenic CoV can change through the process of reproduction, which causes the protein structure or the protein structure book to be adapted.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Don haka, babu wat hanya ba ne cewa uku na HCoVs sun fito a cikin shekaru ashirin da suka gabata.
en-mt: Therefore, there is no way that three HCoVs have emerged in the last two decades.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: CoVs ba cuta ba ne ko haifar karamin alamu cuta a cikin ɗakunan masu kamu da su kamar gemage da raƙuma.
en-mt: CoVs are not infectious or cause mild symptoms in infected hosts such as bats and camels.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: Suna iya rarrabawa sosai ba tare nuna garkuwar jiki daga mai zama da ciwon ba.
en-mt: They can spread widely without showing the immune system of the person living with the disease.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Anan ne aka samu sirrin me ya sa marasa nuna alamar kamuwa ake ganinsu da kuma abun da yake haifar da mummunan lamura a kamuwa da cutar a mutum.
en-mt: This is where the secret is found as to why those who do not show signs of infection are seen and what causes serious problems in the infection of a person.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Radadin alamun cutar suna faruwa ne sakamakon yadda kwayoyin halittar jikin mutum masu yaki da cuta suke kokarin yakar cutar wanda idan aka samu karfin nasu sosai hakan zai kuma yi illar gaske ga huhun mutum.
en-mt: The symptoms of the disease are caused by the body's immune system trying to fight the disease.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Sabanin haka, a cikin marasa nuna alamar kamuwa da cutar, amsa rigakafi ya kasance kasa ga yaduwar Cov.
en-mt: In contrast, in those not showing signs of infection, the immune response was weak against the spread of Cov.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: Dabarun iri daya ta raba cudanya da amsawar rigakafin iya samun sakamako masu amfani a cikin maganin anti-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: The same strategy that divides the immune response may have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 treatment.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: Amsar interferon tana da ƙarfi musamman a cikin jemagu.
en-mt: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Don haka, gudanar da nau'in I interferon aƙalla a farkon kamuwa da cutar SARS-CoV-2 a cikin ɗan adam ya kamata ya zama da amfani.
en-mt: Therefore, administration of type I interferon at least early in SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Bugu da Kari, kunnawar NLRP3 cikin jemagu na da illa.
en-mt: In addition, NLRP3 activation in bats is detrimental.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Lura da wannan dalilin, rayuwar kwayar halittar NLRP3 da kumburinsa da MCC950 zai yi tasiri wajen warkar cutar COVID-19.
en-mt: Considering this reason, the survival of the NLRP3 gene and its inflammation by MCC950 will have an effect on the cure of the disease of COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: Samuwar SARS-CoV-2 ya biyo bayan jigo ne wanda SARS-CoV da MERS-CoV suka tashi.
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 followed the outbreak of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ganin cewa wata beta-CoV raba 95% nucleotide homology tare da SARS-CoV, Hakanan akwai wanzuwar batirin-CoV wanda ke hade da kashi 96% na nucleotide homology tare da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Whereas a beta-CoV shares 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV, there is also the existence of a beta-CoV that shares 96% of nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Ganin cewa dabbar sivets da sauran dabbobi a cikin kasuwanni an same su dauke da ƙwayoyin cuta masu kama da SARS-CoV, ba a gano mafakar SARS-CoV-2 ta nan-kusa ba.
en-mt: Given that civets and other animals in the market have been found to be carrying viruses similar to SARS-CoV, no reservoir of SARS-CoV-2 has been identified nearby.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Pangolin beta-CoVs mai matukar alaƙar daidaituwa ga SARS-CoV-2 an samo, yana nuna cewa pangolins na iya zama ɗaya daga cikin tsaka-tsakin runduna ko pangolin beta-CoVs na iya ba da gudummawar gutsuttsuran jabu ga fasalin ƙarshe na SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Pangolin beta-CoVs highly related to SARS-CoV-2 were found, indicating that pangolins may be one of the intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs may contribute counterfeit fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV -2.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Kodayake tambayoyin suna wanzuwa, babu wata shaida da ke nuna cewa SARS-CoV-2 an yi mutum ne da gangan ko hadari.
en-mt: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 was intentionally or accidentally man-made.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: CoVs sun dawo zuwa haskakawa sakamakon barkewar kwanan nan na SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: CoVs have returned to the spotlight following the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: Nazarin cututtukan CoVs a jikin jemagu da sauran dabbobi ya sauya tunaninmu game da muhimmancin tushen cutar HcoVs ta samo asali ne daga jikin dabbobi wajen baza ta zuwa ga mutane.
en-mt: The study of CoVs in the body of bats and other animals has changed our thinking about the importance of the source of the disease HcoVs originated from the body of animals and did not reach humans.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Shaida da yawa ta nuna cewa SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV da SARS-CoV-2 suna da asalin batir kuma ana tura su ga mutane ta hanyar runduna ta tsakiya.
en-mt: A lot of evidence suggests that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are of bacterial origin and are transmitted to humans by host hosts.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Ganin cewa cutar SARS-CoV ta samo asali ne daga saduwa tsakanin mutane dabbar civets a cikin kasuwanni, rufe kasuwannin rigar da kashe biranen da ke faruwa na iya kawo karshen cutar ta SARS.
en-mt: Given that SARS-CoV originated from contact between people and civets in markets, closing down wet markets and killing cities where it occurs can end the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ta hanyar dalilai iri ɗaya, ya kamata a cire pangolins daga kasuwannin nama don hana watsa cuta daga dabba zuwa mutum, ta la'akari da binciken gano asalin cutar a pangolin da yawa daga beta-CoVs masu kusancin dangantaka da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: For the same reasons, pangolins should be removed from the meat market to prevent the transmission of the disease from animal to human, taking into account the discovery of the origin of the disease in pangolins from beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Koyaya, ko yaya kuma aka watsa SARS-CoV-2 ga mutane ta hanyar pangolins da sauran dabbobi masu shayarwa har yanzu za'a fayyace su a cikin binciken da za'a yi nan gaba.
en-mt: However, how SARS-CoV-2 was transmitted to humans by pangolins and other mammals remains to be elucidated in future studies.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: A gefe guda, MERS-CoV ya wanzu cikin rakuman larabawa.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV exists in Arabian camels.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Waɗannan raƙuma suna da mahimmanci ga kayan sufuri da kuma babban tushen nama, madara, fata da kayan ulu ga mutanen yankin.
en-mt: These camels are important for transportation and a major source of meat, milk, leather and woolen goods for the local people.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Suna nan ko ina a Gabas ta Tsakiya da Afirka.
en-mt: They are everywhere in the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Don haka, kusan abune da ba zai yiwuwa ba a ce a soke dukkan rakuma domin kawai a shawo kan cutar ta MERS, kamar dai yadda aka yi a kasuwar dabbobin dawa a qasar China domin shawo kan bazuwar cutar SARS-CoV da SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Therefore, it is almost impossible to cancel all camels just to control the MERS disease, as was done in the cattle market in China to control the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV- 2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Don dakatar da yawan yaduwar MERS, ya kamata a ɗauki cikakkiyar hanya don haɓaka rigakafin tasiri ga MERS-CoV don raƙuma, tare da sauran matakan kula da kamuwa da cuta.
en-mt: To stop the spread of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop an effective vaccine against MERS-CoV for camels, along with other infection control measures.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Kasancewar ba mu iya kawar da kwayoyin cututtukan nan ba, watakila a iya samun bullar sabbin kwayoyin halittan da za su haifar da bazuwar cututtuka.
en-mt: Since we have not been able to eradicate these diseases, there may be the emergence of new organisms that will cause random diseases.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: Yawancin CoV na zoonotic suna yaduwa a cikin daji.
en-mt: Most zoonotic CoVs are spread in the wild.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: Alal misali, cututtukan jemage na CoVs da suka samo asali daga jikin dabbobi suna nan birjik.
en-mt: For example, bat-borne CoVs that originated in animals are rare.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Akwai hujjoji da dama da ke nuna cewa cututtukan CoVs suna rayuwa tare da rikida zuwa cutar CoVs da take shafar dan adam cikin sauri kuma ta iya zama mai saurin kisa a nan gaba.
en-mt: There is a lot of evidence that CoVs are living and mutating into CoVs that are rapidly affecting humans and may be fatal in the future.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Ya kamata a watsar da al'adun cin namun daji a wasu wurare na China don rage hulɗa da ba ta dace tsakanin mutane da dabbobi.
en-mt: The culture of eating wild animals should be abandoned in some parts of China to reduce inappropriate contact between people and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Lura da yadda aka sha fama da cututtukan SARS da MERS da kuma COVID-19, lallai ne a yi shirin kwarai wajen tunkarar ta.
en-mt: Considering how SARS and MERS and COVID-19 have been dealt with, it is necessary to have a good plan to deal with it.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: A zahiri, ƙwayoyin cuta da yawa sun wanzu a cikin duniyar ta dogon lokaci.
en-mt: In fact, many viruses have existed in the world for a long time.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Suna zama a cikin ɗakunan ajiya na asali nasu har sai an sami damar yaduwa.
en-mt: They stay in their original warehouses until they have a chance to spread.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Kodayake jemagu suna da fasaloli da yawa waɗanda suka fi dacewa da yada ƙwayoyin cuta, damar da dan Adam zai iya hulɗa da jemagu da sauran nau'in dabbobin daji za a iya rage ta idan an ilmantar da mutane su nisanta da su.
en-mt: Although bats have many features that make them ideal for spreading viruses, the chance of human contact with bats and other wildlife can be reduced if people are educated to avoid them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Cigaba da sanya ido a cikin dabbobi masu shayarwa wajibi ne don kyakkyawar fahimtar yanayin ilimin halittu na CoVs da rundunonin su na halitta, wanda zai tabbatar da amfani wajen hana yaduwar dabbobi zuwa mutane da kuma barkewar gaba.
en-mt: Continued surveillance in mammals is necessary for a better understanding of the biology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing the spread of animals to humans and future outbreaks.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Hanya mafi sahihanci wajen kare bazuwar cututtuka daga jikin dabbobi zuwa mutane ita ce dan adam ya kaurace wa wadannan dabbobin da suke dauke da kwayoyin cututtukan.
en-mt: The most reliable way to prevent the spread of diseases from animals to humans is for humans to stay away from these animals that carry the disease.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Abubuwa da yawa a cikin wasan kwaikwayon game da asalin zoonotic na SARS-CoV-2 har yanzu sun ɓace.
en-mt: Many things in the show about the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Da farko, idan jemagu suna yada kwayar cutar magabata na SARS-CoV-2 zuwa pangolins, Zai zama abin ban sha'awa idan kaga irin yanayi da jemagu da kuma nau'ikan pangolins za su iya zamowa cikin muhalli iri daya.
en-mt: First of all, if bats spread the SARS-CoV-2 virus to pangolins, it will be interesting to see how bats and pangolins can live in the same environment.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Na biyu kuma, idan dai har jemagu suna taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen yada cutar zuwa mutane, yaya za a tabbatar da haduwar mutum da kuma jemagun.
en-mt: Second, if bats play an important role in spreading the disease to humans, how can the contact between humans and bats be confirmed?

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Na uku, idan dabbobi masu shayarwa na uku suka zama mai masaukin gaskiya na tsakiya, yadda yake ma'amala da nau'ikan halittu gami da mutane, jemagu da pangolins ya zama dole a fayyace su.
en-mt: Third, if tertiary mammals are to be the true intermediate host, how it interacts with other species including humans, bats and pangolins needs to be clarified.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: A karshe dai, lura da galibin dabbobi masu shayarwa ciki har da na gida za su kamuwa da cutar SARS-CoV-2, ya kamata a gudanar da bincike hakika a kai.
en-mt: Finally, considering that most mammals, including domestic ones, will be infected with SARS-CoV-2, research should be conducted on it.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Shin Jemage ne, ko pangolin ko wata dabba mai shayarwa, ana tsammanin SARS-CoV-2 ko ƙwayoyin mahaifan sa waɗanda suke kusan iri ɗaya ne za a gano shi a cikin masaukinsa na halitta a nan gaba.
en-mt: Whether it is a bat, a pangolin or any other mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parent cells which are almost identical will be detected in its natural host in the future.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Binciken da aka ci gaba a wannan yankin zai ba da damar hanyar juyin halitta na SARS-CoV-2 a cikin dabbobi, tare da mahimmancin tasiri a cikin rigakafin da kuma sarrafa COVID-19 a cikin mutane.
en-mt: Further research in this area will allow the evolution of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Ana sabunta ka'idojin gwaji na COVID-19 “wanda ake ganin sun kamu da cuta” da “da wanda an riga an gano na da cutar” ya zama dole
en-mt: Updated guidelines for testing of “presumably infected” and “pre-diagnosed” COVID-19 are mandatory

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: A 6 Fabrairu 2020, ƙungiyarmu ta buga jagorar shawara mai sauri don ganewar asali da lura da kamuwa da cutar 2019 noro coronavirus (2019-nCoV), kuma wannan jagorar ya samar mana da kwarewarmu kuma mu bayar da tunani sosai game da yakar wannan cuta ta duniya.
en-mt: On 6 February 2020, our team published a quick advice guide for the diagnosis and monitoring of the 2019 noro coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guide provided us with our experience and gave us a lot of thought on how to fight this disease by world.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Koyaya, cutar coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) sabon cuta ce, wayewarmu da iliminmu suna karuwa ne sannu a hankali bisa binciken ci gaba da ƙwarewar aikin asibiti; Saboda haka, dabarun ganewar asali da magani ana kuma sabunta su koyaushe.
en-mt: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is increasing slowly based on the continuous research and clinical experience; Therefore, diagnosis and treatment techniques are constantly being updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: A cikin wannan wasika, mun ba da amsa guda ɗaya game da jagorarmu kuma mun samar da sabon yanayin bincike na “wanda ake zargi da cuta” da “tabbataccen cutar” bisa ga sabon bincike da Jagororin Kulawa na COVID-19 (sigar na bakwai) wanda Kwamitin Lafiya na Kasa na jamhuriyar jama'ar Sin ya bayar.
en-mt: In this letter, we provide a single response to our guidance and provide a new diagnosis of "suspected disease" and "confirmed disease" according to the new diagnosis and treatment guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) issued by the National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: A cikin watan Disamba na 2019, coronavirus na shekara ta 2019 (2019-nCoV) ya haifar da fashewa, wanda a yanzu an nada shi a matsayin cutar coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) kuma an sanya sunan ƙwayar cuta mai ƙuna mai nauyi ta cutar coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV- 2).
en-mt: In December 2019, the 2019 coronavirus (2019-nCoV) caused an outbreak, which is now designated as the 2019 coronavirus disease (COVID-19) and named after the highly infectious virus of the disease. coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: A ranar 11 Maris 2020, WHO ta kwatanta COVID-19 a matsayin annoba.
en-mt: On 11 March 2020, WHO described COVID-19 as a pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: Don yin yaƙi da kamuwa da cututtukan SARS-CoV-2, ƙungiyarmu ta ɓullo da jagorar shawara mai sauri kuma an buga wannan kan layi a cikin Binciken Ilimin Kiwon Lafiyar Sojoji a ranar 06 ga Fabrairu 2020.
en-mt: To combat SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a quick advisory guide and this was published online in the Military Medical Review on 06 February 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: An jawo hankalin sosai tun lokacin da aka buga.
en-mt: It has attracted a lot of attention since it was published.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Ka lura duk da cewa COVID-19 sabon cuta ne, ƙwarewarmu da iliminmu suna ƙaruwa sannu-sannu bisa binciken ci gaba da ƙwarewar aikin asibiti; Saboda haka, dabarun ganewar asali da magani ana kuma sabunta su koyaushe.
en-mt: Note that although COVID-19 is a new disease, our skills and knowledge are gradually increasing based on ongoing research and clinical practice; Therefore, diagnosis and treatment techniques are constantly being updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Misali, Binciken Bincike da Ka'idodin Jiyya don COVID-19 wanda Kwamitin Kiwan Lafiya na Jamhuriyar Jama'ar Sin ya bayar (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), tsakanin 16 ga Janairu 2020 zuwa 3 Maris 2020, sun ba da sanarwar total bakwai bugu tare da wasu mahallin da ake canza sosai.
en-mt: For example, the Research Review and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), between 16 January 2020 and 3 March 2020, They announced a total of seven editions with some contexts that are being changed a lot.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Yanzu jagorancinmu ta karɓi sharhi ta hanyar Zhou et al., Sun gabatar da wani tsari mai sauƙi wanda ya danganci ƙwarewar asibiti.
en-mt: Now our guidance received comments by Zhou et al., they presented a simple system based on clinical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Ayyukan su sun ƙara sabon shaida don jagorar mu kuma sun ba da ma'anar mahimmanci ga wannan anoba ta duniya.
en-mt: Their work adds new evidence for our guidance and gives a sense of importance to this global epidemic.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Muna alfahari da muhimmiyar aikin su kuma muna nuna godiyarsu.
en-mt: We are proud of their important work and express our gratitude.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Duk da haka, aikin su ma yana buƙatar sabuntawa bisa ga sabon Ganewar asalin ciwo da Jagororin Jinyar COVID-19 (Sigar gwajin bakwai) da kuma binciken kwana nan.
en-mt: However, their work also needs to be updated based on the new Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Seventh Test Version) and today's research.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Dangane da bugu na bakwai (3 Maris 2020), don tabbatar da tuhumar da ake buƙata na buƙatar haɗu da kowane abu guda na abubuwan tarihin annoba tare da abubuwa biyu na alamun bayyanar asibiti don yin cikakken bincike, ko kuma buƙatar haɗuwa da abubuwa uku na bayyanannin asibiti idan ba tare da bayyananne ba tarihin annoba:
en-mt: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), in order to confirm the charges, it is necessary to combine any one item of the epidemiological history with two items of clinical symptoms to make a complete diagnosis, or the need to combine three items of Clinical manifestations without a clear epidemiological history:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Tarihin cututtukan cuta: (1) tarihin tafiya ko zama a cikin birnin Wuhan da kewayenta, ko wasu al'ummomin da aka sami rahoton cutar COVID-19 a cikin kwanaki 14 na ƙarshe kafin alamun farawa; (2) tarihin saduwa da SARS-CoV-2 cututtukan fata (tare da ingantaccen gwajin nucleic acid);(3) tarihin tuntuɓar marasa lafiya tare da zazzabi ko alamu na numfashi daga garin Wuhan da kewayenta, ko kuma sauran al'ummomin da aka sami rahoton COVID-19 a cikin kwanaki 14 na ƙarshe kafin alamun farawa;(4) tarihin hulɗa tare da tarin abubuwan da aka tabbatar(≥ 2 lokuta biyu da zazzabi da / ko alamun cututtukan numfashi sun faru a cikin makonni 2 a cikin ƙananan yankuna, kamar gida, ofis, aji na makaranta, da sauransu).
en-mt: Epidemiological history: (1) history of travel or residence in the city of Wuhan and its surroundings, or other communities where there have been reports of COVID-19 in the last 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (2) history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 skin disease (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) history of contact with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from the city of Wuhan and its surroundings, or other communities where received a report of COVID-19 in the last 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (4) a history of contact with a cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases of fever and / or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas , such as home, office, school classroom, etc.).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Bayyanuwar cututtuka na asibiti: (1) zazzabi da/ko alamun cutar hanyoyin numfashi; (2) tare da alamun fasahar kamuwa da COVID-19; (3) jimlar tantanin halitar farin jinin da ke nuna daidai, raguwa, ko raguwar yawan adadin kumburin lymphocyte a farkon matakin.
en-mt: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/or respiratory tract symptoms; (2) with technical symptoms of infection with COVID-19; (3) the total number of white blood cells showing the same, decrease, or decrease in the number of lymphocyte swelling in the early stage.
