sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Binciken shari'ar da aka tabbatar ya kamata ya dogara ne akan tuhumar da ake zargi tare da kowane abu guda na pathogenic ko shaidar serological kamar haka: (1) gwajin PCR na hakika tabbatacce ga SARS-CoV-2; (2) hoto ko bidiyo mai zagaya yanar gizo da sauri duk tsarin halitta wanda yake nuna babban ɗabi'a ga sanannun coronaviruses; (3) tabbatacce ga takamaiman IgM antibody da IgG antibody zuwa SARS-CoV-2 a cikin gwajin serum; ko sauyawar SARG-CoV-2-IgG takamaiman IgG daga mummunan zuwa tabbatacce, ko titer yana tashi ≥4 sau a cikin lokacin dawo da sama wanda ke cikin mawuyacin lokaci.
en-mt: The diagnosis of the confirmed case should be based on the suspected case with any single pathogenic factor or serological evidence as follows: (1) PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) all biological systems that show high susceptibility to known coronaviruses; (3) positive for specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or the change of SARG-CoV-2-IgG specific IgG from negative to positive, or the titer rises ≥4 times during the recovery period which is in the critical phase.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Za mu iya ganin cewa ainihin gwajin PCR na ainihin acid na nucleic acid a cikin tsarin numfashi ko samfurori na jini sun kara zuwa na biyu (18 Janairu 2020) da na uku (22 Janairu 2020).
en-mt: We can see that the real PCR test of the real nucleic acid in the respiratory system or blood samples has been added to the second (18 January 2020) and the third (22 January 2020).

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: An ƙara gano ƙwaƙwalwar ƙwayar jini a cikin na huɗu (27 Janairu 2020) da na biyar (8 Fabrairu 2020); sannan kuma an kara tabbatar da shaidar serological zuwa bugu na bakwai.
en-mt: Blood clots are detected in the fourth (27 January 2020) and the fifth (8 February 2020); and the serological evidence was further confirmed to the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Wadannan gyare-gyaren da aka danganta da masu binciken sun ci gaba da aikin da cewa don bincika ingantaccen ƙwayar cuta ta hanzari, da samfurori daga ƙwayar numfashi ciki har da samfurin jini, wanda ya haɓaka samar da samfurori daban-daban, kuma yana tallafawa samar da takamaiman sakamako na antibody. a cikin ka'idodin da aka tabbatar.
en-mt: These modifications related to the researchers continued the work that to examine the quality of the virus quickly, and the samples from the respiratory system including the blood sample, which increased the production of different products, and supports the production and specific antibody results. in the proven principles.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Bayan haka, akwai ƙarin tabbaci da yawa waɗanda ke tunatar da mu mai da hankali tare da marasa lafiyar marasa lafiya da marasa lafiyar asymptomatic.
en-mt: After that, there are many more proofs that remind us to pay attention with sick patients and asymptomatic patients.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Saboda haka, jerin gwanon Zhou et al. yakamata a sabunta shi, kamar yadda suke rarraba mutum ba tare da alamun asibiti kamar “ƙananan haɗari ba”.
en-mt: Therefore, the series of Zhou et al. it should be updated, as they classify a person without clinical symptoms as "low risk".

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Hakanan ana buƙatar tabbatar da tsarin ƙimar ci gaba a cikin aikin asibiti da kuma karatun.
en-mt: There is also a need to confirm the value system of development in clinical practice and studies.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Don kammalawa, muna fatan ƙarin tabbaci kai tsaye da ke zuwa tare da yin kira ga masu karatu su faɗi ra'ayoyinsu.
en-mt: To conclude, we hope for more direct confirmation that comes with calling on readers to voice their opinions.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Don bincikar “ciwon da ba a gano ba” da “ciwon da aka gano”, muna ba da shawarar ganowa da yin biyayya da sababbin jagororin ƙasashen su.
en-mt: To diagnose "undiagnosed disease" and "diagnosed disease", we recommend identifying and complying with the new guidelines of their countries.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Kungiyar mu su ma za su sabunta jagorar mu domin bayar da taimako.
en-mt: Our team will also update our guide to help.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Bangladesh ta ba da rahoton sabbin mutuwa guda biyar ta dalilin COVID-19, mafi yawa a rana guda.
en-mt: Bangladesh has reported five new deaths due to COVID-19, the most in a single day.

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Jiya, Bangladesh ta tabbatar da sabbin mutuwa har guda biyar saboda COVID-19 a ranar.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 that day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Wannan shine lamba mafi yawa na mutuwa a rana guda saboda kwayar cutan.
en-mt: This is the highest number of deaths in one day due to the virus.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: A jiya, Hukumar binciken kan cututtuka na Bangledesh, wato Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) ta ba da rohoton lambar wadanda suka kamu da cutan wanda ya hada da wasu wadanda suke da cutar su 114 da kuma wadanda suka warke su 33 wadanda suke zaman gida.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) released a report on the number of people infected with the disease, which includes 114 people with the disease and 33 people who have recovered and are staying at home. .

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Adadin mutane 17 da suka mutu aka rubuta.
en-mt: A total of 17 people have died.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Cikin labarai kan layin intane, Darectan IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, ta ce wadanda suka rasa rayukansu sun hada da maza hudu da mace daya.
en-mt: In the news on the internet, Director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said that those who lost their lives included four men and one woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: A cewar Dr meerjady, kararraki masun cutar biyu sun kai shekaru 60, biyu tsakanin 51 da 60, kuma daya shekaru 41-50.
en-mt: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases with the disease reached 60 years, two between 51 and 60, and one between 41-50 years.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Ta kuma ce biyu daga cikin wadanda cutar ya shafa sun fito ne daga Dhakar.
en-mt: She also said that two of the victims are from Dhakar.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: Hukumar Lafiya (WHO) ta bayyana COVID-19 a matsayin anoba ranar 11 ga watan Maris.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 as an epidemic on March 11.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Wani jami’in asibitin ya fada wa kamfanin dillancin labarai na Anadolu, tashar labarai ta gida cewa daya daga cikin mamacin shi ne Jalal Safur Rahaman daraktan ne na hukumar cin hanci da rashawa na Bengali, wanda aka kula dashi a asibitin Kuwait Maitree.
en-mt: A hospital official told Anadolu news agency, a local news channel that one of the dead is Jalal Safur Rahaman, the director of the Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was treated at Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: A ranar Asabar, a cikin sanarwar bidiyo ta yanar gizo, Ministan Jigilar Hanya da Gadodi na Bangladesh Obaidul Quader ya ce za a rufe jigilar jama'a na tsawon lokaci fiye da yadda aka tsara tun farko, har sai ranar Asabar mai zuwa.
en-mt: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladesh's Minister of Road Transport and Infrastructure Obaidul Quader said public transport will be closed for a longer period than originally planned, until next Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Rufewar wannan abun jigilar jama’a ya fara ne a ranar 26 ga watan Maris da kuma an shiya zuwa karshen Asabar, ranar 4 ga watan Afrilu.
en-mt: The closure of this public transport started on March 26th and is sold out until the end of Saturday, April 4th.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Har yanzu an yarda da jigilar kayayyaki masu mahimmanci, magunguna, man fetur da kayan abinci.
en-mt: Transport of essential goods, medicines, fuel and foodstuffs is still allowed.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: An samu cutar COVID-19 na farko a Bangladesh ranar 8 ga Maris a mutane biyu da suka dawo daga Italy da kuma matar dayansu.
en-mt: The first case of COVID-19 was found in Bangladesh on March 8 in two people who returned from Italy and their wife.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: A ranar goma sha tara (19) ga Maris, wadannan uku sun riga sun warke.
en-mt: On the 19th of March, these three have already recovered.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ya zarce cututtukan miliyan daya a duk duniya
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 has surpassed one million infections worldwide

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: A ranar Alhamis, yawan adadin kamuwa da cutar coronavirus SARS-CoV-2  sun wuce sama da miliyan ɗaya a duk duniya, bisa bayanan Jami'ar Johns Hopkins.
en-mt: On Thursday, the number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus exceeded one million worldwide, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Akalla an samu mutuwa dubu 52 daga cutan COVID-19, cutan da kwayar cutan korona ke jawowa.
en-mt: At least 52 thousand deaths have been reported from the disease of COVID-19, the disease caused by the corona virus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Wannan nasaran ta samu ne a ranar da Malawi ta tabbatar da cutar korona na farko sannan Zambia ta samu mutuwa daga cutar korona na farko.
en-mt: This victory was achieved on the day Malawi confirmed its first corona virus and Zambia had its first death from corona virus.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: Koriya ta Arewa ta yi da'awa, a ranar Alhamis, ta na cikin kasashen kadan wadanda sun kasance ba su da kamuwar coronavirus
en-mt: North Korea claimed, on Thursday, that it is one of the few countries that have not been infected with the coronavirus

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Daga jiya, hukumar Lafiya ta Duniya ta ba da rahoton maganganun guda 1,051,635 wadanda suka tabbatar, wadanda suka hada da kararraki 79,332 a cikin sa'o'i ashirin da hudu da suka gabata 10 na safe. Tsarin Turai na Tsakiya (0800 UTC) ranar 4 ga Afrilu.
en-mt: As of yesterday, the World Health Organization has reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the last twenty-four hours at 10 am. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: A cikin U.S. an rikodin fiye da wadanda suka kamu da cutar coronavirus dubu 244 waɗanda ke da alaƙa da aƙalla mutuwar 5,900.
en-mt: In the US, more than 244 thousand people have been infected with the coronavirus, which is associated with at least 5,900 deaths.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: CBS News sun ba da rohoto daga John Hopkins University da cewa akwai mutuwa sama da 1, 000 a US ranar Laraba wanda cutar korona ta jawo.
en-mt: CBS News reports from John Hopkins University that there are more than 1,000 deaths in the US on Wednesday caused by the corona virus.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: A duniya baki daya, kananan hukumomi sun ba da sanarwar matakan dakile cutar don hana yaduwa.
en-mt: All over the world, local governments have announced measures to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Ranar Alhamis, Sergei Sobyanin, Mayor na Moscow, ya kara dokan hana fita waje zuwa ranar 1 ga watan Mayu.
en-mt: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, Mayor of Moscow, extended the curfew until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: A kasa, shugaban Vladimir ya ce zai ci gaba da biyan albashi ba tare da al'umma suna zuwa bakin aikiba har zuwa 30 ga watan afrilu.
en-mt: On the ground, President Vladimir said that he will continue to pay salaries without people coming to work until April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Yan majalisar Portugal sun kada kuri’ar tsawaita dokar ta-baci cikin kwanaki 15; an jefa kuri'un da kuri'u 215 cikin son kai, ragi goma, da jefa kuri'a daya ba a yarda da su ba.
en-mt: Portuguese MPs vote to extend state of emergency for 15 days; the votes were cast with 215 votes in favor, ten less, and one vote not accepted.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: Saudi Arabbia sun kara kafa dokar hana fita a cikin garin mecca da medina mai tsarki har zuwa tsawon ranaku, a baya can, dokar hana fita ta kasance ne kawai tsakanin karfe 3 na yamma zuwa 6 na safe.
en-mt: Saudi Arabia has extended the curfew in the holy city of Mecca and Medina until the end of the day, previously, the curfew was only between 3 pm and 6 am.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Thailand ta yi kokarin aiwatar da dokar hana fita tsakanin karfe 10 na yamma zuwa karfe 4 na safe.
en-mt: Thailand has tried to enforce a curfew between 10pm and 4am.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Gwamnan Ohio, Mike DeWine, ya sanar da cewa jihan ta kara kwanakin zauna a gida har zuwa 1 ga Mayu.
en-mt: Ohio Governor, Mike DeWine, announced that the state has extended the stay-at-home order until May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Kantuna a Ostiraliya sun rage takarda bayan gida ga kowane ma'amala
en-mt: Shops in Australia have reduced toilet paper per transaction

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: A yammacin ranakun Asabar da lahadi kantin Woolworths and Coles dake kasar Australia ta takaita adadin tolifefa zuwa daya ko biyu ga ko wani mai siya a ko wani kantin ta dake fadin kasar.
en-mt: On the evening of Saturday and Sunday, the Woolworths and Coles store in Australia limited the number of tolifefa to one or two for any buyer in any of its stores across the country.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: ALDI sun bijiro da iyakar nadi daya, ranar litinin
en-mt: ALDI came up with a limit of one roll, on Monday

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: A wallafa ka’idojin ne a bangon fita da kuma shafin kantin dake kafar sadarwa na Facebook.
en-mt: The rules are published on the exit wall and on the store's Facebook page.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Rahoto ya nuna masu siyan kaya sun garkame kayayyaki bisa ga tsoron COVID-19 da daukar matakin killacewa waje guda.
en-mt: The report shows that buyers have stockpiled goods due to the fear of COVID-19 and taking measures to lock them out.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: A ranar Laraba, Woolworths ya siya takarda bayan gida kadan don kaiwa gida fakiti ɗaya kowane oda.
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths bought a small amount of toilet paper to take home one pack per order.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Wadannan canje-canje sun biyo bayan ƙuntatawar fakiti-hudu ko wace ma’amala wanda Woolworths da Coles suka gabatar a watan Maris rana 4 da 5 bi da bi.
en-mt: These changes follow four-pack restrictions introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Coles, a rahoton shi na ranar 8 ga watan Maris yake cewa da mataki na hudu da aka sanya mmafi yawan shaguna na sayar da kaya cikin sa’a guda da sauke kayan, kuma ya kira bukatar da zamto na rashin laakari shi kuma ALDI a wani rubutun shi na shifin sada zumunta na facebook na rananr talata ya kira shi da mara zato.
en-mt: Coles, in his report dated March 8, said that with the fourth stage, most of the stores were set to sell goods within one hour of unloading, and he called the request to be ignored and ALDI in another case. His post on his Facebook page on Tuesday called it unexpected.

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Ciniki ya hau cikin sauri a makon da ya wuce, a maganar kakakin woolworth.
en-mt: Trade picked up quickly last week, according to a Woolworth spokesman.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Shagunan Costco's A Canberra Sun Takaita Yawan Sayarwa Zuwa Nadi Biyu Satin Da Ya Wuce.
en-mt: Costco's stores in Canberra have limited sales to just two last week.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Don ci gaba da rage ƙarancin, Coles ya ba da umarnin manyan kunshin daga masu kaya da ƙara yawan bayarwa, Woolworths ya ba da odar ƙarin jari, yayin da ALDI ya sanya hannun jari don shirin Laraba na musamman da za a fara da wuri.
en-mt: To further reduce the shortage, Coles ordered larger packages from suppliers and increased deliveries, Woolworths ordered more capital, while ALDI invested for a special Wednesday program that will start early.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman, shugaban kungiyar kakanan yan kasuwa, yace kanaken yan kasuwa na kokarin kara kaya, ammman matakan gida akan lokacin shigowar motocin su na zama da shi mai wahala.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, president of the Small Business Association, said that small businesses are trying to increase their inventory, but it is difficult for them to get their cars in.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Ya sa rai samun karuwar farashin sarrafa kaya a yayin kokarin biyan bukatu da makamanci haka na musamman.
en-mt: He expects to see an increase in handling costs while trying to meet special needs and such.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: A ranar Talata, ALDI ya sanar da cewa bayan farkon sakin hannun jari, wasu shagunan ba za su iya gudanar da ranar Laraba ta musamman ba.
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that after the initial stock release, some stores will not be able to run the Wednesday special.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: A Cikin News.com.au., Dr Gary Mortimer ya bada rahoton cewa, Masanin Kananan Ciniki Daga Jami'ar kimiya na Queensland, Ya ce Shagunan Na Cika Kayakin Sayarwan a kowace Dare.
en-mt: In News.com.au., Dr Gary Mortimer reports that Retail Expert from the Queensland University of Science, said the stores are full of merchandise every night.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Yana Cewa Takardar bayan gida Abu ne Mai Yawa, Wanda Ke Sa Kaya Su Yi Karanci A Yawa, Kuma In An Sayar Duka, Su Kan Bar Guraben Ajiya Su Fayau, Hakan Na Matsantawa Karancin Su.
en-mt: He says that toilet paper is an abundant thing, which causes goods to be scarce, and if they are all sold, they tend to leave empty storage bins, which makes them scarce.

sourceString: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic" said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: "Coles da Woolworths suna da ra'ayi [cewa] idan akwai kayayyaki da yawa akan wurin ajiye kaya (shelf), idan kayayyaki kamar takardan bayan gida da abun tsabtacewa [sayi] kuma suna can da yawa, watakila za a rage yawan fargaba" in ji Russell Zimmerman a cikin Labarai na ABC.
en-mt: "Coles and Woolworths are of the opinion [that] if there are more products on the shelf, if products like toilet paper and cleaning products are [purchased] in larger quantities, maybe there will be less panic." said Russell Zimmerman on ABC News.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Mai sake saraffa takardar bayan gida Wanda ya bada Crap ya ce a ranar Laraba ta karshe zasu kare.
en-mt: The toilet paper recycler who gave out the crap said that by last wednesday they would run out.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: Kimberly-Clark, wanda ke yin Kleenex Toilet Tissue, da Solaris Paper wanda ke yin Sorbent, ya jaddada cewa suna aiki 24/7 don kula da wadatar, a cewa rahoton News.com.au.
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, stressed that they are working 24/7 to manage the supply, News.com.au reports.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Domain.com shafin chinikayyan gidaje, sun bada rahoton wasu masun sayarwa suna bada takardan bayangida kyauta ga wanda zai fara ciniki kan gwanjon a Melbourne, lokacin da aka gudanar da gwanjon kadan domin masun saya sun tafi hutu a dogon karshen mako ranar iyan kwadago.
en-mt: Domain.com, a real estate website, reported that some sellers were offering free toilet papers to the first bidder at auctions in Melbourne, when auctions were held short because buyers were away for the long Labor Day weekend.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Shirin ranar Alhamis na jaridar NT na dauke da shafuka guda takwas wanda ya kamace ya yanka domin yin amfani a matsayin tolifefa.
en-mt: The Thursday issue of the NT newspaper contains eight pages that should be cut to be used as a tolifefa.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Da farko Shagunan Sun nuna Rashin aikata Daga Farko Wajen Sa Matakan, A Yadda Wani rahoto Na ABC Australia a ranar 3 ga Watan Maris Wanda Suka Ce Babu Wani Shiri Don Takaita Siyyayya.
en-mt: At first, the stores have shown failure to act from the beginning in the steps, as a report by ABC Australia on March 3, which they said there is no plan to limit shopping.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman ya kara wasu kayakin da ake bukatar su sosai, harda kariyar fuska, sabulun hannu, busashen kaya, ruwan goge hannu da ma filawa.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added some much-needed items, including face shields, hand soap, dry goods, hand sanitizer and even towels.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: A irin haka, a wajen Australia, a rananr lahadi da yamma an lura da cewa shafin kasuwanci na Birtania a yanar gizo Ocado na takaita sayarwan takadar bayan gida Andres zuwa fakitin biyu na nadi-12.
en-mt: In this way, outside of Australia, on Sunday afternoon it was noticed that the British business website Ocado is limiting the sale of Andres toilet paper to two packs of 12 rolls.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: Kungiyar Lafiya ta Duniya ta ayyana COVID-19 a matsayin annoba
en-mt: The World Health Organization has declared COVID-19 as a pandemic

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Ranar hukumar lafiya ta WHO ta kaddamar da barkewar COVID-19 da ciwon da coronavirus SARS-COV-2 ke haifarwa a matsayin annoba.
en-mt: The day the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the outbreak of COVID-19 and the disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-COV-2 as a pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Ko da yake ita kalmar anoba na nufin yanda cutar ke yaduwa, ba yanda hadarin wasu majinyatan ba, WHO ta bukaci sahalewar gwamnatoci wajen yakin.
en-mt: Although the word plague refers to how the disease spreads, not how dangerous it is for some patients, WHO has urged governments to ease the fight.

sourceString: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: “Dukanin kasashen duniya har yanzu na iya sauya fasalin wannan annobar.
en-mt: "All the countries of the world can still change the shape of this epidemic.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: idan kasashe suka gane, gwaji, warkar, binciko, da tura mutanen su izuwa agaji, “ inji Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, shugaban kungiyar WHO.
en-mt: if countries understand, test, cure, research, and send people to help," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the head of the WHO.

sourceString: "We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction."
targetString: "Muna matukar damuwa da duka matakan tashin hankali da yaduwar cutar da kuma matakan rashin damuwa."
en-mt: "We are very concerned about both the levels of violence and the spread of the disease and the levels of depression."

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: A Cewar Dr Tom Frienden, Tsohon Shugaban Hukumar Kula Da Cuttutuka Da Ma Kariya Daga Kamuwa Cewa ita Wannan Annoba Ba a San Kan ta ba Tukun.
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Frienden, the former head of the CDC, this epidemic is not yet known.

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Ya ce, a cikin jawabin da CNN ta buga a watan Fabrairu, "ban da mura, ba wani kwayar cutar ta hanyar numfashi da ta bulla daga damuwa har zuwa yaduwar duniya."
en-mt: He said, in a speech published by CNN in February, "other than the flu, no other respiratory virus has emerged from concern to spread globally."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus shima ya shaida inda ya kara da cewa ba’a taba samun annoba wanda coronavirus tayi sanadiyar yaduwar ta.
en-mt: Ghebreyesus also testified where he added that there has never been an epidemic caused by the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Ya ci gaba da cewa, "kuma ba mu taba ganin annoba da za a iya sarrafa ta a lokaci guda ba."
en-mt: He continued, "and we have never seen an epidemic that can be controlled at the same time."

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Sabuwar matsayin annoba ta biyo bayan shawarar da WHO ta yanke a watan Janairu don bayyana barkewar cutar a matsayin matsalar lafiyar jama'a na damuwa ta kasa da kasa.
en-mt: The new epidemic status follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health problem of international concern.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Darektan Cibiyar Nazarin Cutar Jiki da Cuta mai Yaduwa wato (The United States’ National Institute of Allegy and Infectious Diseases) Dr. Anthony Fauci, ta ce game da barkewar, "Karshen magana, zai kasance da muni."
en-mt: Director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases) Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "The bottom line, it's going to be terrible."

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: A halin yanzu jaridar Associated press ta kawo rahoto cewa an adadin wadanda suka kamu da COVID-19 a duniya ya kai 126,000 kuma mutane 4,600 sun mutu sakamakon kamuwa da ita.
en-mt: Currently, the Associated Press reports that the number of people infected with COVID-19 in the world has reached 126,000 and 4,600 people have died as a result of infection.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Annobar coronavirus ta shekara 2019-20 annoba ce wanda ke cigaba da faruwa ta ciwon 2019 COVID-19 wanda 2 SARS-COV-2 ke haifarwa.
en-mt: The 2019-2020 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic caused by the 2019 COVID-19 virus caused by SARS-COV-2.

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: An gano bullar barkewar cutar a Wuhan, China, a watan Disamba na shekarar 2019, an ayyana shi a matsayin Babban Lafiyar Jama'a na Damuwar Kasa da Kasa a ranar 30 ga Janairu 2020, kuma an karbe shi da cutar a ranar 11 ga Maris 2020.
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, was declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on January 30, 2020, and was officially recognized on March 11. 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: A ranar 10 ga watan Afrilu 2020, kimanin mutane miliyan 1.61 aka samu da cutar COVID-19 a kasashe 210 da ma yankuna, wadanda hakan sun kawo mutuwa guda 97,000.
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, about 1.61 million people were diagnosed with the disease of COVID-19 in 210 countries and territories, which resulted in 97,000 deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Kimanin mutane 364,000 sun warke.
en-mt: About 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: An kiyasta yiuwar mutuwa sanadiyar ta zuwa 4% a kasar China. A duniya kuwa kason ta rabu ne tsakanin 13.04% a Aljeriya zuwa .08% a kasar New Zealand.
en-mt: The mortality rate is estimated to be 4% in China. In the world, its share is divided between 13.04% in Algeria and .08% in New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Manyan alamomin cutar sun hada da zazzabi da tari tare da takaita shakar iska.
en-mt: The main symptoms of the disease include fever, cough and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Rikitarwan cututuka zai iya haɗawa da ciwon huhu da cutar hanyoyin numfashi mai tsanani.
en-mt: Complications can include pneumonia and acute respiratory infections.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Lokacin daga bayyanar cutar zuwa farkon bayyanar cututtuka shine kusan kwanaki biyar, amma yana iya kasancewa daga kwana biyu zuwa goma sha huɗu.
en-mt: The time from the appearance of the disease to the onset of symptoms is about five days, but it can be from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Babu sanannen rigakafi ko wata kulawa domin kawar da ita.
en-mt: There is no known prevention or treatment to get rid of it.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Kulawa Ta farko Na da nasaba Da Kuma Bada Garkuwa Wajen kawo Sauki, Matakan Kare Kai Ciki Harda wanke Hannu, Rufe baki Yayin Tari, Bada tazara Ga Mutanne, Kula da kuma Kebe Kai wa Mutanen Da Ke Dauke da ko Ake Zargin Sun Kamu Da ita.
en-mt: First Aid Involves Providing Self-Protection, Self-Protection Measures Including Hand Washing, Covering Mouth When Coughing, Social Distancing, Monitoring and Isolate People Who Are Suspected To Be Infected .

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Hukumomi a fadin duniya sun mayar da martani ta hanyar daukar matakai kamar takaita safara, killacewa, dokar hana fita, bin ka’idojin rage hatsari a wuraren aiki da kuma kulle masana’antu.
en-mt: Governments around the world have responded by taking measures such as travel restrictions, lockdowns, curfews, workplace safety measures and factory shutdowns.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: annoban ta haifar da mummunar rikice-rikicen tattalin arziƙin duniya, dakatar da sokewa ko soke wasannin, addinai, siyasa da al'adu, da kuma wadatar kayayyaki da ke haifar da sayan ban tsoro.
en-mt: The epidemic has caused a serious crisis in the world economy, the suspension or cancellation of the games, religions, politics and culture, and the availability of products that lead to panic buying.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Makarantu da jami’o’i sun rufe kodai a kasa gaba daya ko a wasu wurare a cikin kasashe 193, ya shafi a kalla kimanin kashi 99.4% na yawan daliban duniya.
en-mt: Schools and universities have closed all over the country or elsewhere in 193 countries, affecting at least 99.4% of the world's students.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Rashin fahimta game da kwayar cutar ta bazu a kan layi, kuma akwai lokutan maganganu na ƙabilanci da nuna wariya ga Sinawa, sauran mutanen Gabas da Kudu maso gabashin Asiya da bayyanar su, da sauran su daga wuraren da ke da muhimancin kamuwa da cutan.
en-mt: Misunderstandings about the virus have spread online, and there have been instances of racist comments and discrimination against the Chinese, other East and Southeast Asians and their appearance, and others from areas with significant transmission of the virus.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Sakamakon dakatar da tafiye-tafiyte da kuma rufe manyan masana’antu an samu karancin gurbatattun iska.
en-mt: Due to the suspension of travel and the closure of large industries, there has been less air pollution.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Jami’o’in lafiya a Wuhan sun kawo rahoto cewa an gano taron cutar ta hanyar kwayar Pneumonia a 31 ga watan Disemba na 2019 bayan haka an kaddamar da bincike a farkon watan Janairu na 2020.
en-mt: The University of Health in Wuhan reported that the outbreak of Pneumonia was detected on December 31, 2019, after which an investigation was launched in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Yawancin lokuta suna da alaƙa da Kasuwancin kayan ruwa a Huanan don haka ana tunanin cutar tana da asalin zoonotic.
en-mt: Most of the cases are related to the seafood trade in Huanan and therefore the disease is thought to have a zoonotic origin.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Kwayar cutar da ta haifar da barkewar cutar ana kiranta da SARS-CoV-2, sabuwar kwayar cutar da aka gano tana da alaƙa da coronaviruses na gemage, pangolin coronaviruses, da SARS-CoV. Wanda aka fara gano shi da alamun cutar daga baya an gano cewa ya kamu da rashin lafiya a ranar 1 ga Disamba 2019 , kuma mutumin bai da alaƙa da bayyane tare da tari mai rukunin kasuwa na baya.
en-mt: The virus that caused the outbreak is called SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus that is closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV. The person who was first diagnosed with symptoms was later diagnosed with the disease on December 1, 2019, and the person had no apparent connection with the previous cluster cough.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Daga farkon tarin rahoton wadanda suka kamu da cutar cikin watan Disamba na shekarar 2019, an gano kashi biyu cikin uku suna da nasaba da kasuwa.
en-mt: From the first collection of reports of those infected in December 2019, two-thirds were found to be related to the market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: A ranar 13 ga Maris 2020, wani rahoto da ba a tabbatar da shi ba daga South China Morning Post ya ba da shawarar cewa, wata kara ta fara daga ranar 17 ga Nuwamban shekarar 2019, a cikin wani dan shekara 55 daga lardin Hubei, watakila shi ne na farko. A ranar 26 ga Fabrairu 2020, WHO ta ba da rahoton cewa, yayin da aka samu rahoton bullar sabbin maganganu a China amma ba zato ba tsammani ya karu a Italiya, Iran, da Koriya ta Kudu, Yawan sababbin shari'o'i a wajen kasar Sin sun wuce adadin sabbin maganganu a cikin kasar Sin a karon farko.
en-mt: On March 13, 2020, an unconfirmed report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case began on November 17, 2019, in a 55-year-old man from Hubei province, possibly he is the first. On February 26, 2020, WHO reported that while new cases were reported in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China has surpassed the number of new cases in China for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Zai yiwu a sami rahoto mai yawa, musamman tsakanin waɗanda ke da alamun karamin bayyanar cututtukan.
en-mt: It is possible to have a lot of reporting, especially among those with mild symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Ya zuwa 26 ga watan Fabrairu, ba a samu karancin lokuta ba a tsakanin matasa, wadanda shekarun su 19 kuma wadanda ke kasa da kashi 2.4 cikin dari na duk duniya. Babban mashawarcin kimiyya na Burtaniya, Patrick Vallance, ya kiyasta cewa kashi 60% na mutanen Birtaniya za su kamu da cutar kafin cimma wata ingantaccen garkuwa.
en-mt: As of February 26, there has been no shortage of cases among young people, who are 19 years old and who are less than 2.4 percent of the world. The UK's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimates that 60% of the UK population will become infected before achieving effective protection.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Yanayi ya nuna yawan mutane da suka gudanar da gwajin COVID-19 wanda kuma gwajin na nuna cewa suna dauke da cutar bisa tabbacin hukuma.
en-mt: It shows the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19 and the test shows that they have the disease according to official confirmation.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: A 23 ga watan Maris ba’a samu kasar da ta gudanar da gwajin cutar na sama da 3% kuma akasarin kasashen sun samu tsari daga hukuma na yin gwaji har ga wadanda basu nuna kananan alamu ba. cikin kasashen akwai Italy da Netherlands da Spain da kuma Switzerland.
en-mt: On March 23, there was no country that tested more than 3% of the disease and most of the countries have received a plan from the authorities to test even those who do not show minor symptoms. among the countries there are Italy, the Netherlands, Spain and Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Wani binciken da aka buga a ranar 16 ga Maris ya gano cewa, a cikin kasar Sin, har zuwa 23 ga Janairu, an kiyasta kimanin kashi 86% na cututtukan COVID-19, kuma waɗannan cututtukan da ba a yarda da su ba sune tushen kamuwa da cuta kashi 79% na kamuwa da cutan yadda yake a rubuce.
en-mt: A study published on March 16 found that in China, as of January 23, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 cases were reported, and that these unacknowledged infections were the source of the infection. and disease 79% of the infection as it is written.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Wani bincike na ƙididdigar da aka buga a ranar 30 Maris ya kiyasta cewa lambobin cututtukan cututtuka a Italiya sun fi girma fiye da rahoton da aka bayar.
en-mt: A statistical study published on March 30 estimates that the number of infections in Italy is higher than reported.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Atesididdigar farko na lambar haifuwa ta asali (R0) don COVID-19 sun kasance 1.4 zuwa 2.4.
en-mt: Initial estimates of the original reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Bincike da hukumar dake dakile yaduwar cututuka na Amurka ta wallafa ta hakikance cewa wata kila 5.7 ne.
en-mt: A study published by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that the probability is 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Mafi yawancin mutane da suka kamu da COVID-19 suna warkewa.
en-mt: Most people who contract COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Ga waɗanda ba su yi hakan ba, lokacin daga bayyanar cututtuka zuwa mutuwa ya kasance tsakanin ranakun 6 zuwa 41, tare da mafi yawan kwanakin 14.
en-mt: For those who did not, the time from symptoms to death ranged from 6 to 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: A ranar 10 ga watan Afrillu 2020 kimanin mace-macen aka alakanta da COVID-19 su kai 97,000.
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, the estimated number of deaths related to COVID-19 reached 97,000.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: A kasar Sin, ya zuwa ranar 5 ga Fabrairu kusan kashi 80% na wadanda suka mutu sun kasance a cikin wadanda suka wuce 60, kuma 75% suna da yanayin rashin lafiya da suka hada da cututtukan zuciya da cutar siga.Daidaito da mutuwa ta asali daga cutar COVID-19 gabaɗaya tana nufin mutanen da suka mutu waɗanda suka gwada tabbacin COVID bisa ga ka'idoji na hukuma.
en-mt: In China, as of February 5, nearly 80% of those who died were among those over 60, and 75% had underlying health conditions including heart disease and tuberculosis. from the COVID-19 disease generally refers to people who have died who tested positive for COVID according to official guidelines.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Wata kila adadin wadanda ke mutuwa sanadiyar COVID-19 zai fi yawa saboda akwai yiuwar mutuwar mutane wadanda ba’a samu anyi masu gwaji ba misali wadanda ke gida da kuma wadanda ke gidan kulawa.
en-mt: It is possible that the number of people who die due to COVID-19 will be higher because there is a possibility of the death of people who have not been tested, for example those who are at home and those who are in nursing homes.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: wani yanki na daga bayanai na kasar Italy ya gano yawon mutuwa yayin barkewar annobar ya wuce adadin mutuwar COVID da nasabar 4-5x.
en-mt: A piece of data from Italy found that tourism deaths during the outbreak exceeded the number of COVID-19 deaths by 4-5x.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Mai magana da yawun Cibiyar Kula da Cututtuka da kawarwa ta U.S. (CDC) ta yarda "Mun san cewa [adadin da aka bayyana na mutuwa) lamari ne mai ban tsoro", bayanin da ya samo tushe daga rahotannin asirin abubuwan da ke faruwa a Amurka Irin wannan rashin sanin yakamata galibi yakan faru a cikin bala'o'i, kamar cutar H1N1 alade ta 2009. Wanda aka tabbatar da mutuwa ta farko ita ce a Wuhan ranar 9 ga Janairu 2020.
en-mt: A spokeswoman for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) admitted "We know that [the reported death toll] is an alarming phenomenon", a statement based on secret reports of what is happening in the US Such ignorance often occurs in disasters, such as the H1N1 swine flu of 2009. The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on January 9, 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Mutuwa na farko da ya faru wajen China na faru ne a 1 ga watan Febreru a kasar Philipines hakazalika mutuwa ta farko a wajen nahiyar Asia ya faru ne a kasar France a ranar 14 ga watan Febreru.
en-mt: The first death that happened outside of China happened on February 1 in the Philippines and the first death outside of Asia happened in France on February 14.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: A ranar 28 na Febreru a gabanin kasar China an samu rahoton mutuwar mutuwa fiye da goma sha biyu a ko wani na Iran da South Korea da kuma Italy.
en-mt: On February 28, before China, more than a dozen deaths were reported in Iran, South Korea and Italy.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: A ranar 13 ga Watan Maris, kasashe da bangarori Fiye Da Arbain Sun Sanar Da Mutuwa, A Kowane Nahiya Banda Antarctica. Ana amfani da Matakai Da Dama Wajen Kimanta Mace-macen.
en-mt: On the 13th of March, more than 40 countries and regions announced the death, on every continent except Antarctica. Several measures are used in the evaluation of the woman.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Waɗannan lambobin sun bambanta daga yanki da na tsawon lokaci, kuma ana rinjayar su da ƙimar gwaji, ingancin tsarin kiwon lafiya, zaɓuɓɓukan magani, tun lokaci barkewar farko, da kuma halayen jama'a kamar shekaru, jima'i, da kuma lafiyar gaba ɗaya. yana nuna adadin mutuwar da aka rarrabe ta hanyar adadin cututtukan da aka gano a tsakanin wani lokaci na wani lokaci.
en-mt: These numbers vary from region to region and over time, and are influenced by testing rates, quality of the health system, treatment options, time since the first outbreak, and demographic characteristics such as age, sex, and general health. . It shows the number of deaths divided by the number of diseases diagnosed during a certain period of time.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Dangane da ƙididdigar Jami'ar Johns Hopkins, ƙimar mutuwa-ta-duniya shine 6.0% (97,039 / 1,617,204) kamar 10 na Afrilu 2020.
en-mt: According to Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death rate is 6.0% (97,039 / 1,617,204) as of April 10, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: Lambobin ya banbanta tsakanin yanki.
en-mt: The number varies between regions.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: A China kiyastawar da aka yi na nuna cewa mutuwa sanadiyar cutar ta ragu daga 17.3% ( Na wadanda suka nuna alamu daga ranar 1 zuwa 10 na watan Janairu 2020) zuwa 0.7% (Na wadanda suka nuna alamu daga ranar 1 na watan Febreru 2020). Sauran matakai da aka dauka ya kunshi matakin auna mutuwa wanda ke nuna yawar mutane da aka kwantar sanadiyar wani cuta da suka mutu. Hakazalika akwai matakin auna kamuwa da cutar mai nuna yawan mutanen (wadanda aka kwantar da akasin su) da suka mutu sakamakon cutar.
en-mt: In China, the estimated death rate has decreased from 17.3% (for those who showed symptoms from January 1 to 10, 2020) to 0.7% (for those who showed symptoms from February 1, 2020). . Other measures taken include the death rate which shows the number of people hospitalized for a disease who died. Similarly, there is a measure of infection rate that shows the number of people (those who were hospitalized versus those who died) as a result of the disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Waɗannan ƙididdigar basu da iyakar lokaci kuma suna bin takamaiman yawan jama'a daga kamuwa da cuta ta hanyar sassanci.
en-mt: These statistics do not have a time limit and follow a specific population from infection through the sector.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Da yawa cikin masana sunyi kokarin gano lissafa adadin na wani bangaren al’umma.
en-mt: Many of the experts tried to find out the number of some part of the community.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: Cibiyar Nazarin Shaida ta Jami'ar Oxford ta yi kiyasin cewa yawan masu kamuwa da cutar yaduwar cutar gaba daya ya kasance tsakanin 0.1% zuwa 0.39%.
en-mt: The University of Oxford's Center for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the overall prevalence of the disease is between 0.1% and 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: Manyan Kididdigar na wannan kewayon sun yi daidai da sakamakon daga gwaji na farko na COVID-19 a Jamus, da kuma nazarin ƙididdigar da ke nazarin tasirin gwaji akan ƙididdigar CFR.
en-mt: The main statistics of this range are consistent with the results from the first test of COVID-19 in Germany, and the statistical analysis that analyzes the effect of the test on the CFR statistics.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: WHO ta tabbatar da cewa za a iya sha kan annoban.
en-mt: WHO has confirmed that the disease can be overcome.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: Tsananin Hauhawar da Yawan Lokacin Barkewar Ba Su Da Tabbas Kuma Za Su Iya Banbanta A Wurare.
en-mt: The intensity and frequency of eruptions are uncertain and can vary from place to place.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: Maciej Bony daga Penn State University ya bayyana cewa idan ba’a kula ba barkewar shafuwar ta zai haura sa’anan ya fara raguwa yayin da cutar ta rasa jiki da zata rayu a kai.
en-mt: Maciej Bony from Penn State University explained that if the outbreak is not taken care of, it will increase and then decrease as the disease loses its body to live on.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Amma kusan ba zai yiwu a yi wani tsinkaye ba game da lokacin da hakan zai kasance ”.
en-mt: But it is almost impossible to make any predictions about when that will be".

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: Babban jami’i mai baiwa gwamnatin China shawara a kan kiwon lafiya Zhong Nashan yana mai ra’ayi cewa akwai yiwuwar kawo karshen ta a watan Yuni mudin dukanin kasashen duniya sun lura da shawarar da hukumar WHO ta bayar na matakan takaita yaduwar kwayar cuta.
en-mt: Zhong Nashan, the chief adviser to the Chinese government on health, is of the opinion that it is possible to end it in June as long as all the countries of the world take note of the advice given by the WHO to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: A ranar 17 ga watan Maris, Adam Kucharski na London School of Hygiene &amp, Tropical Medicine ya bayyana cewa SARS-CoV-2 "zai zagaya a kasashe, mai yiwuwa na tsawon shekara daya ko biyu".
en-mt: On March 17, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "will circulate in countries, probably for a year or two".

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Bisa ga Kwalejin Ilimi na Imperiyal Wani Bincike Wanda Neil Ferguson Ya Jagoranta, za a bukanci Nesantawar jama’a Da ma Wasu matakai “har ya zuwa lokacin da za a  sami maganin rigakafi (a kalla Watani 18 ko ma ya fi)".
en-mt: According to the Imperial College of Education A study led by Neil Ferguson, social distancing and other measures will be required "until such time as a vaccine is available (at least 18 months or more)".

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner na Jami'ar Vanderbilt ya ce, "Ina tsammanin ba zai yiwu ba wannan coronavirus - saboda yana da sauƙin ɗaukar hoto - za ta shuɗe gabaɗaya" kuma "" na iya zama cuta ta zamani, da ke dawowa kowace shekara ".
en-mt: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University said, "I think it is unlikely that this coronavirus - because it is easily transmitted - will disappear completely" and "" it can be a modern disease, which returns every year ".

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: Tsananin kwayar cutar na dangantuwa ne ga karfin kariyar jiki na kamuwa da cuta da kuma yanayin kwayoyin halittar jiki.
en-mt: The severity of the virus is related to the body's resistance to infection and the genetics of the body.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Alamomin COVID-19 na iya zama mara takamaiman rashin daidaito kuma mutane masu kamuwa da cuta na iya zama mara sa alamun cutar.
en-mt: The symptoms of COVID-19 can be non-specific and people who are infected can be asymptomatic.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Mafi yawan alamun rashin lafiya su ne zazzabi (88%) da ma busashen tari (68%).
en-mt: The most common symptoms of illness are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Wasu kananan bayyanuwar cutan ta hadar da gajiya, fitar da majina daga hanyar numfashi (phlegm), rashin jin kanshi, karancin numfashi, ciwon gabobi da na jiki, ciwon makogwaro, ciwon kai, rashin jin dadi, amai, da gudawa, ko canza launin fata wato cyanosis. WHO ta sanar cewa kimanin mutum daya a cikin shida ya kamu da rashin lafiya kuma yana da wahala yin numfashi.
en-mt: Some minor symptoms of the disease include fatigue, phlegm, dizziness, shortness of breath, joint and body pain, sore throat, headache, malaise, vomiting, diarrhea, or discoloration. skin that is cyanosis. WHO has announced that about one in six people are sick and have difficulty breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: Cibiyar Kula da Cututtuka da kawarwa ta U.S. (CDC) ta lissafa alamu na gaggawa kamar wahalar numfashi, tsayayyar ciwon kirji ko matsi, rikicewar kwatsam, farkawa mara wahala, da fuska mai kyau ko lebe; Ana ba da shawarar likita na gaggawa idan waɗannan alamu suna nan.Farin ci gaba na cutar na iya haifar da matsananciyar ciwon huhu, cuta hanyoyin numfashi mai tsananin gajiyar alamar cutan, tashin zuciya, sepsis, girgiza septic da mutuwa.
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms such as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking up, and a swollen face or lips; An emergency doctor is advised if these symptoms are present. The progress of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, respiratory tract disease with severe fatigue, nausea, sepsis, septic shock and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: Wasu daga cikin masu kamuwa da cutar na iya zama asymptomatic, ba tare da alamu na asibiti ba amma tare da sakamakon gwaji da ke tabbatar da kamuwa da cuta, don haka masu bincike sun ba da shawara cewa waɗanda ke da kusanci da mutanen da suka kamu da cutar ya kamata a sa ido sosai kuma a bincika su kawar da kamuwa da cuta.
en-mt: Some of the infected people may be asymptomatic, without clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm the infection, so researchers suggest that those who are close to infected people and the disease should be closely monitored and checked to rule out infection.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: Kdiddigar Sinanci na jimlar mara alamun cutar yana daga kalilan zuwa 44%.
en-mt: The Chinese rate of total asymptomatic disease ranges from a few to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: Lokacin da aka saba amfani da shi (lokacin tsakanin kamuwa da cuta da farawa) ya fara daga daya zuwa kwanaki 14; mafi yawan lokuta kwana biyar ne.To da misalin rashin tabbas, kimantawar ɓarkewar mutane da COVID-19 waɗanda suka rasa kamshin da ƙanshi ya fara daga 30% kuma daga baya ya faɗi zuwa 15%.
en-mt: The time it is usually used (the time between infection and onset) starts from one to 14 days; most cases are five days. Well, as an example of uncertainty, the estimated rate of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell started at 30% and later fell to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: Wasu jawaban akan yadda cutar ke yaduwa ake kokarin ganowa.
en-mt: Some talks on how the disease spreads are trying to find out.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Akwai yakinin farkon yaduwar ciwon at hanyar hulda da mai shi sai kuma ta hanyar digo da aka samu yayin tari ko atishawa ko yin magana tare da samun kusanci da mutum tsakanin mita 1 zuwa 2 (kafa 3 zuwa 6).
en-mt: There is a belief that the first spread of the disease is through contact with the owner and then through droplets obtained during coughing or sneezing or talking with a person within 1 to 2 meters (3 to 6 feet).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: Bincike ya gano cewa tari da ba a rufe ba yana iya haifar da didiga wanda wand zai iya tafiya zuwa mita 4,5 (ƙafa 15) zuwa mita 8.2 (ƙafa 27).
en-mt: Research has found that the pile that is not closed can cause a heel that the wand can go to 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Wasu sun kudurta cewa kwayar cutar na iya yaduwa ne ta hanyar dugon ruwa da ta zauna a iska a tsawon lokaci mai yawa bayan haka a kamu da ita ta hanyar magana. Haka zalika digo ta hanyar nunfashi na iya samuwa yayin da mutum ke numfasa iska waje ko yayin magana. Asali dai hanyar shigar kwayar cutar bai takaita a kan hanyar iska ba.
en-mt: Some have determined that the virus can be spread through droplets that have been in the air for a long time and then become infected through speech. In the same way, respiratory droplets can be formed when a person breathes air outside or while talking. Basically, the way to enter the virus is not limited to the airway.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: Digon na iya fadawa a baki ko hancin wanda ke kusa wata sa’i ma ana iya shakar ta zuwa ga hunhu.
en-mt: The drop can fall into the mouth or nose of the person who is nearby and sometimes it can be inhaled into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Wasu dagag cikin hanyoyin samada da lafiya kamar saka bututu don shakar iska da kuma farfadowa ta zuci suna iya zama sila na yada cutar ta iska.
en-mt: Some of the health and safety procedures such as breathing tubes and cardiopulmonary resuscitation can be a sign of airborne transmission.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Hakanan yana iya yaduwa lokacin da mutum ya taɓa abin da ya gurbata, gami da fata, sannan ya taɓa idanunsu, hanci, ko bakin su.
en-mt: It can also be spread when a person touches contaminated material, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: A yayin da yaduwar ta na iya faruwa ta hanyar kashi ke razanar da mutane, hatsarin ta kuwa na da karanci matuka.
en-mt: While its spread can occur through bone contact with people, its risk is very low.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Gwamnatin China ta karyata yiwuwar yaduwar kamuwa da SaRS-CoV-2 ta hanyar takshi zuwa baki. Kwayar cutar ta fiye yaduwa rana uku da nuna alama sai dai akwai yiwuwar yaduwar ta kafin alamun sun bayyana ko kuma kafin ta ketara zuwa mataki na biyu na ciwon.
en-mt: The Chinese government has denied the possibility of transmission of SaRS-CoV-2 through mouth-to-mouth transmission. The virus spreads more than three days after showing symptoms, but there is a possibility of its spreading before the symptoms appear or before it passes to the second stage of the disease.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Bayan gwaji an gano mutane sun kamu da cutar har tsawon kwana uku kafin bayyanar alamomin ta. Wannan ke nuna cewa akwai yiwuwar kamuwa da cutar kafin bayyanar alamomin ta.
en-mt: After testing, people were found to be infected for three days before showing symptoms. This indicates that there is a possibility of infection before the appearance of its symptoms.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: kadan dag cikin rahotannin dakin gwaji kae tabbatar da mmatsanancin hali da aka samu, amman tsananin yaduwar ya tabbata a wasu kasashe yayin binciken yaduwar da ma alaka.
en-mt: Some of the reports from the laboratory confirm the severity of the condition, but the severity of the spread has been confirmed in some countries during the investigation of the spread and the relationship.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Hukumar dakile yadduwar cututtuka na nahiyar turai ta sanar da cewa mutum daya yakan iya raba ma mutum biyu ko uku cutar. Kuma kwayar cutar na tasiri sa’o’i zuwa ranaku a fili.
en-mt: The European Commission for the Prevention of Communicable Diseases has announced that one person can spread the disease to two or three people. And the virus is effective for hours to days apparently.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: Musamman, an gano kwayar cutar har zuwa kwanaki uku akan filastik (polypropylene) da 304 bakin karfe, na kwana ɗaya a cikin kwali, kuma har tsawon sa'o'i huɗu akan jan ƙarfe.
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was detected for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day in cardboard, and for four hours on copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Wannan, duk da haka, ya bambanta dangane da ɗanshin yanayi da zafin yanayin jiki. An samu dabbobin gida da wasu dabbobin da cutar COVID-19 bayan gwaji.
en-mt: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature of the environment. Pets and other animals have been diagnosed with COVID-19 after testing.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Babu wata shaida mai nuna cewa dabba na iya zamo sanadiyar kamuwar cutar ga dan Adam. Sai dai hukumar Birtaniya ta shawarci da a wanke hannaye bayan hulda da dabba da sauran wurare da mai dauke da cutar ke iya tabawa.
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can be the cause of human infection. However, the British government advises to wash hands after contact with animals and other places that the infected person can touch.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Kwayar cutar 2 SARS-COV-2 kwayar cuta ce wanda ke da asali. An fara samo ta ne daga mutane uku masu dauke da cutar pneumonia dake tare da ciwon nunfashi mai tsanani a nan birnin Wuhan na kasar China.
en-mt: Virus 2 SARS-COV-2 is a virus that has a common origin. It was first found from three people with pneumonia with severe respiratory disease in Wuhan, China.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Dukkan fasalin Wannan sabon kwayar cutan SARS-CoV-2 Sun Faru daga coronavirus dangi iri daya a yanayin su. A Wajen Jikin mutum, a kan kashe kwayar cutan da sabulun gida, Wanda ke Narkar Da Matakan Kariya. SARS-CoV-2 Na Da dangataka Da Ainahin SARS-CoV.
en-mt: All the features of this new SARS-CoV-2 virus are derived from the same family of coronaviruses in their nature. On the outside of the human body, the virus is killed with household soap, which dissolves the protective measures. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Ana tsammanin yana da asalin zoonotic.
en-mt: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
