en-mt: On February 27, 2020, a subsidiary of Generex, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced that they have started a vaccine project to develop an Ii-Key vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: A ranar 12 Maris 2020, Ma'aikatar Lafiya ta Indiya ta sanar da cewa suna aiki tare da kebe guda 11, kuma koda akan saurin sauri zai ɗauki akalla shekara ɗaya da rabi zuwa shekara biyu don samar da maganin.

en-mt: On March 12, 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported the development of a coronavirus-like outbreak under part of the funding from the Canadian Academy for Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: A farkon makon nan, Jaridar The Guardian ta bayar da rahoton cewa Shugaban Amurka Donald Trump ya yi wa CureVac '' kudade masu yawa 'don damar samun damar yin amfani da allurar rigakafin cutar ta' 'Covid-19', wanda gwamnatin Jamus ta nuna rashin amincewarta.
en-mt: Earlier this week, The Guardian reported that US President Donald Trump had paid CureVac "a lot of money" for access to a vaccine against the disease "Covid-19", which the German government had indicated her lack of confidence.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Ranar 17 ga watan Maris 2020, Kamfanin maganin Amurka Pfizer ta sanar da hadin gwiwa tare da kamfanin BioNTech na Jamus don haɓaka rigakafi irin ta mRNA.
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, the American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a collaboration with the German company BioNTech to develop mRNA-based vaccines.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: magani irin na mRNA-based dan bNT162, wanda a yanzu ke cikin gwajin lafiya ana tsamanin shi a april 2020.
en-mt: The mRNA-based drug bNT162, which is currently in clinical trials, is expected to be released in April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: A Italiya a ranar 17 Maris 2020, Takis Biotech, wani kamfani na ilimin kimiyyar kere-kere na Italiya ya sanar da cewa za su sami sakamakon gwajin-asibiti a watan Afrilu 2020 kuma dan takarar na karshe na rigakafin cutar zai iya fara gwajin dan adam da faduwa.
en-mt: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotechnology company announced that they will receive the results of the clinical trial in April 2020 and that the final vaccine candidate can begin human trials and fall.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: A Faransa a ranar 19 Maris 2020, Kungiyar Hadin Gwiwa game da Cike da cuta (CEPI) ta sanar da saka hannun jari na dala miliyan $ 4.9 a cikin wata cibiyar bincike ta COVID-19 wacce ta shafi Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), da Jami'ar Pittsburgh, suna kawowa, Jami'ar Pittsburgh, suna kawowa Jami'ar Pittsburgh, suna kawo Kudaden hannun jarin CEPI a cikin ci gaban allurar rigakafin COVID-19 zuwa dala miliyan 29.
en-mt: In France on 19 March 2020, the Cooperative on Epidemiology (CEPI) announced an investment of $4.9 million in a research center for COVID-19 involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing the University of Pittsburgh, bringing the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's investment in the development of a vaccine against COVID-19 to 29 million dollars.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: Sauran abokan hadin gwiwar CEPI don ci gaban allurar rigakafin COVID-19 sune Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, Jami'ar Hong Kong, Jami'ar Oxford, da Jami'ar Queensland.
en-mt: Other CEPI partners for the development of a vaccine against COVID-19 are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: A ranar 20 ga Maris 2020, jami’an kiwon lafiya na kasar Rasha sun ba da sanarwar cewa masana kimiyya sun fara gwajin dabbobi daban-daban ‘yan takarar rigakafi shida.
en-mt: On March 20, 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists had begun animal testing of six vaccine candidates.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Masu binciken Kwalejin Kwaleji ta Landan sun sanar a ranar 20 ga Maris 2020 cewa suna haɓaka maganin RNA na karɓar kansa don COVID-19.
en-mt: University College London researchers announced on March 20, 2020 that they are developing a self-replicating RNA therapy for COVID-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: Aka haɓaka maganin rigakafin cikin kwanaki 14 ya inda aka samo jerin gwajin daga China.
en-mt: The vaccine was developed within 14 days after the test series was obtained from China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: A ƙarshen watan Maris, gwamnatin Kanada ta ba da sanarwan miliyan C$275 a cikin kudade don ayyukan bincike na 96 a kan magungunan ƙetare game da COVID-19, hade da takara da yawa na allurar rigakafi a kamfanoni da jami'o'in Kanada, kamar ayyukan Medicago da Jami'ar Saskatchewan.
en-mt: At the end of March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on foreign drugs against COVID-19, including several vaccine competitions at Canadian companies and universities. such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan projects.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: A kusan lokaci guda, Gwamnatin Kanada ta ba da miliyan C$192 musamman don inganta allurar rigakafin COVID-19, tare da shirye-shiryen kafa "bankin maganin rigakafin" na ƙasa na wasu sabbin alluran rigakafin da za a iya amfani da su idan wani barkewar cutar coronavirus ya faru.
en-mt: At about the same time, the Government of Canada has committed C$192 million specifically to develop a vaccine against COVID-19, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of new vaccines that could be used in the event of another outbreak. the coronavirus has happened.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: A ranar 2 ga Afrilu 2020, masu bincike a Jami'ar Pittsburgh makarantar ilimin magani sun ba da rahoto game da gwajin PittCoVacc, yiwuwar maganin rigakafin COVID-19 a cikin beraye, yana mai cewa "MNA ta ba da ƙarancin SARS-CoV-2 S1 allurar rigakafin ta nuna yiwuwar antigen-specific amsawar garkuwar jiki [a cikin bera] wadanda suka fara bayyana makonni 2 bayan alurar rigakafi."
en-mt: On April 2, 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on the testing of PittCoVacc, a possible vaccine against COVID-19 in mice, stating that "MNA provided less SARS-CoV-2 S1 vaccine showed possible antigen-specific immune responses [in mice] that first appeared 2 weeks after vaccination."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: a canada a ranar 16 ga watan afrilu 2020, makarantar magunguna karkashin jamiar waterloo sun sanar da feshin hanci a matsayin maganin su na kwayar halittar DNA.
en-mt: in Canada on April 16, 2020, the school of medicine under the University of Waterloo announced the nasal spray as their treatment for the DNA molecule.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Amfani da kwayoyin cuta, ana tsara kwayar halitta ta DNA don yin kwayar cutar cikin jikin dan adam don samar da kwayoyin cuta marasa cutarwa, wadanda zasu iya tayar da tsarin garkuwar jiki don samar da kwayoyin kariya daga kwayar ta SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Using bacteria, the DNA of the virus is programmed into the human body to produce harmless bacteria, which can stimulate the body's immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: A watan Maris 2020, gwamnatin amurka , masana’antu da ma wasu jami’oi guda uku sun hada karfi don samar da nau’rori dag kamfanin IBM da ma ayukan bayan sirri na yanar gizo daga kamfanin Hewlett Packard, amazon, microsoft da ma Google.
en-mt: In March 2020, the U.S. government, industry and three other agencies joined forces to produce products from IBM and web servers from Hewlett Packard, Amazon, Microsoft and Google. .

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Wasu magungunan rigakafin suna da tasirin cutar heterologous, wanda kuma ake kira tasirin da ba na takamaiman sakamako ba.
en-mt: Some vaccines have a heterologous effect, which is also called a non-specific effect.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Hakan yana nufin suna iya samun fa'idodi fiye da cuta wanda aka kare.
en-mt: That means they can have more benefits than the disease that is protected.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Wani ci gaban gwajin da aka yi barkatai a Australia Yana Neman shigarwan ma’aikacin kiwon lafiya guda 4,170
en-mt: A pilot trial developed in Australia seeks 4,170 health worker entries

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: Yana yiwuwa rigakafin a cikin ci gaba ba zai zama da aminci ko tasiri ba.
en-mt: It is possible that the vaccine in development will not be safe or effective.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Binciken farko domin samun ingancin rigakafin ta yin amfani da CoVID-19 ƙayyadaddu tsarin dabbobi, kamar ACE2-transgenic bera, da ma wasu dabobin dakin Gwaji da wadanda asalin su ba Mutum ba ne, sun nuna bukatar aunawar tsarewan mataki uku na lafiyar halita wato biosafety-level 3 na rikewar kwayar cuta masu rai, da daidaituwan duniya domin tabbatar da tsarin lafiya.
en-mt: Preliminary studies on vaccine efficacy using CoVID-19 specific animal models, such as the ACE2-transgenic mouse, as well as laboratory animals and non-human animals, have demonstrated the need for three-level biosafety measures. -level 3 of live virus control, and global compatibility to ensure a healthy system.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: An yi maganin rigakafin cutar SARS da MERS a cikin samfurin dabba na mutane.
en-mt: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in human animal models.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: Har zuwa 2020, babu wani maganin warkarwa ko rigakafin kariya daga SARS wanda aka nuna yana da kyau da tasiri a cikin mutane.
en-mt: As of 2020, there is no cure or vaccine against SARS that has been shown to be effective in humans.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: Dangane da takardun bincike da aka buga a 2005 da 2006, ganowa da haɓaka allurar rigakafi da magunguna don magance SARS ya kasance fifiko ga gwamnatoci da hukumomin kiwon lafiyar jama’a duniya. Hakanan babu wani ingantaccen maganin alurar rigakafi kan MERS.
en-mt: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the discovery and development of vaccines and drugs to treat SARS has been a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world. There is also no effective vaccine against MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: Lokacin da MERS ya zama ruwan dare, an yi imanin cewa bincike na SARS wanda akwai na iya samar da samfuri mai amfani don ci gaba da allurar rigakafi da warkewa game da kamuwa da cutar MERS-CoV.
en-mt: When MERS becomes widespread, it is believed that the existing SARS research can provide a useful model for the development of vaccines and therapeutics against MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: Tun daga Maris 2020, akwai allurar rigakafi (bisa ga DNA) MERS wanda ya ƙare Matak I gwaji na asibiti a cikin mutane, da kuma wasu uku da ke ci gaba, dukkan waɗannan rigakafi ne na masu tafiya da kwayoyin cuta, adenoviral-vectored guda biyu (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac ), kuma MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
en-mt: As of March 2020, there is a vaccine (based on DNA) MERS that has completed Phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others that are in progress, all of which are vaccines for the traveling bacteria, adenoviral-vectored. two (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac ), and MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Tura rubutu ta hanyar sadarwar sun inganta wata ka'ida tunani mai zurfi masu cewa an san kwayar cutar da ke haifar da COVID-19 kuma an riga an sami allurar rigakafi.
en-mt: Social media posts have promoted a common theory that the virus that causes COVID-19 is known and a vaccine is already available.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: Abubuwan da aka ambata waɗanda aka buga ta hanyar kafofin watsa labarun daban-daban na kafofin watsa labarun suna ambatar bayanan da suka kasance game da jerin kwayoyin da kuma alurar rigakafin wasu ƙwayar cuta ta coronavirus kamar SARS coronavirus.
en-mt: The aforementioned articles published by various social media platforms mention the information that was available about the sequence of the virus and the vaccine against some of the coronaviruses such as the SARS coronavirus.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: cututtukan b'coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) cuta ce wanda ta haifar da matsananciyar rashin lafiya mai saurin kamuwa da cuta coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: b'coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a disease caused by the highly contagious disease coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Alamun kullum sun hada da zazzabi, tari, da matsalar numfashi.
en-mt: Symptoms usually include fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Sauran alamu na iya haɗawa da gajiya, ciwon tsoka, zawo, ciwon makogwaro, rashin kamshi da zafin ciki.
en-mt: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle aches, diarrhea, sore throat, bad breath and abdominal pain.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Lokacin kamuwa zuwa bayyanuwar alamun cutar kimanin kwanaki biyar ne amma zai iya bambanta daga biyu zuwa kwanaki goma sha hudu.
en-mt: The time from infection to the appearance of symptoms is about five days but can vary from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Yayin da yawancin lokuta ke haifar da karamar bayyanar cututtuka, wasu ci gaba zuwa cutar huhu da gazawar ƙwayoyin cuta da yawa.
en-mt: While most cases cause mild symptoms, some progress to lung disease and multiple organ failure.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: A ranar 17 Afrilu 2020, an samu karin masu cutan fiye da miliyan biyu (2.24) daga kasashe dari biyu da goma (210) wadda ya jawo mutuwan fiye da miliyan dari da hamsin da uku (153, 000).
en-mt: On 17 April 2020, there were more than two million (2.24) cases from two hundred and ten (210) countries, which caused more than one hundred and fifty-three million (153,000) deaths.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Fiye da mutane dubu dari biyar da sittin da takwas ne suka warke (568, 000). Cutan yana samun yaduwa ne tsakanin mutane yayinda suka kusanci juna, yawancin lokuta ta karamin digon yawu da ke zuwa ta wurin tari, atishawa, ko magana.
en-mt: More than five hundred and sixty-eight thousand people have recovered (568,000). The disease is spread between people when they are close to each other, often through small droplets that come through coughing, sneezing, or talking.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Yayin da ɗigagga na fitowa lokacin numfashi, yawancin su na faduwa zuwa kasa ko kan farfajiya maimakon zaman mai iya ba da cuta daga tsawon nesa.
en-mt: As droplets are released during breathing, most of them fall to the floor or surfaces instead of being able to transmit disease from a long distance.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Mutane na iya kamuwa da cutan ta wurin taba gurbataccen farfajiya sannan su taba idanu, hanci, ko baki.
en-mt: People can become infected by touching a contaminated surface and touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: Cutar na iya rayuwa a farfajiya har awa saba’in da biyu (72).
en-mt: The disease can live on the surface for up to seventy-two (72) hours.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: Ya fi yaduwa a rana uku na farko da fara nuna alamu, ko da yake yana iya yaduwa kafin alamun su bayyana daga baya. Hanyan ganewar asalin cutar ta wurin real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) daga daukan samfurin gwaji daga bayan hanci wato nasopharyngeal swab.
en-mt: It is most common in the first three days after symptoms appear, although it can spread before symptoms appear later. The method of identifying the origin of the disease is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from taking a test sample from the back of the nose, namely the nasopharyngeal swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: An ba da shawaran amfani da abin rufe fuska wadanda suke zaton suna da cutan, tare da masu kula da su.
en-mt: Those who think they have the disease, along with their caregivers, are advised to use masks.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Shawarwarin amfani da kariyar rufe fuska da jama'a sun bambanta, tare da wasu hukumomi suna ba da shawararin a guje amfni da su, wasu na shawarar yin amfani da su, wadansu suna buƙatar amfani da su.
en-mt: Recommendations for the use of face coverings by the public vary, with some authorities recommending avoiding them, others recommending their use, and others requiring their use.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: A halin yanzu, babu maganin alurar rigakafi ko takamaiman maganin rigakafi na COVID-19.
en-mt: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: An yi rikodin bazawar cutan a gida cikin yawancin ƙasashe kewaye da yankuna shida na WHO.
en-mt: Domestic transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries around the six WHO regions.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Wadanda suka kamu da kwayar cutar na iya zama nunin cutar ko haɓaka alamomin kamuwa da mura kamar zazzabi, tari, gajiya, da gazawar numfashi.
en-mt: Those infected with the virus may exhibit or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Alamun gaggawa sun kunshi wahalan numfashi, ciwon kirji ko matsi, rikicewa, wahalan tashiwa, da shudaden fuska ko lebuna; ana shawarar ganin likita da gaggawa idan aka ga wadannan alamu.
en-mt: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, chest pain or tightness, confusion, difficulty standing, and pale face or lips; It is recommended to see a doctor immediately if you see these symptoms.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Wasu lokuta, alamu da suka shafi numfashi kamar atishawa, yoyon hanci ko kuma bushewar wuya na bayyanuwa.
en-mt: Sometimes, symptoms related to breathing like sneezing, runny nose or dry neck appear.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Ana ganin kwayar cututtukan ciki kamar tashin zuciya, amai da zawo an lura da su a kashi dabam-dabam.
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhea are observed at different doses.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Wasu masun kamuwa da cutan da matsalar daurin zuciya da saurin bugun zuciya an same su a China.
en-mt: Some infected people with congestive heart failure and rapid heart rate have been found in China.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: A wadansu, cutar za to iya cigaba har zuwa ga cutar limonia, rashin aikin gabobi da mutuwa.
en-mt: In some, the disease can progress to limonia, organ failure and death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Wannan shine ake kira lokacin hayayyafar cutar.
en-mt: This is called the reproductive period of the disease.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: Lokacin kwanci na COVID-19 kwanaki biyar zuwa shida me amma zai iya dauki kwanaki biyu zuwa 14.
en-mt: The incubation period for COVID-19 is five to six days, but it can last two to 14 days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: Kashi 97.5% na mutane da suka nuna alamun sukan yi hakan ne cikin kwanaki goma sha daya da rabi (11.5) da kamuwa. Rohoto ta nuna cewa ba duka wadanda suka kamu bane suke nuna alamun kamuwa da ciwon ba.
en-mt: 97.5% of people who show symptoms usually do so within eleven and a half (11.5) days of infection. Rohoto pointed out that not all those infected show symptoms of the disease.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: Matsayin wadannan masu dauke da cutan wanda bai nuna ba a wajen yadar da shi ba a sani ba tukuna; ko da shike, wasu shaidu sun ba da alama cewa za su iya yaduwa da cutan.
en-mt: The position of these carriers of the disease that does not show in spreading it is not known yet; however, some evidence suggests that they can spread the disease.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: A yanzu haka ba a san kimanin rabon mutane da ba su nuna alamun kamuwa da cutan ba, amma ana kan bincike. Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) ta ba da rahoton cewa kashi 20% na duka wadanda aka tabatar suna da cutar ba su nuna alamun ba a zamansu a asibiti.
en-mt: Right now it is not known about the proportion of people who do not show signs of infection, but it is under investigation. Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reported that 20% of all those diagnosed with the disease did not show symptoms during their stay in the hospital.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: Hukumar kula da lafiya ta kasar Sin ta fara hada wanda suke nuna alamun rashin lafiya cikin masun kamuwa da cutar a yau da kullun rana 1 ga Afrilu; daga cikin masun kamu da cutar su 166 a ranar, 130 (78%) sun kasance masun nuna alamun rashin lafiyar a lokacin gwaji.
en-mt: The Chinese Health Authority has started to include those who show signs of illness among those infected with the disease on a daily basis on April 1; of the 166 infected on the day, 130 (78%) were symptomatic at the time of testing.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: Duk majina da yau na iya ɗaukar kwayar cuta da yawa.
en-mt: All of today's people can carry many viruses.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Yin magana da qarfin yana bada damar fita sosai ba kamar yin magana yadda aka saba ba.
en-mt: Speaking with power allows you to get out more than speaking normally.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Wata bincike da aka yi a Singapore ta bayyana cewa tari na iya jawo faduwa da ke tafiya mita 4.5 (kafa 15).
en-mt: A study in Singapore revealed that coughing can cause falls that travel 4.5 meters (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Ko da shike kwayar cutan ba zallan iska yake bi ba, National Academy of Science ta ba da shawara cewa bioaerosol transmission na iya faruwa idan aka ajiye air collectors a farfajiya a waje, kusa da muhallin mutane wanda aka samu samfurin tabattace na RNA.
en-mt: Although the virus is not only airborne, the National Academy of Science suggests that bioaerosol transmission can occur if air collectors are placed in outdoor areas, near human environments where a positive sample of RNA has been obtained.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Wasu hanyoyin kiwon lafiya kamar su ciki da kuma farfadowa da zuciya (CPR) na iya haifarda gurbataccen iska wanda zai haifar da yaduwar iska.
en-mt: Some medical procedures such as CPR and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) can create air pollution that will cause air circulation.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: Yayinda akwai damuwa ana iya yada shi ta hanyar bayan gida, an yi imanin wannan haɗarin ya yi ƙasa kaɗan. Kwayar cutar ta fi yaduwa yayin da mutane ke alamtawa, yayinda yaduwa zai iya yiwuwa kafin bayyanar cututtuka, hadarin ya yi ƙasa kaɗan.
en-mt: While there is concern that it can be spread through the toilet, this risk is believed to be low. The virus is more likely to spread when people are symptomatic, and while transmission may occur before symptoms appear, the risk is very low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Cibiyar Yaki da Cututtuka ta Yankin Turai (ECDC) ta ce yayin da ba a bayyana cikakke yadda cutar ke yaduwa cikin sauki ba, mutum daya yana cutar da biyu zuwa uku. Kwayar cutar na rayuwa tsawon awanni zuwa kwanaki a kan abu.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Control (ECDC) said that while it is not clear how easily the disease spreads, one person infects two to three. The virus lives for hours to days on the surface.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: Musamman, an gano kwayar cutar ta kwana ɗaya a cikin kwali, har zuwa kwanaki uku akan filastik (polypropylene) da baƙin ƙarfe (AISI 304), kuma har zuwa sa'o'i huɗu akan 99% jan ƙarfe.
en-mt: In particular, the virus was detected for one day in cardboard, up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and iron (AISI 304), and up to four hours on 99% copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Koyaya, wannan ya bambanta dangane da zafi da zazzabi.
en-mt: However, this varies depending on the heat and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: Sabulu na taimakawa idan an yi amfani da shi daidai; samfurin sabulu na tarwasa cutar kuma ya ciresu daga fata da wasu farfajiya.
en-mt: Soap helps if used correctly; soap products disperse the disease and remove them from the skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Sauran mafita kamar benzalkonium chloride da chlorhexidine gluconate, basuda tasiri, A cikin nazarin Hong kong, samfurin yawun baki aka ɗaukar na kwana biyu bayan an fara bada kula a asibiti.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate, are not effective. In the Hong Kong study, oral samples were taken two days after hospital admission.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: A cikin marasa lafiya biyar daga cikin shida, samfurin farko ya nuna mafi yawan cuta, sannan mara lafiya na shidan ya nuna mafi yawan nauyin cutar a rana ta biyu da aka yi gwajin.
en-mt: In five of the six patients, the first sample showed the most disease, and the sixth patient showed the most disease burden on the second day of the test.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Mai tsananin ciwo na numfashi cutar corona ta biyu 2 (SARS-CoV-2) matsanancin ciwo mai dauke da cutar corona, farko an killace mutane uku masu fama da cutar huhu da alaka da gungu da rashin lafiya na numfashi a cikin Wuhan.
en-mt: Severe respiratory disease second corona virus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) severe disease with corona virus, first three people suffering from lung disease related to cluster and respiratory disease were isolated in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: Dukkanin abubuwan fasalin novel na cutar SARS-CoV-2 faruwa a cikin ƙwayar cutar ta corona a cikin yanayi.
en-mt: All the novel features of the SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in the corona virus in nature.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: A wajen jikin mutum ana kashe cutar da sabulu na gida wadda yake karya karfinsa. SARS-CoV-2 shi ke mafi kama da asalin SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Outside the human body, the disease is killed with homemade soap, which breaks his strength. SARS-CoV-2 is the most similar to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: Huhu ne suka fi samun matsala daga COVID-19 saboda kwayar cutan na samun shiga sels ta wurin enzymes angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), wanda yake da mafi yawa a irin II alveolar sels na huhu.
en-mt: The lungs are the most affected by COVID-19 because the virus enters cells through the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in type II alveolar cells of the lungs.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: Kwayar cutar ta yi amfani da Glycoprotein ta musamman da ake kira ƙaru (peplomer) don hadawa zuwa ga ACE2 don shiga host cell.
en-mt: The virus uses a special glycoprotein called peplomer to attach to ACE2 to enter the host cell.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: An gano raunin zuciya daga cikin kashi 12% na wadanda aka shigar asibiti a Wuhan, China, kuma ya fi yawa a masu tsananin cuta.
en-mt: Heart failure was diagnosed in 12% of those admitted to hospital in Wuhan, China, and was more common in those with severe disease.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: Yawan alamun ciwon zuciya na da yawa musamman, saboda tsarin kumburi da matsalolin rashin rigakafi yayinda cuta na girma, amma ciwon zuciya mai sanani yana da alaka da masu karba ACE2 a zuciya.
en-mt: The number of symptoms of heart disease is very high, due to the inflammatory process and immune problems as the disease progresses, but known heart disease is related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: Masu karɓarACE2 na fitowa sosai a cikin zuciya kuma suna bada gudu mawa wajan aikin cikin zuciya.
en-mt: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and speed up cardiac function.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: An samu mummunan haɗarin thrombosis kashi (31%) da thromboembolism na venous (25%) a cikin marasa lafiya na ICU da ke fama da COVID-19 kuma yana iya kasancewa yana da alaƙa da mummunan ci gaba.Dukatan mutanen da suka mutu sanadiyar COVID-19 sun sami matsala ta lalacewar (DAD), da lymphocyte- wanda ke da kumburi ke shiga cikin huhu.
en-mt: An increased risk of bone thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) was found in ICU patients with COVID-19 and may be associated with poor outcome. -19 had a problem with the damage (DAD), and the lymphocyte- which has inflammation enters the lungs.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: Ko da shike SARS-COV-2 yana da canza yanayi wa ACE2-expressing cells na hanyan numfashi, marasa lafiya da ke fama da COVID-19 na da alamun nuna babban kumburi.
en-mt: Although SARS-COV-2 has altered the ACE2-expressing cells of the respiratory tract, patients suffering from COVID-19 have symptoms that show high inflammation.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: A cikin sauki, an nuna cewa kwayar cuta GM-CSF-secreting T-cells na da alaka da daukan kumburi IL-6-secreting monocytes da sananin ciwon huhu a masu fama da COVID-19.
en-mt: In simple terms, it has been shown that GM-CSF-secreting T-cells are associated with recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and lung cancer in patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: An gano lymphocytic da aka binciko gawaki.
en-mt: Lymphocytic was found and analyzed.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: Hukumar ta WHO ta buga dabarun gwaji da dama na cutar.
en-mt: The WHO has published several test strategies for the disease.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Tsarin hanyar gwaji shi ne reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) na lokaci kai tsaye.
en-mt: The test method is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: Ana gwajin ne samfurin hanyar numfashi da aka samo a gwajin nasopharyngeal, duk da haka, za'a iya amfani da samfurin da aka dauka daga hanci da kuma yawun baki.
en-mt: The test is a sample of the respiratory tract obtained in a nasopharyngeal examination, however, a sample taken from the nose and mouth can be used.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: Sakamakon gwaji yana samuwa tsakanin awa biyu zuwa kwana biyu.
en-mt: Test results are available between two hours and two days.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: Ana iya amfani da gwajin jini, amma wannan na buƙatar samfuran jini guda biyu waɗanda aka ɗauki makonni biyu baya kuma sakamakon ba shi da ƙima nan take.
en-mt: A blood test can be used, but this requires two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results are not immediately valuable.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: Masana kimiyya na Kasar China ya sami damar ware nau'in kwayar cutar coronavirus da walafawar jerin kwayoyin halita sabo da dakunan gwaje-gwaje na fadin duniya za su iya haɓaka polymerase chain reaction (PCR) gwaji don gano kamuwa da kwayar cutar.
en-mt: Scientists in China have been able to isolate the type of the coronavirus and the sequencing of new genes and laboratories around the world can develop a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test to detect the infection of the virus.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: Tun daga 4 Afrilu 2020, gwaje-gwaje na rigakafin ƙwayar cuta (wanda ke iya gano kamuwa da cuta mai aiki da kuma ko mutum ya kamu da a baya) yana kan ci gaba, amma har yanzu ba a yi amfani da shi sosai ba.
en-mt: As of 4 April 2020, immunological tests (which can detect active infection and whether a person has been infected in the past) are in development, but are still not widely used.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: Bisa ga ganewar Sinawa kan gwaji, daidaito yana kashi 60 zuwa 70% kawai.
en-mt: According to the Chinese diagnosis on the test, the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: FDA ta cikin jihar America ta amince da batun kulawa ta farko a ranar 21 ga wata Maris shekara ta 2020 don anfani a qarshen waccan watan. Jagorar ganewar asali ta fito daga asibitin Zhongnan na Jami'ar wuhan ta bada shawarwaru ga hanyoyin gano cuta dangane da sifofin asibiti da hadarin kwayar cutar.
en-mt: The FDA in the United States approved the issue of first care on March 21, 2020 for benefits at the end of that month. A diagnosis guide from Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University provides recommendations for diagnosis based on clinical features and risk of the virus.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: Hadin multilubar, gilashin kasa opacitiea tare da yanki asymmetry dakuma rarraba gaba suna da yawa a farkon kamuwa da cuta.
en-mt: Multilubar, ground-glass opacitiea with regional asymmetry and anterior distribution are common in early infection.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: Mamayewar subpleural, fasa hauka, da karfafawa na iya fitowa yayinda cutan na girma.
en-mt: Subpleural invasion, pleural effusion, and consolidation may occur as the tumor progresses.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: Babu bayani sosai a kan cutar COVID-19.
en-mt: There is not much information on the disease of COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: Babban ganowa da aka yi daga binciken gawaki sune:
en-mt: The main findings from the autopsy were:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: Macroscopy: plerisy, pericarditis, inganci huhu da pulmonary oedema.
en-mt: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung quality and pulmonary oedema.

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: Za a iya lura da tsananin zafin cutar huhu guda hudu:
en-mt: Four types of lung disease can be observed:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: nimoniya wanda bai tsananta ba: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, babbar atypical pneumocytes, kumburin interstitial da kumburin lymphocytic da aukuwar babban tantanin halitar multinucleated.
en-mt: pneumonia that is not aggravated: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation and lymphocytic inflammation and the occurrence of large multinucleated cells.

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: matsanancin ciwon huhu: Rarrafa lalacewar alveolar (DAD) dakuma rarrafa alveolar exudate.
en-mt: Acute pneumonia: Diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) and diffuse alveolar exudate.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD shine sanadiyyar alamun tsananin gajiyar hanyar numfashi wato respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) tsanancin hypoxemia.
en-mt: DAD is the result of respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) severe hypoxemia.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: warkas da namoniya: kungiyoyi na exudates a alveolar cavities da pulmonary interstitial fibrosis.
en-mt: healing of pneumonia: groups of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis.

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: Jini: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); amsawar leukoerythroblastic
en-mt: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: Matakan rigakafin don rage yiwuwar kamuwa da cuta sun hada da kasancewa a gida, guje wa wuraren cunkoson jama'a, wanke hannu da sabulu da ruwa sau da yawa a kalla sekan 20, kulla da tsabtacen numfashi da kuma guje wa taɓa idanu, hanci ko baki tare da hannayen marasa wankewa.
en-mt: Preventive measures to reduce the risk of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, maintaining good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: CDC ta ba da shawarar rufe bakin da hanci da tolet papper yayin tari ko atishawa takuma badar da shawarar yin amfani da gwiwar hannu idan ba a sami tolet papper ba.
en-mt: The CDC recommends covering your mouth and nose with a tissue paper when coughing or sneezing and recommends using your elbow if tissue paper is not available.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: Tsabtacewar hannu bayan kowane tari ko atishawa ana ƙarfafa shi.
en-mt: Hand hygiene after each cough or sneeze is encouraged.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: CDC ta ba da shawarar yin amfani da mayafin rufe fuska a cikin wurin zaman jama'a, a wani ɓangare don iyakance watsa cutar daga mai alamun cutar. Tsarin nesantawa daga jama’a nufin sa domin rage huldawa da wanda ya kamu da cutar da babban tarin mutane ta hanyar rufe makarantu da wuraren aiki da ƙuntatawa tafiye-tafiye da soke babban taron jama'a.
en-mt: The CDC recommends the use of face coverings in public places, in part to limit the spread of the disease from those with symptoms. Social distancing measures aim to reduce contact with infected people and large groups of people by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and canceling large public gatherings.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: Ka’idojin nisanta sun shafi mutane su ba da ratan akalla kafa 6 (1.8 m) a gefe.
en-mt: The distance rules require people to give the ratan at least 6 feet (1.8 m) to the side.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: Babu wani magani da aka sani da zai yi tasiri don hana COVID-19. Kamar maganin rigakafi, ba zaton sa yanzu sai farin shekara 2021, wani mahimmin sashi na gudanar da COVID-19 shi ne ƙoƙarin rage ganiyar annoban, da aka sani da "karkatar da doron layin" wato flattening the curve.
en-mt: There is no known medicine that will be effective in preventing COVID-19. Like vaccines, not expected until 2021, an important part of managing COVID-19 is trying to slow the spread of the disease, known as "flattening the curve".

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: CDC sun bayar da shawarar cewa mutane su rika wanke hannaye sau da yawa da sabulu da ruwa na tsawon kimanin sakan 20, musamman bayan an je ba haya ko hannaye sun yi datti a bayyane, kafin cin abinci ko bayan an hura hanci, tari ko atishawa.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and water for about 20 seconds, especially after going to the bathroom or visibly soiled hands, before eating or after blowing their nose, coughing or sneezing. .

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: Ya kuma ƙara bada shawarar yin amfani da ruwan wanke hannu mai sinadarin kashe kwayoyin cuta mai aqalla sinadarai kashi 60%, Amma sai lokacin da babu sabulu da ruwa akusa, dakuma yankunan da basu wadata da amfani da sanidarin wanke hannu ba. WHO ta samar da tsari guda biyu don samar da abubuwan cikin gida.
en-mt: He also recommended the use of hand sanitizer with at least 60% chemicals, but only when there is no soap and water, and in areas that do not have enough to use hand sanitizer. WHO has developed two systems for domestic production.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: A cikin wadannan tsari, aikin kashe karfin kananan halittu da ido ba ya iya gani ya taso ne daga sinadaran giya, wato ethanol ko isopropanol.
en-mt: In these processes, the action of killing the microorganisms that the eye cannot see arises from the ingredients of alcohol, namely ethanol or isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: Ana amfani da Hydrogen peroxide domin cire ramukan kwayoyin cuta a cikin giya; ba shi da inganci domin tsaftace hannu.
en-mt: Hydrogen peroxide is used to remove bacteria holes in wine; It is not effective for cleaning hands.

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: An qara glycerol a matsayin humectant.
en-mt: Glycerol is added as a humectant.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: Ana sarrafa mutane da kulawa mai tallafi, wanda zai iya hadawa da ruwan magani, na'urar bada numfashi da tallafa wa wasu gabobin da abin ya shafa.
en-mt: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluids, ventilators and supporting other affected organs.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: CDC ta bayar da shawara cewa wadanda ake zargi da cewa suna dauke da kwayar cutan su sanya abin rufe fuska.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that those suspected of having the virus wear a mask.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: An yi amfani da Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) domin taimaka wa masu matsalan zuciya bisa dalilin rashin samun numfashi, amma ba a tabbatar da amfaninsa ba.
en-mt: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to help patients with heart problems due to respiratory failure, but its effectiveness has not been proven.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: An bada shawarar tsabtacewar mutum da ingantaccen tsarin lafiyan rayuwa da abinci don inganta garkuwar jiki.
en-mt: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet are recommended to improve immunity.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Taimako mai taimako yana da amfani a cikin waɗanda ke da jiyya mai sauƙi a farkon kamuwa da cuta WHO da hukumar kula da lafiya ta kasar china sun wallafa shawarwari game da kula da asibiti da marassa lafiya dake dauke da kwayar cutar COVID-19.
en-mt: Supportive care is useful in those with mild treatment in the early stages of infection The WHO and the Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations on hospital care for patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Intensivists da pulmonologists a U.S sun samar da hanyoyin jiyya daga hukumomi dabam-dabam, wato IBCC.
en-mt: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the US have provided treatment methods from different agencies, namely IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Tun daga Afrilu 2020 babu takamaiman maganin ƙwayar cutar ta COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 2020 there is no specific treatment for the virus of COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Don alama, wasu ƙwararru likitoci sun ba da shawarar fara anfani da paracetamol akan ibuprofin.
en-mt: For example, some medical experts recommend starting with paracetamol over ibuprofen.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: Dole a dauki matakan kariya domin rage yaduwan kwayan cutan, musamman a ma’aikatun lafiya yayinda ake zatas da ayukan da ke iya kirkiro aerosols kamar su hand ventilators, wato injin shakar iska.
en-mt: Preventive measures must be taken to reduce the spread of the virus, especially in health departments when there are activities that can create aerosols such as hand ventilators, that is a machine for breathing air.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: Masu kiwon lafiya da ke kula da mutane masu COVID-19, CDC ta bayar da shawaran sanya mutumin cikin AIIR, wato dakin da aka kebe tare da kiyayewa, kiyaye haduwa da kiyayewan iska. CDC sun bayyana ka’idoji na amfani da kayan kare kai (PPE) a lokacin anoban.
en-mt: For health care workers who care for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an AIIR, which is an isolated room with protection, contact protection and ventilation protection. The CDC has outlined guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: Kayan sa jiki wanda aka bada shawarar shine: PPE, na’urar numfashi ko kariyar rufe fuska, kariyar ido, da safofin hannu. Lokacin da akwai, na’urar numfashi (maimakon kariyar fuska) an fi son su.
en-mt: Recommended personal protective equipment is: PPE, respirator or mask, eye protection, and gloves. When available, respirators (rather than face shields) are preferred.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Ana ba da izinin na’urar numfashi N95 ga wuraren masana'antu amma FDA ta ba da izinin kariyar rufe fuska a ƙarƙashin Izinin Amfani mai Gaggawa (EUA).
en-mt: N95 respirators are permitted for industrial facilities but the FDA allows protective masks under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: An tsara su don kare abubuwa daga barbashin iska kamar ƙura amma na da inganci akan takamaiman wakilin Halittu wanda bashi da lamunin ga shan magani ba tare da izinin likita ba.
en-mt: They are designed to protect things from airborne particles such as dust but are effective against a specific biological agent that is not warranted to take medicine without a doctor's permission.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Lokacin da babu takunkumi, CDC ta ba da shawarar amfani da garkuwar fuska or irin takunkumin da ake hadawa a gida.
en-mt: When there are no restrictions, the CDC recommends the use of face shields or similar restrictions that are made at home.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: Nau'in ƙwayar cutar ta COVID-19 batayi tsananin daya isa ta buƙaci samun iska ko kuma madadin haka, amman wasu lokata akan samu.
en-mt: The type of virus that causes COVID-19 is not severe enough to require ventilation or an alternative, but sometimes it is.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: Ana yin nazarin nau'in tallafin na numfashi ga mutane da ke da cutar ta hanyar COVID-19 da ke fama da matsalar numfashi ga mutanen da ke asibiti, tare da wasu shaidun da ke nuna cewa za a iya hana intabalation tare da hauhawar hanci da jijiyoyi ko matattarar karfin iska.
en-mt: The type of respiratory support is being studied for people with the disease caused by COVID-19 and suffering from respiratory problems in people who are hospitalized, with some evidence that intabalation can be prevented with nasal inflation and nerves or air pressure filters.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Ba a sani ba ko daya daga cikin wadannan biyu zai iya samar da wani amfani iri daya ga mutanen da  suke fama da matsananciyar rashin lafiya.
en-mt: It is not known whether one of these two can provide the same benefit to people who are suffering from severe illness.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Wasu likitocin sunfi son tsarin iska na invasive idan yasamu saboda wamnan tsarin yana tsaƙaita yaduwa abubuwan aerosol, idan aka kwatanta da wucewar nasal cannula. Matsananci cutar sunfi kamuwa da tsofaffi(wayanda suka zarce shekaru 60, mussan masu shekaru 80).
en-mt: Some doctors prefer an invasive ventilation system if possible because this system limits the spread of aerosols, compared to the passage of a nasal cannula. The severity of the disease is more common among the elderly (those over 60 years old, especially those over 80 years old).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Kasashe masun tasowa dayawa ba su da isashen gadajen asibiti ko wace mallaka, wanda ya rage karfin tsarin lafiya ga iya rikewar tashin yawan masu kamuwa da COVID-19 mai tsananin sosai wanda ke bukatar gama gado a asibiti.
en-mt: Many developing countries do not have enough hospital beds, which reduces the capacity of the health system to handle the surge in the number of people infected with COVID-19, which is very severe and requires hospital beds.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: Wata bincike a China ta gano cewa an shigar da kashi biyar (5%) cikin dakin jiyya na masu mawuyacin hali, kashi 2.3% na bukatan taimakawa da injin shakar iska, sannan 1.4% sun mutu.
en-mt: A study in China found that five percent (5%) were admitted to the intensive care unit, 2.3% required ventilator support, and 1.4% died.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: A China, kusan kashi talatin (30%) na mutanen da ke asibiti da COVID-19 kan samu shiga sashen gaggawa wato ICU.
en-mt: In China, about thirty percent (30%) of people who are hospitalized with COVID-19 are admitted to the emergency department or ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: Gudun iska yana zama mafi rikitarwa yayin da ciwo mai raunin numfashi (ARDS) ke tasowa a cikin COVID-19 kuma oxygenation ya zama da wahala.
en-mt: Airflow becomes more complicated as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes difficult.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Na’urar bada iska wato Ventilators mai tsarafawa ta hanyar matsin iska da PEEP, ana buƙatar su domin ƙara girmar ba da iska, yayin da an rage hadarin samun ciwon da ke da alaka da na’urar iska da pneumothorax.
en-mt: Ventilators that regulate air pressure and PEEP are needed to increase ventilation, while reducing the risk of ventilator-associated morbidity and pneumothorax.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: Dogon PEEP ba zai iya samunwa ba a tsohon na’urar bada iska.
en-mt: Longer PEEP cannot be achieved in older ventilators.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: Bincike a kan hanyoyin jiyya ta fara a Janairu 2020, kuma ana kan gwajin magunguna na yaki da cututtuka da dama.
en-mt: Research on treatment methods began in January 2020, and drugs are being tested against several diseases.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: Remdesivir ya bayyana a matsayin mafi cikawa.
en-mt: Remdesivir appears to be the most effective.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Ko da yake Sabbin magunguna za su iya ɗaukar lokaci har zuwa 2021 kafin a haɓaka su. An riga an amince da yawancin magungunan da ake gwaji domin wadansu amfani ko suna gwajin da ya yi gaba.
en-mt: Although new drugs may take up to 2021 to be developed. Most of the drugs that are being tested have already been approved for other uses or are in advanced testing.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Za a iya gwada maganin jiyyan kwayan cutar mutane masu tsananin ciwo.
en-mt: Antibiotics may be tried in people with severe pain.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO ta shawarci masu sa kai su shiga cikin hanyoyin inganci, tasiri da amincin yiwuwar magani. FDA ta ba da izini na wucin gadi don convalescent plasma a matsayin gwajin daya shafi rayuwar mutum cikin hatsari.
en-mt: WHO advises volunteers to participate in the process of quality, effectiveness and safety of possible treatment. The FDA has granted provisional approval for convalescent plasma as a life-threatening test.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: Ba a riga an yi binciken asibiti wanda ake bukata ba don nuna cewa za a iya amfani da shi kuma tana da muhimanci ga cutar.
en-mt: There has not yet been clinical research that is needed to show that it can be used and that it is important for the disease.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: A watan Fabrairu na 2020 china ta ƙaddamar da manhajar waya don magance barkewar cutar.
en-mt: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the outbreak.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: Akan bukaci masun amfani su shigar da suna da lambar ID.
en-mt: Users are required to enter their name and ID number.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: Manhajar nada daman gano mutane na kusa kuma nayin amfani da bayanan sa ido, don haka haɗari da iyuwar kamuwa da cuta.
en-mt: The software identifies nearby people and uses surveillance data, thus the risk and potential of infection.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Kowanne mai amfani zai iya duba matsayin masu amfani guda uku.
en-mt: Each user can view the status of three users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Idan an gano yiwuwar haɗarin, ba kebewar kai kadai manhajar ya shawarta ba, yana iya fadakar da jami’an kiwon lafiya na cikin gida. Nazarcewar babban bayanan kan bayanan waya, fasahar gane fuska, bin sawu da waya da fasaha na wucin gadi ana amfani da don gano mutanen da ke kamuwa da cuta, Kuma mutanen da suka yi tuntuba cikin Koriya ta Kudu, Taiwan da Singapore.
en-mt: If a possible risk is detected, not only self-isolation is recommended by the software, but it can alert local health officials. Big data analysis of phone records, facial recognition technology, phone tracking and artificial intelligence are being used to identify people who are infected, and people who have had contact in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: A cikin Maris 2020 gwamnatin Isra'ila ta ba hukumomin tsaro damar bin diddigin bayanan wayar hannu na mutanen da ke dauke da kwayar cutar Corona.
en-mt: In March 2020, the Israeli government allowed security agencies to track the mobile phone data of people infected with the Corona virus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: An dauki matakan domin tabbatar da killacewa domin tsare wadanda suke hulda da wanda suna da cutan.
en-mt: Measures have been taken to ensure isolation to protect those who are in contact with those who have the disease.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kuma a watan Maris 2020, Deutsche Telekom ta raba wurare na waya da data da hukuman gwamnatin tarayya na Gemany, Robert Koch Institute, domin bincika hanyoyi na yaki da yaduwan cutan.
en-mt: And in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared phone and data facilities with Germany's Robert Koch Institute to research ways to combat the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: Rasha ta tura fasahar amincewa da fasahar gano fuska don gano masu ketare dokan kebewa.
en-mt: Russia has deployed facial recognition and facial recognition technology to track down illegal immigrants.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: kwamishinar lafiya na Italy, Giulio Gallera, ya ce masu sarafa wayar hannu sun sanar masa da cewa kashi arba’in (40%) na mutane suna ci gaba yawonsu.
en-mt: Italy's health commissioner, Giulio Gallera, said that mobile operators have informed him that forty percent (40%) of people are continuing their journey.

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: Gwamnatin Jamus ta gudanar da wani shiri na hutun karshen mako 48 tare da mahalarta taron sama da 42,000.
en-mt: The German government has organized a program of 48 weekends with more than 42,000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Hakanan shugaban Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid ya yi kiran ga duniya don samun mafita, akan yaduwar cutar ta Corona.
en-mt: Also, the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, called on the world to find a solution to the spread of the Corona virus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Mutane na iya samun matsala a ta dalilin killacewa, dokoki a kan tafiye-tafiye, illan jiyya ko kuma tsoron kamuwa da cutan kanta.
en-mt: People may have problems due to restrictions, travel laws, side effects of treatment or fear of infection itself.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC ta nakalto Rory O'Connor yana cewa, "Karuwar warewar jama'a, kadaici, damuwar rashin lafiya, gajiya da kuma durkushewar tattalin arziki sune cikakkiyar guguwa da zata cutar da lafiyar kwakwalwa mutane da kuma lafiyar jama'a."
en-mt: The BBC quoted Rory O'Connor as saying, "Increasing social isolation, loneliness, health concerns, fatigue and the economic downturn are a perfect storm that will harm people's mental health and public health."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: Wannan cuta na iya shiga ta hanya mai sauki tare da kaɗan ko babu alamun, masu kama da cutar lumphashi, irinsu mura na yauda kullum.
en-mt: This disease can enter in a simple way with little or no symptoms, similar to lumphashi disease, like the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Masu nuna dan rashin lafiyar kan warke cikin sati biyu, sannan masu sananin cutar na iya daukan sati uku zuwa shida kafin warkewa.
en-mt: Those who are mildly allergic usually recover within two weeks, and those who are known to have the disease may take three to six weeks to recover.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Matan da ke da juna biyu na iya kasancewa cikin haɗari mafi girma ga kamuwa da cuta da COVID-19 dangane da bayanai daga wasu ƙwayoyin cuta masu kama da wannan, kamar SARS da MERS, amma bayanai don COVID-19 ba su da yawa. A cikin wasu mutane, COVID-19 na iya shafar huhun da ke haifar da cutar huhu.
en-mt: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, such as SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is scarce. In some people, COVID-19 can affect the lungs causing pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: A cikin wadanda cutar ta fi shafa, COVID-19 na iya ci gaba da hanzari zuwa cuta hanyoyin numfashi mai tsananin gajiyar alamar cutan (ARDS) (ARDS) wanda ke haifar da gazawar hanyoyin numfashi, girgiza septic ka gazawar gabobin jiki da yawa.
en-mt: In those most affected by the disease, COVID-19 can rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) which leads to respiratory failure, septic shock and multiple organ failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Wahalan da ke da alaka dai COVID-19 sun haɗa da sepsis, daskarewar jini wanda ba a ka’ida ba ne da lalacewar zuciya, koda da hanta.
en-mt: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal blood clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: Matsalan daskarewan jini, musamman karuwa na lokacin daskarewa. An bayyana cewa a kashi shida (6%) na wadanda aka shigar da su asibita da COVID-19, masu matsalan koda kuma suna kashi hudu (4%) na wannan rukuni.
en-mt: Blood clotting problems, especially increased clotting time. It was revealed that in six percent (6%) of those admitted to the hospital with COVID-19, those with kidney problems are also four percent (4%) of this group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Kimanin kashi 20-30% na mutanen da su ke da kwayar cutar COVID-19 suna nuna girman enzymes na hanta (Transaminases).
en-mt: About 20-30% of people with COVID-19 show elevated liver enzymes (Transaminases).
